loans.name: Nermin Group

texts.en:
Nermine is the featured borrower for Nermin Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Nermine is a 25-year-old single lady who got employed to cover her needs and expenses. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is still continuing her studies despite her limited income and low financial conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her university tuition fees.

Nermine hopes to finish her studies successfully which she considers a priority in her life. She is the first lady on the right. Najiba Loubna is the lady in the middle, and Nazek is the first on the left.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Nom

texts.en:
Nom 35 years old, lives in a rural area of Baribour District, KAMPONG CHHNANG Province, Cambodia. Nom has been working as a classical musician in his district. He has been involving in his business nearly 10 years. In total, he can make USD 5 per day.

He has decided to apply for a Kiva loan from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members. Through this loan, Nom hopes that it will help him to promote healthy living conditions.

Nom thanks lenders for the financial support .

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is aged 52, married to a farmer, and they're blessed with 2 children. She has managed a hog raising business in their village for almost 5 years. 

Last September 2015, she sold 2 hogs, and she earned a net income of PHP 16,000. Due to insufficient capital for her business, she would like to acquire a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase hogs to raise and a supply of hog feeds. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to grow profitably.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to raise and a supply of hog feeds.

loans.name: Bhabani Group

texts.en:
This group started in the year 2015 at Khairkhut village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. These are eight active, self-dependent women with an intention for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood.

All the members of concerned group have their own professions and businesses. Brundabati is one of them who has taken a great role for her development and the group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing at the middle with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 36 years old and living with her small family of her husband and two children.

Brundabati’s husband has been engaged in a cloth business for the last eight years. Brundabati is also helping him to promote the business. Through the concerned business, the family earns a monthly income of 7,800 INR. In Brundabati’s opinion, this small income is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to take a loan for the expansion of her business.

Brundabati planned to purchase a huge quantity of dress materials, saris and other cloth during the season. As the festival and marriage season is coming, Brundabati hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money to provide a better education to her children.

The other seven members of the group are also smart at their professions and also actively engaged with different professions like dairy, animal trading, a grocery shop, a betel shop and tailoring.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of dress materials, saris and other cloth.

loans.name: Nilakantha Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, 11 self-dependent women of Ghantabahali village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India, formed a group named Nilakantha. Their main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social livelihood by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Kumari is the most active and energetic lady of the concerned village and has taken the leadership to form a self-help group. The lady is aged about 39 years and is standing as the third person from left-hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and two children.

For the last four years Kumari has been engaged with a vegetable vending shop with the help and support of her husband. She earns monthly income of 7,200 INR from her occupation. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business through a loan.

She will purchase a huge quantity of vegetable items, like tomatoes, cauliflower, chilis, potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, cucumbers, etc., as per the demand of the customers from the nearest market. Through this, Kumari hopes that this will definitely generate a handsome amount of extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house.

The other 10 members of the group are also engaged themselves with different small businesses like vegetable vending, dairy, a general store, tailoring, a betel shop, animal trading, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of vegetable items like tomatoes, cauliflower, chilis, potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, cucumber, etc.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 43 ans, Akossiwa est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida. Avec trois enfants à charge, Akossiwa est une femme dynamique qui se bat pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants en revendant des fruits. Akossiwa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités d’oranges des régimes de bananes. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne revente, Akossiwa répondra favorablement aux besoins de ses clients puis avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 43-year-old married woman living in Baguida. With three children to take care of, she is a dynamic and hardworking woman who sells fruit in order to provide for her family. Akossiwa is requesting this loan so that she can purchase oranges and bananas. With the profits made from reselling her goods, Akossiwa will satisfy her customers' needs, become financially independent and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy oranges and bananas.

loans.name: Irada

texts.en:
Irada is 50 years old, married and has two children. One of them is married and the other is studying second course at technical college. Her husband is a schoolmaster. She lives with her family in the Baku region. She is a hardworking woman and cooks national Azerbaijan dishes. Those dishes are delicious and of good quality.

Irada has applied to the Komak company and she needs a loan in the amount of 2300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this amount she is planning to repair her kitchen. She is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Her two children are in school, while one is working. Adelina’s husband is a caregiver in other country. With her aspiration to help her husband to uplift their living, Adelina engage herself in food vending business. Adelina is selling street foods for eight years. She is receiving monthly remittance from her husband but she uses it to improve their house, and some of it for her children needs in school.

Adelina wants to expand her business. She is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy raw meat, ingredients and materials use in her food vending business. Adelina will use her earnings to support her children's other needs for their studies.

loans.use: to buy raw meat, ingredients and materials used in her food vending business.

loans.name: Majnun

texts.en:
Majnun fifteen years ago start working as a farmer for crop-growing in the agricultural sphere. Her husband is a farmer and they have five adult children. She is a very kind and responsible woman. She is successful working in an agricultural sphere and has a good experience in this sphere. Majnun raised her children from her agricultural gain. She works with her husband and her daughters in law help in her activity.

She wants to enlarge her agriculture business by sowing crops for the new season, so she needs the money. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somony to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. She awaits your support and your help to reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season .

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ayuba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Ayuba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ayuba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is married with five adult children and lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin , Misamis Occidental with her family. 

She has been engaged in a charcoal sales business as a way of earning an income while her husband engages in farming activities. For many years, she has been able to sustain her family's daily living. 

Marcelina has successfully repaid her previous loan, used for labor costs. She wants to gain more income. She is requesting a new loan of 25,000.00 to buy additional coconut shells to turn into charcoal to resell. She hopes to be able to buy an additional hectare of land for her coconut production.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconut shells.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a third year student at the university majoring in Mathematics. He is 25 years old who ‎lives with his family in a rural area that falls under Al Mafraq, which was affected by the Syrian ‎crises. ‎

Being one of a family of 9 members family who is supported by only their father from working as a driver, in ‎addition to his retirement salary, now Ayman is requesting a loan in order to help in paying his ‎upcoming semester fees.‎

loans.use: in order to help pay his ‎upcoming semester fees in Mathematics

loans.name: La Concepción Group

texts.es: El grupo la concepción, lo integran 3 personas  ejemplos de emprenderismo y lucha todo por el bienestar económicos de sus familias y de ellas mismas. Coordinado por Alma, de 52 años, responsable de un hijo, tiene una venta calzado desde hace 25 años con el dinero que le presto un familiar.  El crédito lo requiere para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos de vestir, zapatos colegial de mujer, sandalias y zapatillas. Con esto está segura de que podrá mejorar su situación económica, y podrá ofrecer más variedad. Las demás socias son Gladis, de 30 años, se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, venta de enchiladas y sandiwch. Darío, se dedica a la venta de taller de zapatería donde elaborar sandalias bajas y altas para damas.
texts.en:
The group La Concepción is comprised of three people who are examples of entrepreneurial spirit and who fight for the economic well being of their families. Alma is their coordinator. She is 52 years old, responsible for one child, and has a shoe sales business she has run for 25 years thanks to the initial investment from a friend.
The loan she is asking for today will be used to purchase dress shoes, women's school uniform shoes, sandals, and slippers. With new stock, she will be able to improve her economic situation and to be able to offer more variety to her customers. Her other associates are Gladis, who is 30 years old and sells sodas, enchiladas and sandwiches and Darío, who is a cobbler who makes flat and high heeled sandals for women.

loans.use: purchase dress shoes, women's school uniform shoes, sandals and slippers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter lives in Masindi-Uganda. He earns a salary where he is able to get income for looking after his family. Seven years ago he was inspired to serve his people so started as a sales person. Peter is a hardworking man who aims at building for his family a dream house but the money he has at hand is not enough. He is seeking for a loan facility to buy building materials like bricks to build his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like bricks to build his house.

loans.name: Betris

texts.en:
Betris is in agriculture. She plants vegetables and various peanuts. When the vegetables are ready, she brings them to the market to sell. 

She  started planting vegetables in 2000 with her own working capital of $250.00. Now she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business. Every day, her life is planting vegetables because she earns a good income from it. 

She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more manure, other  vegetable seeds, pumpkin seeds and other things to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy more manure, other vegetable seeds, pumpkin seeds  and other things.

loans.name: Nile High Luuka School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Gideon. He is the Principal of Nile High School Luuka, a mixed School in the rural area of Luuka in with 1700 students. Nile High School Luuka has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining UV water and Tulip filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of their budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing two water filtration systems will therefore save the schools money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV and Tulip Filtration water treatment systems with 750 litre tank and 5 Sets of 20 Litre Buckets, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Nile High School Luuka will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Gideon ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. .

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old and farmer. She’s married and has 2 children. She lives in a humble house in a rural town called Lita, northern of Ecuador. This area is characterized as predominantly agricultural and has very rich lands.

The agriculture is her principal family’s income. Her husband works for a mining company called “Exploraciones Novomining” hence he works all the week in the field and weekends goes back home. So Maria has to take care the crops and educated the children. The agriculture has let her to improve his family life. She works in the agriculture since she was 15 so she has good experience working in that activity.
The loan will allow her to buy naranjilla plant to start a new plot, fertilizers and pay labor to fumigate the ground. Maria will appreciated your help.

loans.use: The loan will allow her to buy naranjilla plant to start a new plot, fertilizers and pay labor to fumigate the ground

loans.name: Maira Ana

texts.es: Maira de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 2 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas e inicio con capital propio, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maira, 36, lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She has worked in the production and sale of tortillas for two years and she began with her own resources. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase corn for quintals and lime powder so she can continue with the production of tortillas and thus can have a better income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn for quintals and lime powder.

loans.name: Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es: Lissette conforma el grupo Rosa de Saron, ella tiene 32 años, unida y con 3 hijos,  se dedica a la venta de calzado y ropa usada de manera ambulante, este negocio lo inicio con ayuda de su esposo. El crédito que solicita para la compra de de paca mixta (variedades de blusas, camisas, pantalones, shores para mujeres y varones y comprara zapatos mixtos de segunda mano.Las otras socias son María, de 67 años dedicada a la venta de nacatamales, en su domicilio. Francys de 36 años, dedicada a la venta de calzado y ropa, y Yisela quien a los 37 años se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Lissette belongs to the group Rosa de Saron (Rose of Sharon). She is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She makes a living by selling used clothes and second hand footwear as a street vendor. She began this business with the help of her husband. The loan will be used to purchase a mixed pack of used clothing such as blouses, shirts, pants, and shorts for men and women as well as second hand footwear.
The other members of the group are Maria, who is 67 years old and sells nacatamales (food), Francys who is 36 years old and sells clothing and shoes and Yisela who is 37 years old and sells clothing and cosmetics.

loans.use: purchase mixed pack of clothing items such as blouses, shirts, pants and shorts for men and women as well as second hand footwear.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Adriana es una joven docente que desea llevar a cabo su proyecto de realizar reparaciones en su vivienda. Solicita un préstamo de seiscientos mil colones (₡ 600 000), para la compra de materiales de construcción, entre estos, cerámica y pintura que le permitan realizar las reparaciones necesarias en su vivienda.
texts.en: Adriana is a young teacher who wants to finish her goal of repairing her home. The loan she is asking for will be used to purchase construction materials such as ceramics and paints in order to finish the necessary repairs to her home.

loans.use: purchase construction material to improve her home.

loans.name: Koeurn's Group

texts.en:
Koeurn, 46, is a mother of four children living in Kampong Cham province. To support her living condition, she grows rice and rubber plants, and works for others for a fee to supplement her income.

Koeurn's rice field was destroyed by insect so her rice does not grow well. She has been involved this business for 28 years. This is her second loan cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) while the other one in her group is the sixth loan and she has fully repaid back her past loans as well. With her past loan, she has made a good income to improve her family’s living to better than before.

In a group of two members, Koeurn is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to support on her rice farming. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle and make her farming bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto earns a living by being a tailor. He caters services like dressmaking, dress adjustments and other related services. He is 65-year old single man who resides in Tagbilaran City, Bohol.

Dressmaking is in demand in his place, that's why Jacinto would like to acquire the materials needed to become more productive.

Jacinto join Kiva's field partner CEVI to access loans. He wants to purchase a new sewing machine, fabric, and sewing needles. In that way, his financial income will slowly improved. He would also be able to cope with demands and increase his profitability.

Jacinto is grateful to KIva for the continued support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine & sewing supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth Guadalupe

texts.es: Elizabeth es una mujer de 37 años, madre soltera de dos hijos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante; la venta de ropa, calzado y cosméticos es la principal fuente de ingresos de su familia, es por eso que Elizabeth está muy interesada en seguir invirtiendo en ello. En el pasado Elizabeth ha sido beneficiada con créditos, los cuales le han permitido, comprar artículos varios para vender, y algunos electrodomésticos para uso personal. Este nuevo crédito que solicita, lo requiere para la compra de sandalias, zapatos y blusas para vender en la época navideña, de la cual espera obtener jugosas ganancias, sin embargo, ella afirma que este no es el último crédito que solicitará, ya que, necesitará de otro crédito en el futuro para continuar con su negocio y de esta manera garantizarle la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 37-year-old woman and single mother of two children, and she is very eager to get ahead in life. The sale of clothing, footwear and cosmetics is the main source of income for her family, and this is why Elizabeth is very interested in continuing to invest in it. In the past, Elizabeth has benefitted from loans, which have permitted her to purchase various articles for sale and some electrical appliances for personal use. 

She requires the new loan that she is requesting to purchase sandals, footwear and blouses to sell during the Christmas holiday, from which she hopes to earn a substantial profit. Nevertheless, she states that this is not the last loan that she will request, as she will need another loan in the future to continue with her business and in this way guarantee her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase sandals, shoes and blouses.

loans.name: Srey Hean's Group

texts.en:
Srey Hean is a young mother of a small child residing in Kampong Cham province. She is 29 years old. She earns a living via growing rice and rubber plants, and working for other to get a fee. She has been doing this for around eleven years.

Unfortunately, Srey Hean's crop has grown not well since it was threatened by weed. To save her business, she is now leading a group of two to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund. She will to use her loan portion to buy seeds and herbicide to protect her crop so it can grow well. This will be the second loan cycle for her group, which contain two members.

Srey Hean hopes to earn more income to save for future need and able to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and herbicides.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina lives in Maubesse and she is a business woman. She has been involved in business activities since a 2001 using her own working capital and she does her best with it. She has a very high interest in doing business.

Marcelina has a bigger store but she is still requesting this loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business. So she takes a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more additional items to keep in her store, including shampoo, detergent, candy, tea, rice, coffee, sugar, noodles and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Ang

texts.en:
Ang is a farmer and is 36 years old. She lives in a community in the Bakan District of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has three children who are enrolling in school right now. To make a living, she has been involved in the farming sector for nearly 10 years. Her husband is also farmer. Both of them can earn net profit of 10 USD per day.

Due to the shortage of funds and difficulty of finding a latrine, Ang would like to apply a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake for her family members. Through this loan she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help lessen environmental deterioration. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support and for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Karla Group

texts.es: El grupo Karla lo conforman mujeres quienes son duelas de sus negocios y mujer ejemplos de lucha y superación, coordinados por Karla, de 35 años, soltera y con 3 hijos a su responsabilidad. Es dueña de su propia sala de belleza, quien se encuentra dichosa de ofrecer este servicio a su amada clientela. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de queratinas, vitaminas, tintes, permanentes, peróxidos, blondo y pinturas de uñas. Con esto tendrá mayores productos para el embellecimiento de sus clientas. Las demás socias son Martha, de 43 años dedicada a la venta de verduras y leche de manera ambulante. María de 46 años quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The Karla Group, coordinated by 35-year-old Karla who is single and responsible for her three children, is made up of women business owners who are examples of women who struggle and overcome. 

It's her dream to have her own beauty salon where she is delighted to offer services to her beloved customers. The loan that she is requesting is to buy keratin, vitamins, hair dye, perms, peroxide, hair lightener, and fingernail polish. With these, she will have better products to beautify her clients. 

The other group members are 43-year-old Martha who makes a living selling vegetables and milk as a street vendor. Forty-six-year-old Maria makes a living selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy keratin, vitamins, hair dye, perms, peroxide, hair lightener, and fingernail polish.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun is 56 years old and resides in Takeo province. She is a widowed mother of four dependent children who are all in school. To make a living, she has been growing rice and selling grocery items for years. Her main challenge in growing rice is managing drops in the price of rice.

Sun is now seeking a loan from VisionFund to pay for tuition fees for her daughter to study accounting at a local university. She hopefully wants to see her daughter make a living by having a good paid job.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her daughter to study accounting at a local university.

loans.name: Edwin Horacio

texts.es: Don Edwin se desempeña en su propio taller de soldadura, actividad en la cual posee amplia experiencia. Solicita un préstamo de setecientos ochenta mil colones (₡ 780 000), para la compra de materiales, entre estos, material para soldadura, de tal forma que le permita realizar mayor cantidad de trabajos y mejorar los ingresos familiares provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en: Don Edwin works in his own soldering workshop, a trade which he has a lot of experience in. He is asking for a loan of seven hundred and eighty thousand colones (₡ 780 000) in order to buy supplies. Among these he would like equipment for soldering, allowing him to take on a greater amount of work and to improve the family income that comes from his business.

loans.use: to buy work supplies for soldering studio

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 20 años el cual esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia e inicio con capital propio, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Reina is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her two children. She has owned a business selling fruits and vegetables for 20 years. The business, located near her place of residence, was started with her own capital. With her earnings, she manages to pay some of her household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables so she can continue selling and therefore improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Chery Marchand Tailleur

texts.en:
Arthur is a tailor. He launched his own shop 10 years ago. His guiding spirit mixed together with a sense of responsibility are pushing him toward success. Arthur has successfully repaid his first loan. Thanks to that, he acquired new machines and Arthur created two jobs last year. As a result, his economic conditions have improved and his family have become more involved in the shop.

Today, Arthur has a new objective. He plans to achieve a commercial objective of about 22% of net profit next year. This loan request is to fill his stock of fabrics. He also wants to purchase thread, zippers, and buttons in bulk to retail to very small workers. That will increase his sales in tailoring services. Moreover, he plans to hire two new people to sew for him.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and sewing materials for more tailoring services

loans.name: Prester

texts.en:
Thanks to the first loan that Prester received, he has acquired two new machines. He also has a second workspace for three new workers. On a personal note, Prester, like other Zafen borrowers, has become more efficient in time and sales management, thanks to the basic marketing training he received.

Today, his shop has secured two contracts that represent 40% of his sales. He wants to buy more fabrics to respect his orders for limited time and to penetrate some local market segments. As for expected impact: he will be able to hire one woman to retail for him. There will be a second high season for Prester's economic sector between the end of December till February 2016.

loans.use: To buy fabrics in order to prepare some orders

loans.name: Min

texts.en:
Min is a local resident of Battambang province, in Cambodia.  He is 57 years old and a father of six children, only two of them are dependent children.  For 10 years he has made a living rice farming, working on other farms for a fee.  The low price of his rice crop in the market is the main challenge for him. 

This is Min's first loan cycle, he has never borrowed with VisionFund before.  He will use his entire loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pay for plowing fees for his farmland.  He hopes that his farming will gain him high yields so he will have the ability to renovate his old house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pay for plowing fees for his farmland.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman and has five children. She is 40 years old, and resides at Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.

Margie owns and operates a farm. She has been in this business for many years. Planting and harvesting vegetables and bananas, as well as coconuts, earns her a living. Each month she earns 20,000 PHP over all. She requested a loan of 52,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, young crops to raise, and organic fertilizer.

Margie has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and she wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Abubaker

texts.en:
Abubaker lives in Masindi, Uganda. He sells hides and skins as his major business activity. He is also involved in a transport business as an additional source of income. He started the business in 2009 so as to get money to meet increasing family needs. He hopes to educate his children and expand his business though inadequate capital blocks him from achieving his dream.

Abubaker needs a loan to buy hides and skins.

loans.use: to buy hides and skins.

loans.name: Heytel Giordano

texts.es: Heytel es un agricultor de 25 años con grandes aspiraciones en su vida, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de plátano, los cuales espera en un futuro no muy lejano, poder exportarlo hacia los Estados Unidos, por el momento, Heytel solicita un préstamo para comprar urea y diesel productos que son necesarios para el cultivo y para el riego del verano, en el futuro Heytel espera adquirir un sistema de microaspersores que le permitan mejorar la calidad de su cultivo.
texts.en: Heytel is a 25 year old farmer with great aspirations in life. For 5 years he has been working growing and harvesting bananas which he hopes in the near future to export to the United States. For the moment he is requesting a loan to buy urea and diesel fuel, products which he needs for his crops and for irrigating in the summer. In the future Heytel hopes to acquire a micro- sprinkler system which would allow him to improve the quality of his crops.

loans.use: to buy urea and diesel.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 4 años, posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito pero en esta ocasion es para mejorar el local donde tiene su negocio y poder comprar los materiales de construccion necesarios para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y asi continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: This young woman, whose face we have blurred as she is 29 years old and lives in a dangerous area, has had a mill for making boiled corn located in her home for the past four years. She has many customers and with what she earns from her business she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She lives in her own house with her life-partner. She is asking for another loan, this time in order to improve the premises where she has her business and also to be able to purchase building supplies necessary to take care of her customers better and continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy necessary building supplies

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is from Tagbilaran City. He is 46 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. He is a fish vendor. He sells fresh fish to the locals in his area. In addition, he also raises hogs to earn a living. His income goes for food and school expenses.

Eduardo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

He is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to buy more supplies of fish and pig feed.

Eduardo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy fish and pig feed.

loans.name: Darciana

texts.en:
Darciana is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent, coffee, snacks, and soft and hard drinks.

Darciana opened her kiosk in 2002 with her own working capital of $400. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, detergent, coffee, snacks, and soft and hard drinks.

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jonna works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Jonna is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities with her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 49 years old and the mother of four children. She lives in her own house with her spouse in the area of Multan, Pakistan. For several years her husband has been running a small shop selling dry fruits. The shop is located in their place of residence. He sells all kinds of dry fruits. With what he makes from his sales, he manages to make ends meet and cover household expenses.

Farzana is asking once again for a loan to purchase dry fruits such as grams, coconut, peaches, peanuts and dry grapes, etc., to be able to stock her husband’s shop and have better revenue. Farzana and her family will be thankful to the KIVA lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy dry fruits for her husband's shop

loans.name: Jalou

texts.en:
Jalou is 25 years old and married with two children. Both of them are still in school, and Jalou works very hard to provide for them.

Jalou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 4,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to buy groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo, bread and other personal care products.

Jalou has been in this business for five years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy groceries items

loans.name: Sajida Parveen

texts.en:
Sajida is a 41 year-old widow living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. She is a responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. She has been running an embroidery business for 15 years to meet the family’s expenses. Her embroidery business is very famous in the colony, and that is the reason her business runs well. Due to good relations her business has increased. She is a brave woman.

Sajida wishes to buy materials such as hand embroidery kits, ribbons, needles and an embroidery machine from the market. At the moment, another person handles her transactions with her customers. Sajida has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn a better profit for her family. She has become an expert in the embroidery business. So, Sajida asked for a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

She also wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why she wants to buy threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colours in advance, to have them in stock. She requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not have sufficient cash in hand.

Therefore, Sajida humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, she will be able to buy the threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colours that she needs.
Sajida and her family will be thankful to Kiva, lender’s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping her by funding this loan to improve her living standards.
.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for her business

loans.name: Zenona

texts.en:
Zenona is a 49-year-old mother and wife from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She makes the most of her time at home with the use of her mobile phone. Standing next to her tarpaulins, Zenona shared that she has been selling prepaid electronic top-up loads to cellphone users. She is also engaged in buying and selling bananas for additional income.

Zenona is asking for a loan to buy more electronic top-up and bananas to sell. She aims to show that she can also help her spouse in raising their children through these businesses.

loans.use: to buy electronic top-up loads for cellphones and bananas.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una panaderia ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis is 31 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He owns a bakery which has been located at his home for two years. He has many customers due to the quality with which he prepares his bread, and with the money he makes from his business he manages to keep on top of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan in order to buy flour, sugar, flavoured jellies and moulds etc. to be able to continue with his business and thus receive a greater income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, flavoured jellies, moulds, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, an entrepreneur, has owned a small grocery store in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She and her family have lived in this place for a long time now. Usually attached to one's home, the small grocery store is called a "sari-sari," which means variety.

Susana's business consists of selling vinegar, soy sauce, corn starch, sugar, milk, milo sachets, powdered detergent, coffee, matches, canned corned beef, beef loaves, sardines, creamer and shampoo. The business is the source of her daily income.

Susana needs to make further investments in her store, however, she lacks the funds to do so because of her children's school fees. She is requesting a loan to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned food, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, candies, chips, detergent, sugar and seasonings. With the loan, Susana will be able to augment her stock to attract more customers, thus giving her the chance of increasing her sales.

Susana hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable. The income generated will pay for the school fees of her children who are nine, twelve and fourteen years old.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned food, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, candies, chips, detergent, sugar and seasonings.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo es un productor de granos básicos, y además dueño de una pulpería que está ubicada en su casa, es padre de dos hijos, ambos menores de edad los cuales dependen de él. En el pasado Jairo ha sido beneficiado con créditos, los cuales utilizó para la compra de productos agrícolas y compra de productos como maíz, café, azúcar, entre otros. Este nuevo préstamo que Jairo solicita lo requiere para invertir en su venta, comprar productos de plástico, aluminio y acero, con los cuales espera mejorar sus ganancias en esta época navideña. En el futuro Jairo espera seguir obteniendo nuevos créditos para seguir agrandando su negocio y mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en: Jario produces dry grains and is also the owner of a small grocery store which is located in his house. He is the father of two young children who both depend on him. In the past Jairo has received other loans, which he has used to buy agricultural products and also products such as maize, coffee, sugar, and more. This new loan that Jairo is asking for will be used to invest in his store and to buy plastic, aluminium and steel products, with which he hopes to increase his profits during this Christmas period. In the future Jairo hopes to continue receiving new loans in order to keep enjoying his business and improving his home.

loans.use: to buy plastic, aluminium and steel products

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Vilma, de 57 años, unida, ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y muy trabajadora, siendo fiel cliente renovando nuevamente su crédito para el mejoramientos de sus diversas actividades económicas como es la venta de ropa, cosméticos, destace de cerdo, nacatamales, y recargas. Con la ayuda de su esposo ha podido establecerlos. Ahora el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de 4 cerdos, gaseosas, granos básicos (como arroz, aceite, azúcar) y sopas maggy.
texts.en: Vilma, 57 years old and married, has demonstrated herself to be a responsible and very hardworking person.  Being a loyal client, she renewed her loan for the betterment of her diverse economic activities such as the sale of clothing, cosmetics, butchered pork, nacatamales (corn, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf), and chargers.  She has been able to start them with her husband's help.  Now, she will invest the loan in the purchase of four pigs, soft drinks, staples (like rice, oil, sugar), and Maggi soups.

loans.use: to buy four pigs, soft drinks, staples (like rice, oil, sugar), and Maggi soups.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes thanks Kiva and CCT for their untiring financial and moral support for her livelihood. She has received a number of loans that certainly helped for a productive harvest of pineapples on her farm, and thus, funded her household needs.

To sustain and grow her harvest, Gertrudes is again seeking assistance in the amount of 15,000 PHP to pay for more seedlings, fertilizer and labor. Although her farm suffers when hit by typhoons, she still maintains her faith that better days are ahead. Gertrudes has been a hardworking woman and believes that the fruits of her labor shall sustain her family.

Gertrudes has a simple prayer that God will crown her efforts with a productive harvest and bless her family with abundance. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more to pay for more seedlings, fertilizer and labor to increase crop yields on her farm.

loans.name: Bustonoy

texts.en:
Bustonoy was born in 1975. She is married and has 2 children. Bustonoy’s husband is a master at repairing houses.

She always wanted to start own business and in this way to get ahead. Bustonoy is going to start a business sewing Kurpachas, the national mattress. She learnt to sew kurpacha from her mother and now this craft will be the source of her family income. She will sew mattresses in her house.

Bustonoy took part in a Women's Organization course “To Get Ahead” and got her certificate. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 TJS to buy fabrics for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for organizing new business sewing kurpachas.

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia is a 52-year-old farmer from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She tends to her garden where she grows vegetables such as okra (lady's fingers), water spinach and pechay (bok choy). She works hard even in the presence of uncertainty.

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable garden. Once she harvets her vegetables, Vergenia will be able to provide food for the family and extra income for other household expenses.

Vergenia hopes to consistently build her business to make it more successful for her family. She has two children aged 18 and 19.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a mother of four children. Being a widow, she worries for the future of her children. Thelma is very thankful because, with her income, she is able to send her children to school and all of them finish college.

Thelma is engaged in retailing, buying and selling fruit and vegetables. To increase her income, Thelma also engages in the livestock business. She has a mother pig to produce piglets. Due to insufficient funds, Thelma is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs and piglets.

The loan will be a big help for her to maintain the business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, and vaccines for her hogs and piglets.

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Group

texts.en:
This group was formed in the year 2015 at Labanipur village in the Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are eight active independent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses.

Dharitri is one of the members who has taken a great role for her development and for the group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing in the front row on the extreme right with her hand raised in the photo. She is about 24 years old and living with her small family consisting of her husband and two sons.

Her family has been engaged in dairy for the last four years. The complete family together promotes their business. Through this business, they earn a monthly income of 9,000 INR. Dharitri plans to improve her business over the course of the loan. It will be the first loan for the group. With the loan, Dharitri will purchase another two cows. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for her future needs.

The other seven members of her group are also smart at their professions and actively engaged in different businesses like vegetable vending, a grocery shop, a rice business, tailoring, cosmetics and a fancy store, a seasonal business and a cloth store. With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase another two cows.

loans.name: Safia Group

texts.en:
Safia is a 25-year-old married woman living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children, one of whom attends school. In the photo, Safia is the lady who has her hand raised; the other lady is Kousar.

Safia's husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. She has been running an embroidery business for the past seven years to help her husband meet the household expenses. Her embroidery business is very famous in the area, and that is the reason her business runs well. Because of good customer relations, her business has increased.

Safia wants to buy embroidery raw materials such as hand embroidery kits, ribbon, needles, and an embroidery machine from the market. Safia has requested a loan to buy raw materials from the market.

She wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. She wants to buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colours to have in stock. She requires some capital to buy the desired items because she does not have sufficient cash on hand.

Safia humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, she will be able to buy the thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colours that she needs.

Safia and her family will be thankful to Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them to improve their living standard by funding this loan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos desde hace 6 años, comercializa sus productos en los peublos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presenatn en su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man whose face is blurred (for being 25 years old and living in a high-risk area) has worked cultivating basic staples since the age of six.  He sells his products in the adjacent towns, and settles household expenses with the profits earned.  The young man lives in his own house with his life partner and with his daughter.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land (shown in the photograph) to be able to continue farming, now that it is the only source of work, and in this way have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella posee un negocio de venta de comida desde hace 6 años y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en: Sonia is 50 years old and lives in her own house with her daughter. She has had a business selling food for 6 years. With her earnings, she has succeeded in covering some household expenses. She wants to improve her home by changing the roof, but as she does not have enough capital, she is requesting a loan to buy metal sheets and poles and to pay workers. Thus, she will be able to have a safer home.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and poles and to workers.

loans.name: Sambhunath Group

texts.en:
This group was started in the year 2015 at Udepur village in the Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are nine active independent women, with an intention of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses.

Ranju is one of the members who has taken a great role in her development and the group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing fourth from the right with her hand raised in the photo. She is about 26 years old and living with her small family, her husband and two children.

Ranju’s husband has been engaged in a clothing business for the last eight years. Ranju is also helping him to promote the business. Through the concerned business, the family earns a monthly income of 9,800 INR. In Ranju’s opinion, this small income is very difficult to maintain the family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to avail loans for the expansion of her business.

Ranju plans to purchase a huge quantity of dress materials, sarees and ready-made clothing during the season. As the Festival and Marriage season is coming, Ranju hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money to provide a better education to her children.

The other eight members of the group are also smart at their professions and actively engaged in different professions like dairy, animal trading, a grocery shop, a betel shop and a tailoring business.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of dress materials, sarees and ready made clothing.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic, age 38, is married to a carpenter, and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in her village for almost four years and earns a net income of PHP 800 daily. Her net income from her business is usually spent on her family's daily expenses at home and the school allowances of her children. Due to insufficient capital for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase canned goods, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will grow profitably and improve more.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: Maria de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee desde hace 19 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gasto de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old and lives in her own home with her partner. For 19 years, she has had a small store in her home. She has many clients because of her good price and kindness with selling. With her earnings from her sales, she succeeds in covering some household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, sodas, sweets, sweet bread, etc. Thus, she will be able to have more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, sodas, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla, de 38 años de edad, soltera y con un hijo a su responsabilidad, se dedica a preparación y venta de comidas como carne asada, pollo y enchiladas, pero también tiene una pequeña librería donde ofrece artículos escolares, por segunda vez solicita crédito para el financiamiento de sus actividades económicas e invertirá en la compra de carne, pollo, carbón, plátano, vinagre, zanahorias, colonia, talcos, bolsas para regalos y retrateras. Así podrá aumentar sus ganancias y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Karla is 38 years old, single and she has one son under her responsibility. She makes a living cooking and selling food such as roasted meat, chicken and enchiladas, and she also owns a little library where she sells school supplies.

This is the second time she is requesting a loan to finance her economic activities. She will invest it in buying beef, chicken, coal, bananas, vinegar, carrots, perfume, talcum powder, gift bags and picture frames. She will be able to increase her earnings in this way and to improve her life conditions.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, coal, bananas, vinegar, carrots, perfume, talcum powder, gift bags and picture frames.

loans.name: Fátima

texts.es: Fátima se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene amplia experiencia en ofrecer diversidad de prendas a sus clientes. Solicita un préstamo de trescientos veinticinco mil colones(₡ 325 000), para la compra de más prendas, esto con el fin de poder ofrecer a sus clientes mayor diversidad y aumentar su participación en el mercado.
texts.en: Fátima works selling clothing.  She has ample experience offering diverse garments to her clients.  She is requesting a loan of ₡ 325,000 to buy more garments with the end goal of being able to offer her clients better variety and increase her market participation.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Meera Group

texts.en:
Meera Group formed in the year 2015 at Titlagarh village, of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. These are 11 active, self-dependent women with an objective for developing their existing businesses, as well as their livelihood.

All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses. Saraswati is one of them who has taken a great role for her development and the group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing and is the second person from the left-hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 39 years old and is living with her small family, consisting of her husband and two children.

Her family has been engaged with a furniture making and selling business at Titlagarh village for the last eight years. The complete family together promotes their business. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 8,800 INR. Her opinion is that income is not sufficient to maintain her family, and hence, there is almost zero surplus at the end of the month.

She plans to improve her business in the course of loan, with which she will purchase wood, some mechanical equipment and some ready-made furniture like sofa sets. Saraswati hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for the purchase of a house and to provide better education to her children.

The other 10 members of her group are also smart at their professions and are also actively engaged with different businesses like dairy, a tea and tiffin stall, a grocery shop, a betel shop, fancy cosmetics shop, etc. With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase wood, some mechanical equipment and some ready-made furniture like sofa sets.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is 58 years old and separated with two children. To earn a living, she owns and operates a transportation rental business. She earns a good income from this and is able to sustain her daily needs.

With the income from her previous loan, her business was successful. She will use a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle used in the business. She is hopeful to gain more revenue from the business, and to be able to provide the educational costs for her children.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Kranti Group

texts.en:
This group formed in the year 2015 at Ghantasahada village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. These are 12 active, self-dependent women with an objective for developing their existing businesses, as well as their livelihoods.

Sulochana is one of them who has taken a great role for her development and for her group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing second from the right with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 37 years old and living with her husband and only son.

Sulochana and her husband have been engaged with a tea and tiffin (snacks) stall business for the last four years. Through the concerned business they earn a monthly income of 8,500 INR. Sulochana plans to improve her business in the course of loan. She will purchase necessary utensils, four chairs, a gas stove, and rice, wheat, oil, etc. She hopes to get more income through the expansion of her business. From that, Sulochana will save more for her future needs.

The other 11 members of her group are also smart at their professions and are also actively engaged with different businesses like vegetable vending, tailoring, fancy and cosmetics shop, the cloth business, a grocery shop, dairy, etc. With this loan, they all hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase necessary utensils, four chairs, a gas stove, and rice, wheat, oil, etc.

loans.name: Jagannath Group

texts.en:
This group started in the year 2015 at Rigdul village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. These are 12 active, self-dependent women with an intention for developing their existing businesses, as well as their livelihood.

All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses. Rita is one of them who has taken a great role for her development and her group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing third from the right with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 45 years old and is living with her small family of her husband and three children.

Rita’s husband has been engaged in a cloth business for the last eight years. Rita is also helping him to promote the business. Through the concerned business, the family earns a monthly income of 8,800 INR. In Rita’s opinion, this small income is very difficult to maintain the family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to take a loan for the expansion of her business.

Rita plans to purchase a huge quantity of dress materials, saris and other ready-made cloth during the season. As the festival and marriage season is coming, Rita hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money to provide a better education to her children.

The other 11 members of the group are also smart at their professions and are also actively engaged with different professions like dairy, vegetable vending, a grocery shop, a betel shop and tailoring.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of dress materials, saris and other ready-made cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la siembra de maiz, frijol, yuca y hortalizas y vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y gracias a su trabajo es como puede salir adelante, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman (whose face is blurred for being 24 years old and living in a high-risk area) has worked since she was five years old, planting corn, beans, yuca, and hortaliza (a vegetable).  She sells her products in the adjacent towns.  She is able to move forward thanks to this work.  The young woman is a single mother and she lives in her own house with her son.  She is requesting a loan  to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc., and to improve the land shown in the photograph in order to continue farming now that it is her sole source of work, and in this way have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Danys Del Carmen

texts.es: Una pulpería y la siembra de plátano son las principales fuentes de ingreso de Danys, una mujer de 44 años con grandes aspiraciones para sus negocios. Durante 5 años ha trabajado en la pulpería, sin embargo, la siembra de plátano es un negocio relativamente nuevo para ella, ya que, apenas inició con ello hace un año. El crédito que Danys solicita, lo requiere para comprar diversos productos para la pulpería y la platanera, las cuales espera seguir viendo crecer. Sus planes a futuro son, tener una pulpería muy bien surtida y comercializar sus plátanos con el vecino país de Honduras.
texts.en: A grocery store and banana cultivation are the principal sources of income for Danys, a 44 year old woman with grand aspirations for her businesses. For five years she's worked at the grocery store, but the planting of bananas is a relatively new venture for her, something she started only one year ago. The loan Danys is requesting she requires to purchase various products for the grocery store and banana plantation, that she hopes will continue to grow. Her plans for the future are to have a well stocked grocery store and to sell her bananas to neighboring Honduras.

loans.use: to purchase various products for a grocery store and banana plantation.

loans.name: Priscus

texts.en:
Priscus, who is in his early 30s, is married with one schooling child. He has been running a retail shop which sells home appliances for five years. He works from 7 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Priscus requested his sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to restock the out-of-stock items. He used the previous loans to increase the home appliances products and was able to pay back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, repay loans, reinvest in his business, and renovate his house. He dreams of expanding his business so it can cover different areas. Priscus will be accountable for paying back the loan per the schedule.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: When he was a young man, Ernesto learned farming activities from his parents. He is now 61 years of age and still managing his 1.5 hectare farm. Ernesto grows rice in their field. He and his wife are working together to do some of their farm activities to minimize their cost of labor. Ernesto wishes for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy fuel, diesel, and fertilizers for his farming needs. Ernesto hopes to sustain all his farming needs so that he can grow his rice crop well and get a greater yield.

loans.use: to buy fuel, diesel, and fertilizers for his farming needs.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
While managing her family farm, Jesusa thought of another source of income. This way, she can earn daily profit. She came up on a decision to put up a sari-sari store business in their village. Jesusa is now 39 years old and has run her retailing business for three years. Through her income, she is able to provide her two children allowances to go to school to attend their classes. 

In line with her business, Jesusa wants to extend the products she is selling because some of the items her costumers want to buy are still not available in her store. Hence, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy grocery items to sell. Jesusa hopes to sell more items and gain bigger income as well.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Zoleida

texts.es: Zoleida es una mujer muy esforzada que labora en su propio negocio en el cual ofrece diversidad de productos, entre estos, productos alimenticios y de limpieza a sus clientes. Solicita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil clones (₡ 1 050 000), dinero que usará para la compra de estos productos, con lo cual podrá incrementar su nivel de inventario y aumentar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en: Zoleida is a hardworking woman who works in her own business in which she offers her clients diverse products, among them, food products and cleaning products.  She is requesting a loan of ₡ 1,050,000, money that she will use to buy these products with which she will be able to increase her inventory level and raise her business's sales.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis, de 29 años,  unido, y tiene un hijo de 4 años a su responsabilidad se dedica a la venta de perecederos, y por primera vez solicita crédito a ADIM y a los miembros de KIVA para su desarrollo, e invertirá en la compra de plátanos de calidad y plátanos de baja calidad y otra parte para el combustible del cual utiliza para el transporte. Asi esta seguro que podrá aumentar su venta y sus ganancias mejoran para asi brindarle una mejor condición económica a familia.
texts.en: Luis is 29 years old, married, and has a 4-year-old son who is his responsibility. He is dedicated to selling perishable goods. For the time, he requests a loan from ADIM and from Kiva members for his development. He will invest in buying high-quality and low-quality bananas and fuel, which will be used for transportation. Thus, he is sure that he will be able to increase his sales and his earnings to improve and offer a better life to his family.

loans.use: to buy high-quality and low-quality bananas and fuel, which will be used for transportation.

loans.name: Ronaldo Jose

texts.es: Hace 15 años Ronaldo junto a sus hermanos incursionaron en el negocio del cultivo de plátano, actualmente trabaja solo, sin embargo eso no le ha impedido expandirse y crecer, ya que, según Ronaldo, llegan compradores desde Honduras y El Salvador a adquirir sus productos. El préstamo que Ronaldo solicita, lo requiere para invertir en su negocio, mediante la compra de productos agrícolas, los cuales son indispensables para todo agricultor.
texts.en: 15 years ago Ronald and his brothers ventured into the business of banana cultivation. He currently works alone, nevertheless this has not impeded him from growing and expanding, since buyers seek out Ronaldo coming from Honduras and El Salvador to acquire his products. The loan Ronaldo is requesting he requires to invest in his business through the purchase of agriculture products which indispensable to any agrarian.

loans.use: purchase agriculture products.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima lives in Oecusse and her business is computer rentals. She lives near many people, so she had an idea to open rentals for everybody so that, if they want to print a document, it should not be too far away. She has had her business since 2011 and she is earning a good income every day because many people come to print documents in her rental so she is very happy with her business. 

And now she is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger rental business in the future. She started to own working capital of $ 400.00. She is taking this loan because she wants used to buy paper, black and white ink, color ink, and other materials. She hopes with this loan, her business can improve in the future.

loans.use: to buy paper, black and white ink, color ink, and other materials.

loans.name: Saadani Group

texts.en:
Clara, who is in her early 60's, is widowed with three school-age children. She has been running a general store for five years now; she works from 7 AM to 7 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Clara's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase items in her general store and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is doing great now. She used the profit to pay for school fees, loan repayments, and house renovation. 

She will use this loan to increase her shop inventory to meet her customers' demands. She dreams of expanding her business. Clara will share this loan with her loan group "Saadani" which has two members who will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to increase shop inventory to meet her customers' demand

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en: Nodira is a kind and responsible woman. She was born in 1974. Nodira is married and has three children. She always tries to offer better living condition for her children. Nodira is going to start a new business and in this way, find a source of income. Nodira is going to open a bakery business. She will bake biscuits, rolls, and cakes and sell in the cafes of the local schools. She took part in the course “To Get Ahead” from a women's organization and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy flour, bread, sugar, etc. for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy flour, bread, sugar, etc. for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of two school-going kids. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are stock purchases in addition to food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour in a shop to the general public. She faces a major challenge of lack of working capital to run her business. Fatuma dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil to expand her current business.

She joined Yehu to have access to loans in order to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Manizha

texts.en:
Manizha is an ambitions woman. She lives with her family in the northern part of Tajikistan. Manizha is going to start a wedding dress salon business. She will give wedding dresses in hire for fiancées. Manizha will manage with business alone. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy wedding dresses for organizing new business.This loan will help to organize a business in Tajikistan and in this way, improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses for organizing new business

loans.name: Katia Joanna

texts.es:
Katia es una estudiante que solicita un préstamo para cubrir sus gastos educativos. Esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Katia, tengo 17 años de edad, resido con mi abuela paterna en el Ensanche Ozama en Santo Domingo.
Gracias a mi alto índice académico durante el bachiller fui favorecida con una beca de un 50% en la Universidad Iberoamericana (UNIBE), para poder realizar mis estudios superiores. No he empezado a cursar la carrera de Administración De Empresas, debido a que se me hace difícil costear el otro 50% restante de la matrícula. Si no recibiera este préstamo no podría iniciar mis estudios y por consiguiente, perdería el 50% de la beca otorgada. Si en caso contrario fuera favorecida con el préstamo cumpliría mis metas de convertirme en profesional y así no solo ayudar a mi familia a salir adelante, sino que también contribuiría con el desarrollo de mi país.
Mis metas académicas son: finalizar mi carrera con un alto índice académico como acostumbro y luego de finalizarla, poder insertarme en el mercado laboral de mi país. Seguiré estudiando para aprender más acerca de mi carrera en el sector público  y privado de mi país.
texts.en:
Katia is a student requesting a loan to cover her education costs. This is her story: 

My name is Katia, I'm 17 years old, and I live with my paternal grandmother in Ensanche Ozama in Santo Domingo. 

Thanks to my high GPA in high school, I was favored for a 50% scholarship at the Universidad Iberoamericana (UNIBE), to carry out my higher studies. I haven't begun pursuing a career of Business Administration, due to my difficulty paying the other 50% of the tuition. If I don't receive this loan I will not be able to start my studies and will lose the 50% scholarship.  On the other had, if I were given the loan, I would accomplish my goal of becoming a professional and thus would not only help my family move forward, but would also contribute to the development of my country. 

My academic goals are: finish my educational career with a high GPA, as I usually do, and then be able to enter the my country's workforce. I will continue studying to learn more about my career in the public and private sector of my country.

loans.use: To cover higher education expenses

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer independiente y muy trabajadora. Vive con su pareja con ha criado a su hijo de 15 años. Estudió la carrera técnica en belleza y otra en sistemas de recarga. Actualmente vive en el Estado de México en donde también tiene su negocio desde hace más de 12 años.
El negocio es una tienda de consumibles de cómputo que inició con la idea de cubrir una primera necesidad. Brinda servicios de compra y venta de  insumos para impresoras y computadoras, así como instalación de sistemas y reparación de electrónicos. Hace 12 años, Carolina tuvo la oportunidad de establecerse como un negocio fijo, sin embargo se dedica a esto desde años atrás.
Carolina siempre ha querido ver más próspero su negocio y por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar más mercancía con el fin de tener un mejor inventario y, de esta manera, poder incrementar sus ventas al dar mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su meta en el negocio es lograr un incremento en sus ganancias, lo que le brindará mayores beneficios en su vida profesional y personal.
texts.en:
Carolina is 34 years old. She is an independent and very hardworking woman. She lives with her partner with whom she has raised their 15-year-old child.
