She took technical courses in beauty and another in charging systems. She currently lives in the State of Mexico where she has had her business for more than 12 years.

Her business is a computer accessories store that she started with the idea of covering an initial need. She provides services buying and selling supplies for printers and computers as well as system installs and electronics repair. Twelve years ago, Carolina had the opportunity to establish a permanent business, however she had been working like this for years before.

Carolina has always wanted to see her business prosper more, and for this reason she is requesting a loan to be able to buy more products in order to have a better inventory and thus be able to increase her sales and provide better service to her customers. Her goal in the business is to achieve an increase in her earnings, which will bring her greater benefits in her professional and personal life.

loans.use: to buy more products in order to have a better inventory.

loans.name: Blanca Ruby

texts.es:
La Joven Blanca de 24  años de edad es soltera,  no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su papa, en casa propia en una comunidad de San Lorenzo,  valle al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 02 años  al negocio de venta de pescado y tiene un negocio de abarroteria.
Blanca es una mujer trabajadora y está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más variedad de pescado como robalo, salmón, sardinas, etc.  Con el apoyo de este préstamo espera que mejoren sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente que solicita su segundo préstamo para capital de trabajo ya que quiere capitalizar más el negocio. 
Blanca su sueño es mejorar poco a poco su casa y que su negocio sea uno de los más grandes de la zona.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2015
texts.en:
The young Blanca is 24 years old, and she is single. She does not have children dependent on her, and she lives with her father in their own home in the community of San Lorenzo; a valley in the south of Honduras. She has earned a living for two years in the business of selling fish and she has a grocery business.

Blanca is a hardworking woman and she is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety of fish such as bass, salmon, sardines, etc. With the support of this loan she hopes to improve her earnings and her quality of life. She is a client that is requesting her second working capital loan since she wants to capitalize her business more. Blanca's dream is to improve her house little by little and have her business be one of the biggest in the area.

loans.use: to buy bass, salmon, sardines, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marling De Los Angeles

texts.es: Hace diez años que Marling se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, su hijo es su principal apoyo en el negocio poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para aumentar sus ingresos y comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras. Con las ganancias obtenidas podrá mejorar la infraestructura de su local.
texts.en:
It was 10 years ago that Marling started to work selling fruits and vegetables. Her son is her main helper in the business. Little by little she has gotten ahead.

It is for that reason that she is requesting a loan to increase her income and to buy more fruits and vegetables. With the obtained earnings, she will be able to improve the infrastructure of her store.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kenia Rosibel

texts.es:
La joven  Kenia de 25  años de edad, es casada y  tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella vive con sus hijos sola ya que su esposo esta en Los Estados Unidos, posee  casa propia y vive en una comunidad  de San Lorenzo,  valle al sur de Honduras.
Kenia se dedica desde hace 02 años  al negocio de venta de tortillas y sus clientes son los amigos y personas que vienen a su casa a diario, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña ya que son la materia prima para hacer las tortillas. Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos, es una clienta que solicita su segundo préstamo.
Kenia su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015.
texts.en:
This young lady named Kenia is 25 years old, is married, and has two children that are dependent on her. She only lives with her children because her spouse is in the United States. She has her own house and lives in a San Lorenzo community in the southern Honduras valley.

Kenia has made a living for two years selling tortillas. Her customers are her friends and people who come to her house daily.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy corn and firewood because those are the raw materials for making tortillas. With the support of this loan, she will try to improve her income. She is a client that is requesting her second loan. Kenia's dream is to improve her business and her house. San Lorenzo, Honduras - November, 2015

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her business.

loans.name: G.s Buenas Nuevas Group

texts.es:
La señora Domitila es una mujer  emprendedora y dedicada al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos provienen de su negocio que es la venta de abarrotería, este negocio lo atiende de manera personal y se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes, tiene 16 años de dedicarse a su negocio.
Doña Domitila solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de abarrotería como ser: arroz, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, huevos, churros, lácteos, embutidos y condimentos, etc. para dar a vasto las demandas de producto a sus clientes, espera poder extender su negocio y poder vender más variedad de productos a sus clientes y así poder mejorar su fuente de ingresos.
Doña Domitila solicita el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas
Doña Elsi se dedica a la venta de abarrotería, desde hace 6 años.
Doña Isis se dedica a la venta de sandalias, desde hace 8 años.
Doña Telma se dedica a la elaboración y venta de rosquillas desde hace 4 años.


Danli, Honduras - Noviembre del  2015
texts.en:
La señora Domitila is an enterprising woman and is dedicated to selling. Her main source of income comes from her business where she sells groceries. She works this business personally, and she gets up very early to attend to her customers. She has worked her business for 16 years.

Doña Domitila is requesting the support of the loan to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, butter, sodas, eggs, churros, dairy, meats, and condiments, etc. to give a vast selection of products to her customers. She hopes to be able to expand her business and be able to sell a wider variety of products to her customers and thus be able to improve her revenue.

Doña Domitila is requesting the loan as part of a group with the following people:

Doña Elsi works selling grocery for the 6 years.

Doña Isis works selling sandals for 8 years.

Doña Telma works making and selling donuts for 4 years.





Danli, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, butter, sodas, eggs, churros, dairy, meats, and condiments, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Edelmira

texts.es: Rosa de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de lacteos y paletas naturales desde hace 6 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas prodcutos pr mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old and lives with her son in a house that she owns. She has earned her living selling dairy products and natural ice pops for six years. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers, especially her neighbors. With the earnings she obtains, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

Rosa is requesting a loan for the purchase of more products at wholesale so that she can continue with her sales in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products and natural ice pops at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Aide

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad es viuda vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella posee desde hace 20 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a 56-year-old widow who lives in her own house with her two daughters. For some 20 years now, she has operated a small store in her place of residence. Maria has many customers due to her good prices and the friendliness she displays while selling goods. The earnings she obtains is sufficient to cover some of her household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan for purchasing more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet breads, etc., in order to earn a better income and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet breads, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is thirty two year old married man who lives Masindi district. He deals in sugarcane growing and has done this for twelve years. He started up the business with the main aim of supporting his family and taking his children for education up to higher levels.

He is seeking for a loan to cut and transport his sugarcane to the factory.His dreams is to enlarge his farm but he encountered by a problem of burning the sugar-canes at an early stage.

loans.use: to cut and transport his sugarcane for sell.

loans.name: Martha Lilia

texts.es: Doña Martha es una mujer que ha logrado salir adelante con el negocio de venta ropa y zapatos, hace tres años inicio con dicha actividad sus hijas son su principal apoyo, quiere fortalecer su negocio y expandirse en diferentes zonas es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para comprar electrodomésticos y mercadería variada y de esa manera lograr surtir la demanda de sus clientes. Con los ingresos obtenidos podrá realizar mejoras en su hogar.
texts.en: Martha is a woman who has succeeded in getting ahead with the business of selling clothing and shoes. She started this business three years ago and her daughters are her main supporters. She wants to strengthen her business and expand into different areas. This is why she is requesting a loan to purchase household appliances and a variety of merchandise, and in that way supply the demand of her customers. Martha will be able to make improvements in her home with the income obtained.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances and a variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is maize farmer from Sha Labari village. As a member of Babban Gona, Garba is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Garba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Garba can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Garba is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Soleyma Geraldina

texts.es: Soleyma de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su esposo quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de pans, camisetas deportivas, calcetas, etc. desde hace 9 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, la clienta está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor ya que le va bien en sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Soleyma is 38 years old. She lives in her own house with her daughter and her husband who works and helps her economically. She has worked selling clothing like pants, sports jerseys, stockings, etc. for nine years. Her business is located in the municipal market. She has lots of clients due to the quality of her clothing and her good prices. The client is once again requesting a loan to buy more clothing wholesale as her sales are going well and doing this she can have greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing like pants, sports jerseys, stockings, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Elvia Lissette

texts.es: elvia de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus padres, ella posee una negocio de venta de reparacion y accesorios para celulares desde hace 5 años tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de los productos y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas accesorios y respuestos para celulares por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Elvia is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and her parents. She has a cell phone repair and accessories sales business that she has had for 5 years. Elvia has many customers because of the quality of the products and with the profit she obtains, she is able to take care of some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cell phone accessories and spare parts in bulk in order to continue with her sales and be able to gain better economic income.

loans.use: to purchase more cell phone accessories and spare parts in bulk.

loans.name: Jose Farid

texts.es: Jose de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, el se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros desde hace mas de 20 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de prodcutos que comercializa y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algnos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old and lives with his daughter in a house that he owns. He has earned his living selling women's and men's clothing for more than 20 years. His business is located in the municipal market and he has many customers because of the variety of products that he sells. With the sales he makes, he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

Jose is requesting a loan for the purchase of more clothing at wholesale in order to continue with his sales and thereby have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase women's and men's clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Mi Bendicion Group

texts.es:
La asociacion comunal mi Bendicion esta conformada por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un hombre madres y padres responsables de quince hijos, son originarios del sauce, lugar que se caracteriza por ser productor de leche, queso, son personas responsables con ganas de superacion personal que luchan dia a dia para salir adelante con sus hijos, y brindarles oportunidades de estudios, y cumplir sueños  y metas como hacer mejoras de sus viviendas y darles estabilidad y estudios.

gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la cordinadora es leyda y tiene por actividad economica la venta  y crianza de cerdos en pie. el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion, ella dedica a su negocio unas ochos horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. el objetivo del credito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cerdos en pie. mi Bendicion agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua. para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mi Bendición" [My Blessing] is made up of eight members: six women and one man, responsible mothers and fathers of fifteen children. They are natives of El Sauce, a place known for milk and cheese production. They are responsible people with a desire for personal improvement. They strive day after day to support their children, providing them with opportunities to go to school, and fulfill their dreams and goals, like improving their houses and giving their children stability and education.

Because of her desire to get ahead, Leyda is the coordinator. For her economic activity, she raises and sells live pigs. Her business is located in her house. She works in her business eight hours a day, selling her products. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock up her business of buying and selling live pigs.

Mi Bendición is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors provide to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have a decent means of making a living.

loans.use: to purchase and sell live pigs.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Chantal is a married woman with 42-years-old with six children who are between 5 and 18 years old. Chantal works hard to support her family and provide them with a better life. She is the president of group TWITEZIMBERE in local language and in English means to be developed. She is the first person on the left side.

For the past 10 years, Chantal has sold goats and pigs in a small market. Every morning she goes to the market at 5 am and works tirelessly until her daily supply is sold.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, to expand her business by purchasing more pigs, goats for sale. With her profits, she will be able to continue paying school fees for her children, health insurance for her children and she will use the remaining profit to expand the current business by purchasing other animals like cows,chickens

loans.use: to buy more goats and pigs for  sale.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a married man from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. He is 44 years old with six children. His eldest is 17 and the youngest is 3 years old. Benjamin has been engaged in farming vegetables like string beans. This business has been his source of income for 15 years now.  Benjamin was able to send his children to school out of his income. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. The loan will help Benjamin enhance his farming activity and his future harvest. His income will send his children to school and help pay for his household expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Helen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Helen has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is a married woman, 56 years old.

Reynalda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Reynalda requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new equipment like fishing net, tackle and maintenance for her business.

Reynalda has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment like fishing net, tackle and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a maize farmer from Dan'asabe village. As a Babban Gona member, Yohanna is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Yohanna can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yohanna no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Yohanna hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ma. Erma

texts.en:
Ma. Erma is 48 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Erma has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Erma has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Meit's Group

texts.en: Meit’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Meit makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la reparacion, activacion y venta de accesorios para celulares, se dedica a esa actividad desde hace 3 años e inicio con capital propio con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 2 meses, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas accesorios y repuestos por mayor para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The youth who has had his face pixelated is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area. He works repairing, activating and selling accessories for cellphones. He has been working at this activity for 3 years and started with his own capital. With what he obtains from his profits he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He lives with his life companion and his two month old son.

He is requesting a loan to buy more accessories and parts in order to have greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy more accessories and parts wholesale.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MUJRES EMPRENDEDORAS, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que espera mediante su negocio poder continuar apoyando  a su familia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, carnes, papas, aceite entre otros insumos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras" [Entrepreneurial Women]. The member continues working in the restaurant business. The member has a good time with her business, which is doing well thanks to the determination she brings to her business each day. The member is an enterprising and fighting woman who hopes to be able to continue supporting her family through the business, being that this is the way she helps her family get ahead

The member is requesting a loan to buy rice, meat, potatoes, and oil, among other supplies. 

The member is thankful for the loan granted and promises to make her established repayments.

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, potatoes, and oil, among other supplies.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La socia María Teresa  pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
La socia continúa  dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia María Teresa solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas, polo  entre otros.
texts.en: María Teresa  belongs to the communal bank  “Mujeres Emprendedoras” in the city of Cuzco, Peru. She still has a business buying and selling clothing.  She is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking member who hopes that through her business she can continue to support her family.  She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments on schedule, as this is the way she can improve the lives of her family.  María Teresa is requesting a loan to purchase sweaters and polos, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters and polos, among other items.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 45 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are still in school.

Lilibeth is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 65 years old and married with six children. Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, soap and other grocceries.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thida's Group

texts.en:
Thida’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia.

Thida makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa lives in Same. She is a businesswoman so she always finds ways to improve her business. Elsa has a small business that she opened a year ago. She started to do business with her own working capital of $200. She is also selling bread, fried bananas and doughnuts. Now she is taking a loan $600 from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use the loan to buy goods to keep in her store such as wheat, bananas, cooking oil and other things. She thinks that in the future she will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy  wheat, bananas, cooking oil and other things.

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es:
La socia Yessenia pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, la socia continua  con su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes, la socia vende casacas,pantalones,polos entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member, Yessenia, belongs to the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" [Enterprising Women] communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. She still has her clothing sales business. She is an enterprising and tenacious woman who hopes to obtain more earnings through her business in order to be able to continue supporting her family in that way.

Yessenia continues selling her merchandise to her customers. She sells coats, pants, t-shirts, and more. She would like to be able to keep working in order to be able to continue supporting her family.

She is grateful for this loan and she promises to make her loan payments according to the payment timetable.

Yessenia is requesting the loan for the purchase of sweaters, among other things.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, among other things.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El socio Ruben pertenece al banco comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS, él socio Rubén sigue dedicándose al negocio de agencia de viajes, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable que espera mediante su negocio poder continuar apoyando a su familia, él socio espera poder continuar trabajando en su negocio y de la misma forma que crezca su agencia.
EL socio solicito el crédito para la compra de boletos y entradas entre otros
texts.en:
Ruben belongs to the communal bank MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS. He still has his travel agency. He has had this business for a long time and it is going well thanks to the hard work he puts in every day. Ruben is a responsible person who hopes that through his business he can continue to support his family. He hopes to continue working in his business and that his travel agency continues to grow.

Ruben is requesting a loan to purchase travel tickets and admission tickets, among other things.

loans.use: to purchase travel tickets and admission tickets, among other items.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Juan continua con su negocio de agencia de viajes,  él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable que espera mediante su negocio poder continuar apoyando a su familia, él socio espera poder continuar trabajando en su negocio y de la misma forma que crezca su agencia.
El socio se siente agradecido por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de entradas turísticas  entre otros.
texts.en:
Juan belongs to the communal bank MUJERES . The bank is located in the province of Cuzco and state of Cuzco.

Juan continues to run his travel agency. He has had his business for a long time and it is going well due to the hard work he puts in every day. He is a very responsible person and hopes that through his business he will continue to support his family. He hopes to continue working with his business and that the agency grows. He is thankful for the loan he has received and promises to make his payment son time. Juan is requesting a loan to purchase tourist admission tickets, among other items.

loans.use: purchase tourist admission tickets, among other items.

loans.name: Chhem's Group

texts.en:
Chhem’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia.

Chhem makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ginnie Jinaky

texts.es:
Ginnie es un joven estudiante de la carrera de Diseño Gráfico, carrera que decidió estudiar porque desde muy niño le gusta todo lo referente al diseño, al arte. Le gusta mucho crear sus propios diseños y expresar sus sentimientos a través de ellos.

Lleva estudiando ya un año y medio, aún le falta un año y medio para que culmine su carrera. Le va muy bien en sus estudios, dedicándole 3 horas diarias a sus estudios, incluso hay veces que les dedica hasta 6 horas, dependiendo de los trabajos que tenga que realizar.

Al terminar su carrera, siente que los beneficiará mucho porque así podrá brindar a su familia, una mejor calidad de vida; para su comunidad hará muchas cosas, ayudando a los más necesitados haciendo campañas para recaudar fondos y destinarlos a jóvenes con talento como él, que no cuentan con los recursos para poder cumplir sus sueños.

Le gustaría trabajar en todo lo referente a su especialidad, ganar mucha experiencia, aprender al máximo todo lo de su entorno laboral para así poder formar su propia empresa.

El principal obstáculo que presenta Ginnie actualmente es el económico, debido a que la situación actual por la que está atravesando su familia, lo que pone en riesgo su continuidad estudiantil, por lo tanto no podrá cumplir sus sueños de ser un excelente profesional. Es por eso que, recurre al apoyo de KIVA para que puedan apoyarlo y así pueda cancelar las deudas que tiene pendiente y no tenga que preocuparse mucho por lo económico. 

Este préstamo lo ayudará mucho, porque le permitirá terminar su carrera sin tener que preocuparse mucho por lo económico. Logrando en él un gran cambio, porque se dedicará al 100% a su carrera y seguirá especializándose cada vez más.

El mayor sueño que Ginnie tiene en la vida es poner talleres de arte en todo el mundo, no solo de diseño, sino también de música, danza, bailes urbanos, gastronomía, etc. Ayudará a los artistas de la calle, con eso hará presentaciones y campañas para un solo objetivo: recaudar fondos y poder ayudar a los más necesitados de todo el mundo.

Ginnie se siente muy feliz y agradecido al obtener este crédito, pues le ayudaría con uno de sus más grandes objetivos a corto plazo que es el terminar con éxito su carrera. Por ese motivo, desea expresarles unas líneas: "Me siento muy agradecido, muy feliz, pues no solo me ayudarían a seguir con los estudios, sino también a cumplir las metas que me propuse, y por eso les estoy muy agradecido. Sigan apoyando a jóvenes como yo, que tienen el mismo problema, ayúdennos a cumplir nuestros sueños y no truncarlos por los obstáculos que se nos presenta. Muchas gracias KIVA!!"
texts.en:
Ginnie is a young student who is pursuing a major in Graphic Design. He decided to study this field because he has always liked design and art since he was a young boy. He enjoys creating his own designs and expressing his feelings through them.

He has been studying for a year and a half. He still has another year and a half to complete his course. His studies are going well. He spends 3 hours a day on his coursework, and sometimes up to 6 hours a day depending on the work he needs to complete.

He feels that finishing his degree will be very beneficial to others because he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life. He will also do many things for his community; helping the neediest with campaigns to raise funds destined for young people like him who are talented, but who do not have the resources to achieve their dreams.

He would like to work in anything related to his specialty, gain a lot of experience, and learn as much as he can about the work environment so that he can start his own company

The main obstacle that Ginnie faces now is financial. Due to the situation his family is currently facing, his ability to continue his education is at risk, and he will not be able to achieve his dreams of becoming an excellent professional. Therefore, he has come to KIVA to request support so that he can pay off the debts that he has to pay and not worry too much about finances.

This loan will help him a lot, because it will let him complete his degree without having to worry too much about money. This will be a big change for him and he will be able to dedicate himself 100% to his degree and to specializing more every day.

Ginnie's greatest dream in life is to deliver art workshops throughout the world, not only about design but also music, dance, urban dance, gastronomy, etc. He will help street artists and do presentations and campaigns with a singular objective: to raise funds to help the neediest people in the world.

Ginnie feels very happy and thankful to receive this loan, since it will help him with one of his greatest short term goals, which is to successfully finish his degree. For this reason, he wants to share with you a few words:

"I feel very thankful, very happy because you are not only helping me to continue my education, but also to achieve the goals that I set for myself. For this, I am very thankful. Keep supporting young people like me who have the same problem. Help us achieve our dreams and not give up on them due to the obstacles we face. Thank you very much, KIVA!"

loans.use: to continue his courses in Graphic Design and to achieve his dream of taking art to the entire world.

loans.name: Norway Group

texts.en:
Ester, who is in her mid 30s, is married with three schooling children. She has been running a food vending business famously known as "mamalishe" for two years. She works from 6 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restore the out of stock items in her mamalishe store. She dreams of expanding her business into a restaurant. Ester will share this loan with her loan group Norway which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restore the out of stock items in her mamalishe food store.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LAS MARGARITAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba.
El socio Raúl ,continua con su  negocio de farmacia, el socio continua vendiendo jarabes,pastillas,medicamentos en general para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio es una persona responsable con su trabajo y su familia, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de pastillas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Raúl is a member of the Las Margaritas communal bank, located in the province of Urubamba.  He continues running his pharmacy business, selling syrup, pills, and medicine in general to his customers.  He is a responsible person with regards to his work and his family, and that allows him to move ahead with his family.  

Raúl is requesting a loan to buy pills, among other things.  He is grateful for the loan and he is committed to making the established payments.

loans.use: to buy pills, among other things.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is aged 30 a single mother of 3 children and only one attends school. She operates a saloon business whereby she plaits hair for ladies plus beautifying them and supplements it by buying and selling produce such as rice,maize and beans. She intends to grow and expand her business the more only to be limited by high rental incomes.Mildred is focusing on the festive season where she usually gets many customers and wishes to buy enough stock of hair braids to use to plait her customers thus seeking for a credit facility to buy hair braids  for using in the saloon.

loans.use: to buy more hair braids for her saloon.

loans.name: Nimunyonje

texts.en:
Nimunyonje is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is purchasing stock for her business.

For over ten years now, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Ana Yalci

texts.es:
Ana, estudio hasta tercer grado de educacion basica esta casada su pareja es pensionado tiene dos hijos pero solo uno vive con ella ya que es un miño especial y la otra esta acompañada y tiene su propio hogar ademas tiene un nieto que estudia y que vive con ella de ella dependen tres personas.

Ana, trabaja con tienda lo a hecho por mas de diez años y lo aprendio por iniciativa propia y decidio hacer pupusas para vender los fines de semana asi mismo recibe remesas de usa antes solo se dedicaba a oficios domesticos el negocio la tienda en su casa donde vive viaja en bus a la ciudad para comprar productos necesarios para su negocio le apoya su esposo y su horario de trabajo es de 6.00am a6.30 pm de lunes a domingo.

Ana, comprara productos para sustir la tienda le mejorara mucho su negocio porque podra tener variedad de producto para ofrecer a sus clientes y esto le permitira tener mejor calidad de vida y se siente satisfecha porque tiene la oportunidad de seguir trabajando gracias al prestamo actual y a los prestamos anteriores porque a venido trabajando con prestamos y ahora tiene mas productos tiene su plancha de hacer pupusas que antes no la tenia.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando muy fuerte para poder vivir un poquito mejor y tener siempre surtida su tienda y el prestamo le ayudara a lograr sus sueños y con las ganacias va comprando productos y pagando el restamo ya que su objetivo es cumplir muy bien con la obligacion del prestamo para que le segan prestando.
texts.en:
Ana studied until the third grade of elementary school. She is married and her partner is a pensioner. She has two children, but only one lives with her now because he is a special child, and the other is in a relationship and has her own home. Ana also has a grandson who is studying and living with her; so three people depend on her.

Ana has worked with the store she built for more than ten years. She learned this business through her own initiative and decided to make pupusas to sell on the weekends. She also receives remittances from the USA. Previously she only did domestic work. Her store business is at her home where she lives. She travels by bus into town to buy the products necessary for her business. Her husband supports her and her work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 6.30 pm from Monday to Sunday.

Ana will buy products to stock her store, which will greatly improve her business because she will be able to have a variety of products to offer to her customers. This will allow her to have a better quality of life. She feels pleased because she has the opportunity to continue working thanks to her current loan and previous loans, because she can get along working with the loans. Now she has more products and a griddle to make pupusas that previously she did not.

Her dreams are to continue working very hard in order to be able to live a little better and to always have her store stocked. This loan will help her achieve her dreams, and with her earnings she will continue buying products and paying back the loan, since her objective is to comply with the duties of her loan so that she can keep borrowing.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos con 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltero,vive en casa propio,en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor, plantación tiene cuatro años de edad, esta en segundo año de producción,con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 4 años.Su producto lo comercializa en Distrito Santo Tomas vendiendo a compradores mayorista de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría-engorde de ganado vacuno,con una experiencia en el rubro hace 5 años. Así mismo se dedica a la cría de animales menores como (gallinas, pavos, chanchos y cuyes) y al cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, vitucas, plátanos, menestras y otros) siendo estos para su consumo y en ocaciones para la venta; cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de 1 hectárea de café. De esta manera obtendrá una buena producción en la campaña 2016 incrementando mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad vida

Juan Carlos es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 25 years old, single, and lives in his own home in the Santo Tomás district, Cutervo Province, in the department of Cajamarca, Peru. He has very good references, both personal and work related, from the inhabitants of the area. The majority of the citizens of this locality make a living in agriculture, business, and livestock.

Juan Carlos earns a living in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of coffee of the Catimor variety. The plantation is four years old and is in its second production year.He has four years in the industry. Juan Carlos sells his product in the Santo Tomás district to the wholesale buyers of the area. He also earns a living in the raising and fattening of cattle, with five years in the industry. Similarly, he works raising smaller animals like chickens, turkeys, pigs, and guinea pigs and in the cultivation of bread products like yucca, taro, plantains, legumes, and others for his consumption, and on occasion, for sale. He has ample experience in this industry.

The loan will be to invest in the maintenance of 1 hectare of coffee. This way he will obtain a good production in the 2016 campaign, increasing his income and like that be able to improve his living conditions.

Juan Carlos is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of 1 hectare of coffee.

loans.name: Nuevo Dia Group

texts.es:
Sarah es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 3, 10 y 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de pollo a la broaster.
Ella es emprendedora, amable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘Nuevo día’ caracterizado por albergar a los sobrevivientes del desborde del río años atrás, hoy convertida en la zona pujante de producción manufacturera.
Sarah es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y fisico robusto (sentada a la izquierda, viste polera lila), Su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer de bus y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. El impulso por mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; verdulería, venta de ropa de segunda mano, servicio de taxi, taller de reparación de electrodomésticos, tienda de barrio, librería y venta de huevo. Su negocio es la venta de pollo a la broaster, actividad que realiza desde medio día hasta las media noche durante todos los días de la semana, “Cada presa de pollo que sirvo, la acompaño con papas fritas y una porción de arroz, los clientes Siempre salen satisfechos después de comer mis pollos…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque las presas de pollo son grandes en relación al precio de la comida. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de muebles de comedor para atender a más clientes. Su sueño es tener otro puesto de venta, ella desea comprar mesas y sillas  para vender comida a más clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sarah solicita un préstamo para comprar mesas y sillas para vender pollo a la broaster.
texts.en:
Sarah is 35 years old. She lives with her partner and has 3 children, ages 3, 10 and 18. Her business is selling Broaster style ( pressure fried) chicken.

She is very entrepreneurial, friendly and hardworking. Her business is located in the 'Nuevo dia' neighborhood, which was set up to shelter survivors when the river flooded years ago. Now it is a thriving manufacturing area.

Sarah has brown skin, long black hair and a robust figure (seated on the left in the photo and dressed in a purple shirt). Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks in with her family. She speaks Spanish for general culture and in her business. She shares her life with her partner who works as a bus driver, and with her children who attend school. The family lives in a rented room constructed of brick with a corrugated tin roof and a concrete floor. It has potable water, electricity and plumbing.

The desire to improve her business drove her to set up a lending group. The businesses of the members are: a green grocer, sales of second-hand clothing, a taxi service, a repair shop for appliances, a neighborhood store, a book store, and egg sales. Her business is selling Broaster style chicken. She does this from noon to midnight everyday.

“Every serving of chicken I comes with French fries and rice. Customers are always satisfied after eating my chickens...", she comments. Her business is successful because the servings of chicken are large relative to the price of the meal. The advantage of her business is that she has daily sales. The disadvantage is that she doesn't have enough dining furniture to serve more customers. Her dream is to have another location. She wants to buy more tables and chairs to sell food to more customers. This is her first loan cycle with the bank in the five years that she has had her business.

For these reasons Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase tables and chairs to sell Broaster style chicken.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to sell Broaster  style chicken.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Delia is 47 years old and has two children are still in school.

Delia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new equipment like fishing net, tackle, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Delia has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new equipment like fishing net, tackle, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Adamu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Adamu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Adamu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Adamu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Ly’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Ly makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is a bar and restaurant operator who manages her business located at Circle a suburb in Accra. She is 60 years old, hardworking, and has 8 years of experience functioning in the drinks and food business.
She needs a loan of GHS 2000; this would help her buy in bulk rather than the usual smaller quantity she normally buys. She believes that investing into her business around this time yields more returns basically because of the festive season around the corner.

She has no children but takes care of nieces and nephews living with her as well as the people she works with. It gives her much joy to be able to give work to a number of people who depend on her for their daily earnings.

She works from Mondays to Saturday and her customers are mainly corporate workers and the middle class. She began this business to provide food and refreshment for the working community in the area.
She is thankful to Kiva lenders for showing faith in her and the many people they give support to around the world.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa has been involved in activities since 2000. She started her business with her own working capital of $500. Her husband is in agriculture. She is requesting a loan of $1500 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies according to people's requests, including candy, candles, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, detergents, biscuits, nuts, milk, cigarettes, coffee, children's milk and other things to sell Including soft drinks and hard drinks. She hopes to make her business bigger in the future.

loans.use: to buy candy, candles, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, detergents, biscuits, nuts, milk, cigarettes, coffee, children's milk, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima De Conchacalla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA DE CONCHACALLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Ricardina, la socia continúa dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia es una mujer emprendedora  que espera poder obtener más ganancias con su negocio para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua criando a su animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan en las distintas ferias que se realizan por la zona, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar más cuyes entre otros.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
Las socias que salen adjuntas en la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA DE CONCHACALLA” communal bank which is located in the district of Anta, belonging to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Ricardina, the member continues to make a living by raising small animals. The member is an entrepreneurial woman who hopes to earn more profit through her business and in this way continue supporting her family. 

The member continues to raise small animals and then sell them to her clients who request them for various fairs that are held throughout the area. This way she helps her family get ahead. 

Overall the members are thankful for the loan granted and commit to completing their established quotas. The member requests the loan to purchase more guinea pigs among other things. 

The person whose face is covered does not belong to the communal bank. The members who are attached to the photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to purchase more guinea pigs among other things

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS MARGARITAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba.
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa y también la socia vende juguetes como muñecas y carros, la socia es  una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo  pantalones, blusas y polos para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos y casacas.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to "Las Margaritas," a bank located in the province of Urubamba.

She continues working in the business of selling clothing, and she also sells toys such as dolls and cars. She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who hopes to obtain more earnings through her business, so that in this way she can continue supporting her family. She continues to sell pants, blouses, and polo shirts to the customers who seek her out, since in this way she is raising her family.

She is applying for the loan to purchase shoes and jackets.

She feels grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments on her account.

loans.use: to buy shoes and jackets to sell.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier  de 39 años es padre de 4 hijos y junto a su esposa Feliciana desean  poder darle la mejor educación posible y verlos convertidos en profesionales, además aspira a poder realizar algunas mejoras en su casa para brindar un mejor ambiente a su familia   es por eso que  se esfuerza mucho y tiene 2 empleos, trabaja como capataz en una Finca y también se dedica a la agricultura de  frijoles y maíz además de la cría de ganado. Aunque estas actividades suplen muchas necesidades, en su familia hay una necesidad que a Javier le gustaría suplir  a corto plazo y es la falta de energía eléctrica, ya que en la comunidad de Atlántida, Honduras donde ellos viven no cuentan con este servicio, por lo que  deben iluminarse con lámparas a base de querosén y también deben pagar para poder tener el servicio de cargar teléfonos celulares. Por estas razones Javier solicita a Soluz Honduras un préstamo para poder adquirir un sistema solar para iluminación que le ayudara a tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Javier is 39 years old and has 4 children.  He and his wife Feliciana want to be able to give their children the best education possible and see them become professionals.  Javier also wants to be able to make some improvements to his home to provide a better environment for her family, and he works hard to be able to do so.  He works as a foreman on a farm and has 2 employees, and he also makes a living growing beans and corn as well as raising livestock.  

Although his various activities are able to fill many of their needs, there is one need in his family that Javier would like to fill in the short term and that is the need for electricity.  They don't have electricity service In their community of Atlántida, Honduras, so they have to light their home with kerosene lamps and they also have to pay for a cellphone service.  For these reasons, Javier requested a loan from Soluz Honduras so that he can install a solar power system for lighting that will help him and his family improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel system for lighting that will greatly improve the conditions of life for his family.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is a resident of Muniguda village in the Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is 42 years old. She has a small family with her husband and three children. She and her husband are engaged in the occupation of making and selling snacks (Mixture). No doubt she has everything required for the basic necessities of life: different activities with a permanent income, a two-wheeler, a good shop and other allied items to manage her family. Still, her family members are not so happy due to the unavailability of a good RCC house that she owns.

This doesn’t mean that they are staying at a thatched house; rather they are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent. The rented house is made from mud and roofed with asbestos, which creates a very critical situation during the rainy season. The most important thing is the apprehensive house is not completely secure and safe. In this situation, she decided to construct a small but standard house with all possible facilites. She has already started to construct the house. But she does not have sufficient funds complete it. So she decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institution. At this time, Mamata came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn the house loan details.

Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan for house construction. With the loan, Mamata will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring and coloring of the house. She will also complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few months. It not only reduces the financial burden but also helps Mamata to feel proud to own her house in society.

loans.use: to complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring and coloring of her house as well as the wiring with an electricity connection.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS MARGARITAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba.
La Saturnina continua con su negocio de venta de carne, la socia lleva buen  tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pon cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo carne a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar carne.
texts.en:
Saturnina is a member of the Las Margaritas communal bank, located in the province of Urubamba.

Saturnina continues making a living selling meat.  She has run her business for a long time, and it is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her work every day.  She sells meat to customers who order it from her, and that allows her to move her family forwards.  

She is requesting a loan to buy meat.  She is grateful for the loan and she promises to follow through with her repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Mandakini

texts.en:
Mandakini is a resident of Muniguda village in the Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is 40 years old. She has a small family with her husband and two children. She and her husband are engaged in a printing press occupation. No doubt she has everything required for the basic necessities of life: different activities with permanent income, a two-wheeler, a good shop and other allied items to manage her family. Still, her family members are not so happy due to not owning a good RCC house.

It doesn’t mean that they are staying at a thatched house; rather they are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent. The rented house is made from mud and roofed with asbestos, which creates a very critical situation during the rainy season. The most important thing is the apprehensive house is not completely secure and safe. In this situation, she decided to construct a small but standard house with all possible facilites. She has already started to construct the house. But she does not have sufficient funds to complete it. So she decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At this point, Mandakini came to Mahashakti Foundation to lean the details of a house loan. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan for house construction. With the loan, Mandakini will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring and coloring of the house. She will also complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

She is very happy to know that her house will be completed within a few months. It not only reduces the financial burden but also helps Mandakini to feel proud to own a house in society.

loans.use: to complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring and coloring of her house as well as wiring with an electricity connection.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Hace 8 años  que Luis se dedica a la agricultura, siembra y cosecha maíz, frijoles y café, esta actividad la realiza junto a su familia. Aunque Luis es un hombre soltero es muy trabajador y emprendedor, tiene como objetivos poder comprar una motocicleta que le servirá como transporte y le ayudara en sus labores diarias, también le gusta mucho la barbería, por lo que en un futuro desea implementar un pequeño negocio de este tipo en su vivienda. En la comunidad de Atlántida, Honduras donde vive Luis, lamentablemente no hay acceso a la energía eléctrica, esto obstaculiza algunas de sus labores diarias, debido a  la falta de iluminación, actualmente debe iluminarse con lámparas a base de kerosén lo que implica un aumento en su presupuesto, además debe pagar para poder tener servicio de carga de teléfonos celulares. Por estas razones Luis está solicitando a Soluz Honduras un préstamo para adquirir un sistema solar para iluminación que le ayudara a tener una vida mucho más productiva de la que ahora tiene.
texts.en:
Luis has been working in agriculture for eight years. He plants and harvests corn, beans, and coffee. He does this work together with his family. Although Luis is a single man, he is very hard-working and entrepreneurial. He has as goals to buy a motorcycle, which will serve him as transportation and will help him in his daily work; he also very much likes the barber business, and for this reason he would like to set up a little business of this type in his home in the future.

In the community of Atlántida, Honduras, where Luis lives, unfortunately there is no access to electrical energy. This is an obstacle to some of his daily work, given the lack of lighting. Now he has to light with kerosene lamps, which implies an increase in his budget. In addition, he has to pay to be able to have a cellular telephone charging service.

For these reasons, Luis is applying to Soluz Honduras for a loan to acquire a solar power system for lighting, which will help him to have a much more productive life than he has now.

loans.use: to purchase a solar power system for lighting, which will improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.name: Alejandra Alicia

texts.es:
Alejandra es una mujer de 54 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijas de 13 y 17 años, y su negocio es la confección de mantas de lana de oveja.
Ella es fuerte, dedicada y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Huarina’ distante a 35 kilómetros de la ciudad y cercano al lago sagrado Titicaca, los pobladores mayormente se ocupan de la agricultura, pesca y ganadería. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura máxima de 10 grados centígrados.
Alejandra es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado y viste de forma tradicional (sombrero manta y pollera), su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la pesca y con sus hijas que estudian en la escuela y trabajan en el mismo negocio, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica no tiene agua potable ni alcantarillado porque no existen los servicios básicos en el lugar. Su negocio es la confección de tejidos como el ‘aguayo’ que es hilado a mano y lo utilizan las mujeres del Altiplano, Cada mujer tiene su propio aguayo, estos ser confeccionan con lana de llama, alpaca u oveja y es teñido con colores vivos, “con la ayuda de mis hijas queremos tejer mayor cantidad para venderlas en otra poblaciones…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque el uso de estas prendas son casi obligados por las costumbres y tradiciones. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ayuda de sus hijas para tejer, la desventaja es la falta de un telar para producir mayor cantidad. Su sueño es aumentar su producción para vender en ferias de poblaciones vecinas, Ella desea comprar un telar artesanal y lana de oveja. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Alejandra solicita un préstamo para comprar un telar artesanal y lana de oveja para tejer aguayos.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a 54 year old woman who is married and has 2 daughters, ages 13 and 17. Her business is making blankets from sheeps' wool. She is strong, dedicated, and very hardworking. She runs her business in the "Huarina" area, which is 35 kilometers from the city, and close to the sacred lake Titicaca. The citizens of the area work mainly in agriculture, fishing, and livestock farming. It has a cold and dry climate with a maximum temperature of 10 degrees centigrade. She has tan skin, long black hair which she braids, and dresses in the traditional way (hat, blanket, and skirt).

She shares her life with her husband, who works in fishing, while her daughters are in school and are also working in the same business as her. They live in their own home made from adobe, with a corrugated iron roof and cement floor. They have electricity, but no potable water or sewer connection in their home, because the basic services aren't available in the area.

Her business is making woven fabrics such as the "aguayo", which is woven by hand and is worn by the women of Altiplano. Each woman has her own aguayo, which are made with llama, sheep, or alpaca wool and is dyed with bright colors. She comments that "with the help of my daughters, we want to weave greater quantities in order to sell them in other towns...". Her business is successful because wearing these garments is almost obligatory for the customs and traditions. The advantage of her business is that she has her daughters' help with weaving, the disadvantage is that she lacks a loom in order to produce a greater quantity. Her dream is to increase her production in order to sell at fairs in neighboring towns.

She would like to buy an artisanal loom and sheeps' wool. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 16 years she has been doing this work. It is for these reasons that Alejandra is requesting a loan, to buy an artisanal loom and sheeps' wool to weave aguayos.

loans.use: to buy an artisanal loom and sheeps' wool to weave aguayos.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal LAS MARGARITAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba.
La socia Sandra continua  trabajando  en un hotel, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una mujer responsable y empeñosa ella espera  continuar trabajando para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia disfruta su trabajo ya que mediante su trabajo puede conocer diferentes personas de diferentes nacionalidades y así poder conocer diferentes culturas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colchas entre otros.
texts.en:
This bank member belongs to "Las Margaritas," a communal bank located in the province of Urubamba.

Bank member Sandra continues working in a hotel. She feels grateful for the loan granted, and she promises to make her established payments. She is a responsible and persevering woman. She hopes to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She enjoys her work since through this work she can meet different people of different nationalities and thus be able to know different cultures.

She is applying for the loan to purchase bedspreads, among other items.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, among other items.

loans.name: La Union Es Progreso Group

texts.es: Cesarina de 45 años es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos. Al ver que el dinero no alcanzaba para hacer frente a los gastos de su hogar decidió poner una pequeña tiendita en un pequeño espacio de su casa. Su deseo mas grande es tener un minimarket y bien surtida de todos los productos.El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería de abarrotes al por mayor porque asi le sale mas barato. Pertenecer al banquito "La unión es progreso" le ha ayudado a tener una mejor calidad de vida. Se siente muy agradecida con las personas de Kiva por ayudar a cumplir sus metas. Cesarina es la segunda que esta a la mano derecha con una chompa de color ploma y esta agarrado a su nieta.
texts.en:
Caserina of 45 is cohabiting and has 5 kids. Seeing that there wasn't enough money to meet household expenses she decided to start a small convenience store in a small space of her home. 

Her biggest desire is to have a well stocked mini market full of all products. The loan will be invested to purchase grocery merchandise in wholesale because it is cheaper. Belonging to the small bank "La unión es progreso" [Unity is progress] has helped her have a better quality of life. 

She feels very grateful for the people at Kiva for helping her achieve her goals. Cesarina is the second from the right wearing a lead colored sweater and clutching her granddaughter.

loans.use: purchase grocery products in wholesale

loans.name: Exitosas Group

texts.es:
La banca de emprendimiento exitosas ahora es presidida por Lixi, ella es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Actualmente la banca sigue trabajando unida, los negocios de los socios mejoraron, pudieron comprar materia prima, mercadería, realizaron el pago de servicios y arreglaron sus ambientes de trabajo. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque planificaron bien sus ventas y cumplieron sus metas.
Lixi es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada al centro, viste polera gris). Su vida la dedica a su hijo que está empezando la escuela y que no tiene padre, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, ella recorre largas distancias en centros comerciales, oficinas públicas y privadas, áreas peatonales y todo comercio en busca de clientes, a los cuales ofrece cosméticos por catálogo, los productos más demandados son lápices labiales, pinturas de uñas y perfumes de moda, los cuales compra con anticipación para mostrarlos y entregarlos en el instante, “compro mercadería de moda para cargar en mi cartera, estas son las primeras en venderse y las clientas no esperan…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque ofrece facilidades de pago como, pago al contado y pago en cuotas. La ventaja de su negocio es que ofrece mercadería variada y de moda, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar mercadería por mayor. Su sueño es tener un buen capital de trabajo y consolidar su negocio, ella desea comprar cosméticos de moda para vender al crédito y contado para pagar los gastos de su hijo. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lixi solicita un préstamo para comprar cosméticos de moda para mantener a su hijo.
texts.en:
This bank of successful entrepreneurs is now presided over by Lixi.  She is a young 21-year-old single woman who has a 6-year-old child and a business selling cosmetics.  

Presently, the bank continues working together and its members have improved their businesses, bought primary materials and merchandise, paid for services, and fixed up their work environments.  Their payments were puntual because they planned their sales well and fulfilled their goals.  

Lixi has a dark complexion, long black hair, and a slender build, and she speaks Guaraní, her first language, with her family and Spanish with the general public and when she does business.  She is seated in the center wearing a grey T-shirt.  She dedicates her life to her son who is starting school and doesn't have a father.  They live in a home owned by her family.  It is made of brick with a corrugated iron roof and a cement floor, and is equipped with running water, electricity, and plumbing.  

She has a business selling cosmetics.  She travels long distances to commercial centers, public and private offices, pedestrian areas and shops in search of customers who she offers cosmetics from catalogs.  The most in-demand products are lip liner pencils, nail polish, and fashionable perfume, so she buys these items ahead of time so that she can show them to customers who can purchase them immediately.  

"I bought the merchandise to carry around in my bag since these are the first items to sell and the customers expect them," she comments.  Her business is successful because she offers easy payment options such as in cash or by installments.  The advantage of her business is that she offers a variety of fashionable products, and the disadvantage is that she lacks capital to buy wholesale merchandise.  

Her dream is to have good working capital and consolidate her business.  She wants to buy fashionable cosmetics to sell for cash or on credit to pay for her son's expenses.  This is her 3rd sequence of loans with the with the institution in the 3 years that she has had her business.  

For these reasons, Lixi is requesting a loan to buy fashionable cosmetics to support her son.

loans.use: to buy fashionable cosmetics to support her child.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson tiene 31 años y  es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos y también a la construcción, con estos dos empleos desea darle la mejor calidad de vida a su familia, su sueño es que su hijo sea un hombre de bien y que logre tener una buena educación, por eso Nelson y su esposa se esfuerzan mucho.
