En la comunidad de Atlántida, Honduras donde Nelson vive no hay acceso a la energía eléctrica ya que es una comunidad muy alejada del área urbana, por lo cual algunas actividades diarias se hacen más difíciles, deben iluminar su vivienda con lámparas a base de querosén, lo cual perjudica su salud, también deben pagar para tener un servicio de carga de celulares, su esposa a quien le gusta mucho cocinar, tiene problemas a la hora de preparar los alimentos en la noche o muy temprano en la mañana por la falta de iluminación.  Por esto Nelson ha decidido solicitar a Soluz Honduras un préstamo con el cual podrá adquirir un Sistema solar para iluminación de su vivienda, ya que con este sistema la vida familiar mejorara mucho.
texts.en:
Nelson is 31 years old. He is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial man who works farming staple foods and also works in construction. With these two jobs he wants to give his family a better quality of life. His dream is that his son will become a good man and that he will be able to have a good education. For this reason, Nelson and his wife put forth a lot of effort.

In the community of Atlantida, Honduras, where Nelson lives, there is no access to electrical energy since it is a community very far from the urban area. This makes some daily activities very difficult. They have to illuminate the house with kerosene lanterns which is harmful to their health. He also has to pay to have a cellular charging service. His wife really likes to cook, but she has problems when preparing food at night or very early in the morning due to the lack of illumination.

For these reasons, Nelson has decided to request a Soluz Honduras loan with which he will be able to acquire a solar system to illuminate his home since with this system his family's life will be very much improved.

loans.use: to buy a solar lighting system that will improve the living conditions for his family

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda de 40 años se dedica a la cría de cerdos junto a su esposo, también  a la siembra de frijol y de maíz, desde hace más de 15 años, viven en la comunidad de Atlántida, Honduras, y con estas actividades Hilda está logrando poder darle una buena calidad de vida a su familia y que sus seis hijos tengan la mejor educación posible. Dos de los hijos de Hilda aún están estudiando, esta labor por las noches se les dificulta mucho, ya que donde ellos viven no hay acceso a energía eléctrica y deben iluminarse con lámparas a base de querosén, lo cual perjudica su salud. Además deben pagar para tener servicio de carga de celulares. Por estas razones Hilda solicita a Soluz Honduras un préstamo con el cual podrá adquirir un sistema solar para iluminación que le brindara muchos benéficos en su hogar  y   evitara la contaminación que produce la iluminación con querosén.
texts.en:
Hilda is 40 years old and together with her husband earns a living by raising pigs. She also plants beans and corn and has lived in the community of  Atlántida, Honduras for more than 15 years, and with these activities Hilda is providing a good quality of life to her family and the best possible education for her six kids.

Two of Hilda's kids are still studying, thus studying is hard to do at night, because there is no access to electricity where they live, and they have to use kerosene lamps which harms their health. Furthermore, they must pay to have their cell phones charged. 

For these reasons Hilda requests from Soluz Honduras a loan that will help acquire a solar lighting system which will provide many benefits to her home and will avoid the contamination that is produced by kerosene lamps.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lighting system which will improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La socia Feliciana continúa dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad y elaboración de artesanías. Ella está logrando salir adelante y cumplir su meta de ampliar su negocio y tener una tienda donde expender sus productos de mejor manera. Para ello la socia necesita  alimentar mejor a sus animales que ella cría y vende y así podrá tener más ingresos económicos para su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar afrecho y alfalfa para sus gallinas y cuyes.
La socia está feliz y contenta con el crédito otorgado por los inversionistas de KIVA y se compromete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Felicia continues making a living raising animals and running a business selling basic necessities and making handicrafts.  She is succeeding at moving forwards and completing her dream of expanding her business and having a store where she can sell her products more effectively.   

In order to complete her goal, she needs to feed her animals better and sell them so that she can bring in some much-needed income for her home.  She needs a loan to buy bran and alfalfa for her chickens and guinea pigs.  

She is happy to receive the loan provided by Kiva lenders and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bran and alfalfa.

loans.name: Kijiwe Pesa Group

texts.en:
Sesilia is a married woman in her early 40's, with four school-aged children. She has sold rice for eight years and works from 8 am to 10 pm daily to make a good monthly profit. This will be Sesilia' 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her rice inventory and has managed to successfully repay her loans. She is happy with the loan and appreciates KIVA for the support of their group which is doing great. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan, and renovate her house.

She will use this loan to buy rice to meet customer demands. She dreams of expanding her business. Sesilia will share this loan with her 2-member loan group "Kijiwe Pesa". They hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase rice.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
La socia Leyla pertenece al banco comunal "VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN" ubicado en el poblado de Arin , en la provincia de Calca  y departamento del Cusco.
La socia tiene 22 años y se dedica a la actividad ganadera. Su deseo es salir adelante, ahora más que nunca que acaba de tener un hijo. Por eso quiere mejorar la calidad de su ganado dándole una mejor dieta, así podrá venderlos a mejor precio en el mercado y darle una mejor futuro a su pequeño vástago.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar alfalfa y cebada para sus animalitos.
La socia está contenta y agradecida con las personas que permiten que ella pueda salir adelante mediante el crédito que le servirá de mucho en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Leyla belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Concebida de Arin."  The members of this group live in the town of Arin, in Calca province in the department of Cusco.  Leyla is 22 years old and works raising livestock.  She wants to get ahead, now more than ever since she just had a son.  She wants to improve the quality of her livestock by giving them a better diet.  This way she will be able to sell them at a higher price in the market and provide her little son with a better future.

Leyla is requesting a loan to buy alfalfa and barley for her young animals.  She is happy and grateful to the people who are enabling her to get ahead through this loan, which will help her a lot with her business activities.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa and barley

loans.name: Experia

texts.en:
Experia is a widowed 64-year-old mother of eight children. Experia works very hard to provide for them.

Experia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. Experia requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, bread, cooking oil, coffee, cereals, soft drinks, snack foods, etc. to sell.

Experia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, bread, cooking oil, coffee, cereals, soft drinks, snack foods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 61 years old and married with two children.

Veronica is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Veronica requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Veronica has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Veronica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sophal makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Saveoun's Group

texts.en: Saveoun’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Saveoun grows rice to support her family. Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. San makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: Maria de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace 5 años e inicio con capital propio, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maiz por quintales y asi poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, 30, lives in her own house with her 2 children.  She's had a business making and selling tortillas for 5 years, a business that she started with her own capital.  With her earnings from this business, she manages to cover some of the household expenses.  Maria is requesting a loan to buy corn in 100 pound sacks.  This way she can continue with her sales and generate a good income.

loans.use: to buy 100 pound sacks of corn

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La socia Agueda continua dedicándose a la venta de maíz, este negocio lo realiza con mucho entusiasmo desde hace mucho tiempo, la socia desea salir adelante junto con su familia y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz, ella desea incrementar su mercadería por fin de año.
La socia está satisfecha y agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella y darle la oportunidad de seguir por sus metas.
texts.en:
Agueda is continuing with her business selling corn.  She carries out this activity with a lot of enthusiasm, and she's been doing this work for a long time.  She wants to get ahead with her family and have a better quality of life.

Agueda is requesting a loan to buy corn.  She wants to have more merchandise for the end of the year.  Agueda is satisfied and grateful to the Kiva lenders for continuing to trust in her and for giving her the opportunity to continue to work toward her goals.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.She is a widow.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through GDMPC  to purchase  groceries to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business

Flordeliz dreams that, one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Melin

texts.en:
Melin is 38 years old and has two children. Melin is married and has two children who are in school.

Melin is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Melin requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Melin has been raising livestock for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 43-year-old married woman with four children.

She has raised pigs for 3 years and is is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and supplies.

She earns additional income selling recycled materials.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and  supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florentina is 47 years old and has four children are presently in school.

Florentina has a nipa roofing making business in the Philippines. Florentina requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase raw materials such as nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, rope and other materials.

Florentina has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to  purchase raw materials such as nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, rope and other materials

loans.name: Ginas

texts.en:
Ginas is a 32-year-old married woman with eight children. With five children currently in school, Ginas works very hard to provide for them.

Ginas has run a general store for 2 years and requests 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She sells a variety of items such as coffee, cereal, sugar, juice, snack foods, and detergent.

In the future, Ginas would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are stock purchases, on top of school fees and food.

For over thirteen years now, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling in a shop to the general public. She faces a challenge of capital for running her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

With the loan of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase more supplies of prawns and dried fish for resale. She joined Yehu because of favorable loaning policies.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies of prawns and dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Dayyabu

texts.en:
Dayyabu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dayyabu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Dayyabu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Dayyabu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Dayyabu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Dayyabu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a fifty two year old woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She sells clothes in order to raise money for her family and has been in business for ten years. She endeavors to pay school fees for her children like any loving parent. Her customers are so fond of her and she is gifted with good customer care skills. Inadequate capital affects her business while her dream is to build houses for rent. Oliver intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Rerb's Group

texts.en:
Rerb’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Rerb makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chet's Group

texts.en: Chet’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chet makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en: Ra’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Ra grows rice to support her family. Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr: Adjowavi est une femme mariée  avec quatre enfants à charge. Adjowavi est âgée de 58 ans et vit à Baguida où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice de riz, du haricot et de la pâte bandée appelé « Kom ». Adjowavi s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Adjowavi sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de riz, de maïs et des tas de condiments en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à ses enfants aux besoins de la famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de ceux-ci.
texts.en:
Adjowavi is a married woman with four dependent children. She is 58 years old and lives in Baguida. She works cooking rice, beans and  a cornmeal dish known as "Kom" for sale. Adjowavi stocks up on  cooking ingredients twice a month at the market and sells her cooked dishes in front of her house. 

She is seeking this loan to buy bags of rice and corn and bowls of condiments in order to increase her sales and revenues. This will allow her to help support her family and improve her children's life conditions.

loans.use: to buy one bag of corn, three bags of rice and four bowls of condiments.

loans.name: Kimha's Group

texts.en: Kimha’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Kimha makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kimheng's Group

texts.en: Narin’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Narin makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely de 36 años vive en la comunidad de Atlántida, Honduras es una mujer muy emprendedora, junto a su esposo Fredy desde hace 12 años se dedica a la cría de cerdos y a la agricultura, con esta actividad llevan el sustento y suplen las necesidades de sus dos hijos. Ella  desea que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios con éxitos y puedan tener las mejores condiciones de vida posibles, pero en la comunidad donde vive no cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica por eso solicita a Soluz Honduras un préstamo para adquirir un Sistema solar para iluminación ya que en las condiciones actuales a sus hijos se les dificulta poder realizar de buena manera sus deberes escolares y a ella las tareas del hogar por las noches. Por lo que su sueño es contar con este sistema   para que sus hijos  puedan estudiar mejor y también para tener un servicio para cargar sus teléfonos celulares, y a la vez  ahorrarse  ese gasto.
texts.en:
Nely is 36 years old and lives in the community of Atlántida, Honduras. She is a very enterprising woman, and together with her husband of 12 years, Fredy, she works in agriculture and raises pigs. They make a living with this work and meet the needs of their two children.

Nely wants her children to be able to complete their studies successfully and to have the best conditions in life possible, but in the community where they live they do not have electric service. For this reason she is requesting a loan from Soluz Honduras in order to purchase a solar lighting system. 

In their current conditions, it is difficult for her children to perform well with their homework, as well as for her to do housework at night. For this reason, her dream is to have this solar energy system so that her children can study better, as well as to have a service so they can charge their cell phones, and at the same time save themselves that expense.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lighting system which will improve the living conditions in her home.

loans.name: Nheat's Group

texts.en: Nheat’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia.  Nheat grows rice to support her family. Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Martha Gladys

texts.es: Doña Martha de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica desde hace 17 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas e inicio con capital propio, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Martha is 53 years old. She lives in her own home home with her husband and their daughter. For 17 years she has made and sold pupusas. She started with her own capital. Her business is located in her residence in a very busy area. With what she makes from her sales she is able to pay for some household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy cracklings, cheese curd, beans, corn and other ingredients so she can continue with her work that generates good income for her.

loans.use: to buy cracklings, cheese curd, beans, corn and more ingredients.

loans.name: Eilyn

texts.en:
Eilyn is 35 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Eilyn has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Eilyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more pants, school uniforms, towels, and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Eilyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Eilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more pants, school uniforms, towels, and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mariedel

texts.en:
Mariedel is 38 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mariedel has a general store business in the Philippines. Mariedel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

Mariedel has been in this business for four years. In the future, Mariedel would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old, and four of her children are still in school.

Vilma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and gasoline for her boat and pay for boat repair.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and gasoline for her boat and pay for boat repair.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 61-year-old married woman with three children.

Teresita has raised livestock for 9 years and requests 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has previously borrowed 18 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Luz Bella

texts.en:
Luz Bella is a 47-year-old married woman with three school-aged children. Luz Bella works very hard to provide for them.

Luz Bella has run a general store for 3 years and requests 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, snack foods, and personal care products.

In the future Luz Bella would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda and is a hardworking man who runs a general merchandise shop. He sells sodas, bread, toothpaste, sugar, salt among other items. Using the proceeds from his retail business, he was able to start a mobile money business so as to be able to add on his income.

Tom has a great dream of buying himself a car for family use but lack of enough funds is still a challenge. He needs a loan to buy general merchandise like sodas ,bread, toothpaste, sugar, salt and many others to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, bread, toothpaste, sugar, salt for sell.

loans.name: Rit''s Group

texts.en: Rit’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Rit grows rice to support her family. Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una panaderia ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años ya que es un negocio familiar y es asi como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This young woman's face is pixelated because she is 23 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has had a bread bakery in her home for several years. It is a family business and this is how she ad her family have been able to get head. She lives in her own home with her life's companion and their two children. She is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, flavored jellies, molds, etc.,  so that she can continue with her work and have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, flavored jellies, molds, tins, etc.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself as determined. He has operated a photography business for 25 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local people.

He describes his biggest business challenge is the lack of efficient photography tools. He will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy a camera for his business. His business goal is to own a photography studio within 5 years.

He hopes to excel in the future. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to cater for family needs and open a video recording business.

loans.use: to buy a camera

loans.name: Francisca De La Cruz

texts.es: Francisca de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de comales y tambien posee una tienda, se dedica a esa actividad desde hace 20 años con las ganancias que obtiene es como ha podidio salir adelante con su esposo, Francisca esta solicitando un credito para la compra de comales por mayor y productos para su tienda y asi poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Francisca is 46 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband. She sells comales and she also has a store. She has done this activity for 20 years. With what she earns she has been able to get ahead with her husband. Francisca is asking for a loan to buy comales wholesale and products for her store so she can continue with her sales to have better income.

loans.use: to buy comales wholesale and products for her store.

loans.name: Los Pucarinos Group

texts.es: Lidia de 44 años es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Ella desde muy joven se dedico a la venta de ropas en un puesto del mercado. Su deseo mas grande es tener una tienda mas grande.El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería de de prendas de vestir al por mayor. Pertenecer al banquito "Los pucarinos" le ha ayudado a tener una mejor calidad de vida. Se siente muy agradecida con las personas de Kiva por ayudar a cumplir sus metas.El joven Dennis no esta en la fotografía ya que no asistió el día de la reunión porque tenia clases en su universidad. Lidia es la que esta parada con chompa rosada.
texts.en:
Lidia, 44, is married and has 5 children.  Ever since she was very young she has had a business selling clothing from a stall in the market.  Her greatest desire is to have a bigger store.  She will invest this sum in merchandise, buying garments at wholesale.  She belongs to the communal bank "Los Pucarinos," which has helped her to have a better quality of life.  

Lidia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for helping her to achieve her goals.  The young member of this group named Dennis is not in the photograph.  He was not able to attend the meeting that day because he had classes at his university.  Lidia is the one who is standing and is wearing a pink sweater.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a married 40-year-old woman with two children, both of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nilda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Nilda requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy new fishing nets and bamboo. It will also provide maintenance for her business.

Nilda has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and bamboo. It also provides maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 62-year-old window with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Virginia has had a general store for 3 years and requests 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy  groceries.

loans.name: Thunh's Group

texts.en:
Thunh’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Thunh makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money spent on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sok makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money spent on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Vuth's Group

texts.en:
Vuth’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Vuth makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money spent on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel to boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en: Vuthy’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia.  Vuthy grows rice to support his family. Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families,  save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families,  save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

texts.en: Sotheara’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sotheara makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nern's Group

texts.en: Nern’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Nern makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these individuals to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saroem's Group

texts.en: Saroem’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Saroem grows rice to support his family. Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself as focused. He is a cobbler and his business is located in a busy area.

He will use the 75,000 KES loan to buy shoe making and repair materials. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes to have good living standards and educate his children.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy shoe making and repair materials

loans.name: Vigilance

texts.en:
Vigilance is a married woman with 6 children. She describes herself as honest. She has managed rental houses for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local people.

She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use 40,000 KES to renovate her rental houses. Her business goal is to own an estate within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were successfully repaid. She will use the anticipated profits to build more houses.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Amarelie

texts.en:
Amarelie is a married woman with six children who works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business and is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy seafood.

Amarelie has sustained her business through 3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Arjely is 16 years old and is 2nd of three children in the family. Her mother,Anabelle, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business.

Arjely is studying for a bachelor of science in elementary education and is currently in the 1st of this 4-year course.

Anabelle is borrowing 11,350 PHP to pay for her daughter's tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2015-16.

Arjely plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Amevi Francoise

texts.fr: Amevi est une femme âgée de 47 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mariée et mère de cinq enfants, Amevi est une marchande de chaussures qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Amevi désire ce crédit pour financer son achat  des unités de chaussures pour femmes et pour enfants en vue de mieux revendre puis tirer plus de profit afin de bien contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Amevi is a 47-year-old woman who lives in Baguida.  She is married and the mother of five children.  She sells shoes and stocks up twice a month at the market.  She resells her merchandise from home and also as an itinerant seller in the surrounding neighborhoods.  She is taking this loan to buy women's and children's shoes.  Her goal is to increase her sales and profits so that she can adequately cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of women's shoes and 20 pairs of children's shoes.

loans.name: Sofrida

texts.en:
As a married mother with five children, Sofrida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store and is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy groceries to sell.

Sofrida has sustained her business through 4 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 57-year-old married woman with 9 children living in Liposong, Ozamiz City.

Jocelyn helped her husband to farm to make a living. She has been doing this this since she got married. Corn is their main source of income. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients with the amount of 5,000.00. In the future, she wants to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de cocos desde hace 18 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas cocos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y si tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Juan, 48, lives in his own home with his wife and his daughter.

He has earned a living for 18 years selling coconuts. His business is located in his home and he has a lot of customers. He has been able to get ahead with his family thanks to his job.

He's requesting a loan to buy more coconuts wholesale so he can keep on making sales and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts wholesale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single woman with 1 child. She describes herself as ambitious. She has operated a tailoring business for 10 years. Her business is located in a developing place and her primary customers are local people. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

She will use 40,000 KES to buy tailoring materials. She hopes to meet her family's financial needs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy  tailoring materials.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Jonathan is 23 years old and is the sixth of six children in the family. His mother, Haide who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through a livestock-raising business in the Philippines.

Jonathan is studying for a bachelor of science in criminology and is currently in the fourth year of this four-year course.

Haide is borrowing PHP 3,000 to pay for Jonathan's tuition fees for the second semester of the school year, 2015-16.

Jonathan plans to graduate and be gainfully employed so that he can help his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Sambath lives in Takeo Province and he is single. This man is working as a sales staff member to earn a salary to make a living. He has been involved in his work for one year.

Due to having not enough capital, he is now requesting a new loan from VisionFund to pay for his tuition fees with the purpose of pursuing his bachelor's degree in Information Technology.

He hopes that this loan will help him to complete his studies and get a good job.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees with the purpose of pursuing his bachelor's degree in Information Technology.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée résidant à Baguiuda avec deux enfants à charge. Abla est une revendeuse de charbon de bois et de maïs qui s’approvisionne quatre  fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Abla  nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs et de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en: Abla is a married woman who lives in Baguida and who has two children under her care.  She resells charcoal and maize and stocks up four times per month at the market.  She resells her merchandise in front of her home.  She is taking this loan to buy some bags of maize and charcoal.  Her goal is to increase her profits and to help her husband cover the expenses of the family.  She would also like to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy one bag of maize and two bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Chhailoeurn

texts.en:
Chhailoeurn is a 20-year-old single man who lives in Banteay Meanchey province. He grows rice and raises pigs to earn a living. He can earn 11 USD per day and saves about 3 USD each day after daily expenses.

His farming business is challenged by damaged caused by pests.

Chhailoeurn wishes to continue studying at the university. He requests a loan from VisionFund to pay for tuition fees and school supplies. He hopes that this loan will enable him to pursue his dream job after he graduates and to get a good salary to support his family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and school supplies.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey province, Svay Chek district

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería agrónoma, por medio de su profesión quiere poder crecer y salir adelante para poder ser un profesional útil para la sociedad.
Su meta es recibirse para poder trabajar en su carrera y algún día poder seguir estudiando para aumentar sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Jose is studying for his degree in agricultural engineering, through his profession he wants to grow and thrive in order to be a useful professional for society.

His goal is to receive his degree to be able to work in his career, and one day to be able to continue studying to increase his knowledge.

He is asking for this loan to invest it in his graduation expenses, and thus to be able to cover this expense that he has.

loans.use: to pay graduation costs.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
For the past five years, Martina has raised hogs to support the needs of her household. She is a 40-year-old married woman with three dependents, two of whom are still attending school.
She hails from the town of Sikatuna. Her husband works in the fields and grows rice.

Martina raises hogs and sells them to the locals and settlers in her town. This season, hog raising is in demand. That is why she decided to request a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI, to cater to her financial need.

Martina has requested a loan to invest in piglets, feed, and medicine. These are very vital in order to gain higher earnings. Then, she would be able to set aside enough savings to invest in any business opportunities.

Martina is looking forward to having a stable source of income in the future. She extends her thanks for the support.

loans.use: to invest in piglets, feed, and medicine.

loans.name: Ireri

texts.en:
Ireri is a married man with 6 children. He describes himself as honest. He has operated a farm for 15 years to grow beans and other crops.

His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are local people. He will use 95,000 KES to buy seeds.

His business goal is to expand the farm within 5 years. He hopes to be a role model for other farmers. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were successfully repaid. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy seed to plant.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 45 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Margie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Margie has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and she has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Margie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Sopha is a 40-year-old married woman who lives with her family in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She has two school-aged dependent children.

She grows rice and cassava as the primary source of her family’s income. She has been in this business for 22 years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 80,000 KHR per day and save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future needs.

This is the fifth micro loan for Sopha with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loans have enabled her to better support her family and her children’s education. She leads her group to ask for a loan and will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed.

She hopes to increase her current business, earn a larger income, and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Limousine Group

texts.en:
Lister, who is in early 40s, is married with four children; three are still at school and the rest are grown-up.

He has been running a butcher shop for six years. He works from 5:30 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Lister's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase items in his butcher shop and has managed to repay all of his loans successfully. He is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group, which is doing great now.

He used the profit to pay school fees, make loan re-payments and renovate his house. He will use this loan to increase the stock of meat and to buy supportive working equipment.

He dreams of expanding his business by adding a number of butcher shops. Lister will share this loan with his loan group "Limousine" which has two members who will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to replace out-of-stock items at his butcher shop.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Sangkae district of Battambang province, Horn is a 42-year-old married mother of four children, one of whom is still in school.

Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for ten years and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 47,000 KHR per day to meet their family’s needs. They manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Horn’s Group consists of three members who live in the same village. Horn has been with VisionFund for one cycle already, and the first loan has helped Horn to better support her family members. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Horn, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labour.

With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily. She also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Mita

texts.en:
Mita is a resident of Muniguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 35 years old. She has a small family with her husband and two sons. She and her husband are engaged with the occupation of a seasonal business. She has everything as per the requirements of basic necessities of life, permanent monthly income from an established business, a two-wheeler, and allied items to manage her family. Still, her family members are not happy due to the non-availability of a good RCC house that they own.

They are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent and without sufficient facilities. It is very difficult to leave during the rainy season. It is also very critical to stay during the summer and winter season. In this situation, she decided to construct a house with a good standard. She has already started to construct the house, but she does not have sufficient funds to complete it. So, she decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At this moment, Mita came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan to Mita for house construction. From the loan, Mita will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring, and coloring the house. She will also complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few months. It not only reduces the financial burden, but also helps Mita to feel proud to have an owned house in the society.

loans.use: to complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring, and coloring the house, as well as the wiring with an electricity connection.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and has three children. Josephine is married and has one child still in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Josephine has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
Ret, 35, is married and resides in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She has five children, two of whom are in school. To support their big family, she and her husband have been farming rice for 17 years and working for others for a fee. Their current business brings in about 70,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Low crop yields have been destroyed by insects. The damage to crops by pests is the main challenge for her business.

Ret has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle. She successfully used this previous loan to better support her family. It provided sufficient food and supported her children’s education. She is now leading her group in this request for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to pay for labour for harvesting rice. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business and earn a larger income to improve her family’s living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for labour for harvesting rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en: Yen’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Yen makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Roum's Group

texts.en: Roum’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia.  Roum makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Pramodini

texts.en:
Pramodini is a resident of Muniguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 35 years old. She has a small family with her husband and three children. Her husband has his own business of a tent house. Pramodini makes leaf plates and sells them in the nearest market. No doubt, she has everything as per the requirements of the basic necessities of life, like a small but permanent income, a two-wheeler, and other allied items to manage her family. Still, her family members are not happy due to the non-availability of a pacca (concrete) house.

It doesn’t mean that they are staying at an open place or thatched house. But, they are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent charged by the house owner. The rented house is made of mud and is roofed with asbestos, which creates a very critical situation during the rainy season. It is also very critical to stay during the winter period. The most important thing is that the apprehensive house is not completely secure and safe.

In this situation, she decided to construct a RCC (reinforced concrete) house for a good standard. She has already started to construct the house, but the fund availability is not sufficient to complete it. So, she decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At this moment, Pramodini came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan for house construction. From the loan, Pramodini will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring, and coloring the house. She will also complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few months, and she will be proud to own a house in the society.

loans.use: to complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring, and coloring the house, as well as  complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis es un hombre trabajador de 70 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de diversos productos en su vivienda, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes. Él vive junto a su hijo de 22 años de edad al que ha lograd sacar adelante, con mucho esfuerzo. Luis dese encementar el piso del corredor, pero lo que más le preocupa es encementar la pila de su vivienda para evitar que el agua se filtre y se desperdicie, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena y mano de obra para encementar la pila y corredor y cuidar el agua y sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis is a hardworking 70-year-old man, who works selling diverse products in his home. He has been carrying out this business for several years, and as such, he has many customers. He lives his 22-year-old son, whom he has been able to support with a great deal of effort.

Luis wants to cement the floor of his hallway, but what concerns him most is cementing his house’s water basin, so that the water doesn’t leak out and go to waste. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, and labor in order to cement the water basin and hallway, and to take care of his home’s water and health.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and labor to cement his water basin and hallway, and to take care of his home's water and health.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Teresa de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 2 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 66, lives in her own house with her family group. For two years, she has had a small store located in her place of residence. She sells a variety of products, such as candy, soft drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc., and she has many customers due to her good prices..

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale, since this is her only source of income. In this way, she will be able to have better profit and better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Cherine

texts.en:
Cherine, 25, is Lebanese, married and the mother of two children, who still attend school. Her husband, the family's main source of income, satisfies the requirements of life. He owns a fruit and vegetable shop.

Despite a bad financial situation, Cherine is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. She would use the loan to pay school fees. She says this loan would surely help her to register her children in a new school year, and that makes her very optimistic.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Kristine Joy is 19 years old and is studying Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education. She is currently on Her 4th yr. of this 4 yrs.-year course.

Her mother Alma is borrowing 7000 to pay for tuition fees of the 2nd Semester of the School Year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Kristine Joy plans to graduate and be gainfully employed..

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees for a BSc. in Elementary Education

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en: Ret’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Ret makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara es una mujer de 53 años de edad que vive con su padre y su hijo de 22 años de edad, al que ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a prestar sus servicios de cocinera, además vende productos de belleza por catálogo. Sara desea invertir en productos de belleza por catálogo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lociones, desodorantes, maquillaje, etc., para su negocio de venta de productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Sara is a woman of 53 years of age who lives with her father and her 22-year-old son, whom she has managed to raise with much sacrifice. She is a hard-working woman who offers her services as a cook. In addition, she sells beauty products by catalog.

Sara wants to invest in catalog beauty products, for which she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in lotions, deodorants, make-up, etc., for her business of selling beauty products.

loans.use: to invest in lotions, deodorants, make-up, etc., for her business of selling beauty products.

loans.name: Cheng Em's Group

texts.en:
Cheng Em, 57, is the married mother of six children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Originally from a rural village of the Chueng Prey district of Kampong Cham province, rice farming has been the family's main source of income for 37 years. To earn more income and better support the family, her husband works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 60,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs. They can manage to save about 40,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Cheng Em’s group comprises three members who live in the same village. This is Cheng Em's second loan cycle with VisionFund. Her first loan helped her better support her family. She is leading her group to apply for this loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She would also use a portion to pay for labour for harvesting rice. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and to pay for labour for harvesting rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rosa Dina

texts.es: Rosa a sus 64 años de edad se dedica a cuidar de su tienda de productos básicos, además ella cuenta con una granja de gallinas indias, lo que le permite sostener a su familia. Rosa vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 22 años de edad, al que ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Rosa desea invertir en su venta de productos básicos, pero principalmente en su granja, ya que en época navideña, las ventas de gallina india aumentan, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: granos básicos, gallinas indias, concentrado, vitaminas entre otros productos y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is 64 years old. She owns a shop selling everyday products, and she also has a farm where she raises Creole chickens, which enables her to sustain her family. Rosa lives with her husband and their son, who is 22 years old. With great effort, she has been able to get them. Rosa wants to invest in her sales of everyday products, but primarily in her farm because during the Christmas season the sales of chickens go up. This is why she requests a loan from FUSAI to purchase: staple grains, chickens, chicken feed, and vitamins, among other products in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her store and chickens.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman with four children. She describes herself as being committed. She operates a retail business, selling potatoes, onions and other vegetables. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. Her biggest business challenge is the high cost of products.

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use this loan, for 100,000 Kenyans shillings, to buy more stock of potatoes, onions and other vegetables. She hopes, in the future, she will have increased profits. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes, onions and other vegetables

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is a resident of Muniguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 23 years old. She has a small family with her husband and only one son. She and her husband are engaged with a grocery shop. She has everything as per the requirements of the basic necessities of life: permanent monthly income from an established business, a two-wheeler, and allied items to manage her family. Still, her family members are not happy due to the non-availability of a good, RCC (reinforced concrete) house that they own.

They are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent and without sufficient facilities. It is very difficult to leave during the rainy season. It is also very critical to stay during the summer and winter seasons. In this situation, she decided to construct a house with a good standard. She has already started to construct the house, but she does not have sufficient funds to complete it. So, she decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At this moment, Sunita came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan to Sunita for house construction. From the loan, Sunita will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring, and coloring the house. She will also complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

She is very happy to know that her house will be completed within a few months. It not only reduces the financial burden, but also helps Sunita to feel proud to own a house in the society.

loans.use: to complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring, and coloring the house, as well as complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

loans.name: Rafael Jeovanny

texts.es: Rafael de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de cocos desde hace 5 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas cocos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Rafael is 38 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their three.children. He has had a business selling coconuts for 5 years, and his business is located in his home.With the earnings he makes he manages to pay for some of their household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy more coconuts at wholesale so that he can continue with his sales and have greater income.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts at wholesale.

loans.name: Tiras

texts.en:
This is Tiras, a final-year student in Muranga University College studying for a diploma in Electric and Electronics.

His dream is to grow in the electrical department and one day own his own personal business and also support the society at large. His vision is to create employment in the county and to help lower the poverty level.

He currently is not able to meet his school fees, and with a Kiva loan he will be able to pay for his tuition costs and his non-tuition costs for his upkeep.

loans.use: to pay for tuition costs and non-tuition costs.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es: Maria de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 2 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como: refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, javon, detergentes, azúcar, etc. con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor y asi poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Maria, 49, lives in her own house with her family. For two years, she has had a small store located at her place of residence. She sells a variety of products such as: soft drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, soap, detergents, sugar, etc. With the sales she makes, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale in order to continue making sales to generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, soap, detergents, sugar, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus is a married man. He has one child. He operates a retail business where he sells mobile phones and their accessories. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 115,000 loan to buy more stock of mobile phones and accessories.

His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a resident in the town of Panglao. For many years now, hog raising has served as her main source of income.  She is a 58-year-old married woman who has seven children, one of whom is still attending school. 

She needs funds to support her existing project. She has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feed.  This will lead to improved financial gain as she continues to seek ways to become more sustainable.
She will be able to settle her obligations and thus manage her finances wisely.

With her previous loan, Lucia was able to pay it back successfully.  Now she has requested a new loan to expand her hog raising business to help ensure that the business will remain competitive in the future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores is 47 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Dolores has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothes to sell.

Ma. Dolores has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Merlita has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and ingredients for her business.

Merlita has been in this business for eight years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Thom province, Khoeurn, 52, is married and has three children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. He and his wife grow rice and cashews, which is their main source of income. They will also work for others to supplement their earnings. Together, they earn around 10 USD a day and can manage to save around 4 USD of it for future needs.

Khoeurn decided to apply for a 3,500 USD loan through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia to cover the cost of his son’s tuition and school supplies. He hopes to see his son gain in knowledge and become a wise man who will help his community and family in the future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of his son’s tuition and school supplies.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Allison Isabel

texts.es:
Allison es una joven estudiante de Administración Industrial, carrera que decidió estudiar porque le gustaba desde muy pequeño y tiene una gran visión a futuro cercano de ser una gran administradora y poder trabajar en importantes empresas.

Lleva estudiando ya un año y medio en su carrera, aún le falta año y medio para terminarla. Le va muy bien en sus estudios. Al terminar su carrera ella podrá trabajar y generar ingresos que le permitan apoyar a su familia en lo económico porque quiere ayudar a sus padres con la educación de sus hermanos menores, para que en un futuro, sigan el ejemplo de ella y puedan valerse por sí solos en la vida y no vayan por caminos equivocados.

La situación económica por la que está atravesando su familia es difícil, porque sus padres no tienen un trabajo permanente, lo que pone en riesgo la continuidad profesional de Allison. Es por ese motivo que, Allison recurre a KIVA en busca de un apoyo que le permita continuar con sus estudios y no truncar sus sueños de ser una excelente profesional exitosa. Este apoyo le ayudará a salir adelante y no dejar la carrera inconclusa por la falta de economía.

Su mayor sueño en la vida es ser una gran administradora, ver a sus hermanos llegar a ser profesionales a su madre despreocupada por faltas económicas y pueda estar bien.

Ella quiere dedicarles unas líneas a KIVA: "Su apoyo me da esperanza y alegría al saber que existen personas como ustedes que pueden ayudarme. Gracias a ustedes podré culminar mi carrera y apoyar a mi familia. Siento que puedo servir de mucho a mi familia, siendo una gran profesional. Gracias KIVA por todo lo que hacen!
texts.en:
Allison is a young woman studying industrial administration, a program that she decided to study because she has liked it since she was very young, and she has a great vision for the near future of being a great administrator and being able to work in important businesses.

She has already been studying for a year and a half in her program, and she still needs a year and a half to finish it. It is going very well for her in her studies. At the end of her program she will be able to work and generate income that will allow her to support her family economically, because she wants to help her parents with the education of her younger brothers so that in the future they can follow her example and be able to be on their own in life and not go down the wrong paths.

The economic situation that her family is going through is difficult, because her parents don't have permanent work, which puts Allison's professional continuity at risk. It is for that reason that Allison is turning to Kiva in search of support that will allow her to continue with her studies and not abandon her dreams of being an excellent, successful professional. This support will help her to advance and not leave her program incomplete because of economic needs.

Her great dream in life is to be a great administrator, to see her brothers become professionals, to see her mother without worries because of economic needs, and then she can feel good.

She wants to dedicate a few lines to Kiva: "Your support gives me hope and happiness to know that there are people like you who can help me. Thanks to you, I will be able to complete my program and support my family. I feel that I can go a long way for my family by being a good professional. Thank you Kiva for all that you do."

loans.use: to continue with her studies in industrial administration.

loans.name: Matsezi

texts.en:
Matsezi is a married woman. She has three children, all of whom attend school. Matsezi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is working capital on top of school fees and basic needs for the family.

Matsezi has operated a firewood and fuel selling business, selling from home to the general public for over five years. She faces a challenge of working capital, which has made her not be able to expand her business. She also sells groundnuts to increase her income, which has been rewarding her well and hence her reason for taking a loan.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to expand her business by purchasing more stock of firewood and groundnuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more stock of firewood and groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is married and has four children. For the past five years he has worked as a tailor, sewing and repairing clothes for local people. His shop is located in an area that is good for business.

Benjamin took out and successfully repaid a prior loan through Kiva's field partner SMEP Microfinance Bank. He has applied for a 80,000 KES loan to buy more materials necessary to his trade. His business goal is to be able to supply clothes to larger markets within five years and so will use his anticipated profits to build up his business.

loans.use: to buy more materials necessary to his trade as a tailor.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 35-year-old married Lebanese woman. She has five children who are all in school. While her husband works their farm and raises cattle, she works by dedicating herself to her home and family.

Today Mona has applied for a 575 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s school fees. What would make her very happy is to realize a brilliant future for them.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her five children.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells mangoes, soda, and shoes.
