She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sodas, fruits and shoes. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sodas, fruits, and shoes.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Sherlita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sticky rice, sugar, coconut, etc. for her food production business.

Sherlita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sticky rice, sugar, coconut, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a clothing retail store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like pants, school uniforms and plastic wares.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like charcoal retailing and restaurant businesses.

Marietta dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, school uniforms and plastic wares.

loans.name: Erick

texts.es: Erick es un joven de 20 años que vive en la comunidad de Intibucá, Honduras es maestro de educación primaria y trabaja en la escuela de su comunidad desde hace año y medio, en sus horas libres se dedica junto a su madre y hermanos al cultivo de café  para poder tener un ingreso adicional en su hogar. Una de sus mayores aspiraciones es poder seguir estudiando y obtener un título Universitario. Como maestro le toca realizar algunas actividades para preparar sus clases, las cuales tiene que hacerlas por la noche, pero lamentablemente se le dificulta mucho debido a que en la comunidad donde vive no hay servicio de energía eléctrica y deben iluminarse con velas o lámparas de querosén. Por esta razón Erick ha decidido solicitar a Soluz Honduras financiamiento para la compra de un Sistema Solar con el cual ya no tendrá dificultad en realizar sus labores docentes y mejorara las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Erick, 20, lives in the community of Intibucá, Honduras. In his free time he works with his mother and his siblings growing coffee so he can have an additional income in his home.

He's an elementary school teacher who has worked in the community school for a year and a half. One of his biggest aspirations is to be able to keep on attending school and to earn a college degree.

As a teacher he has to do some tasks to prepare his classes. He has to do them at night, which is very difficult for him because unfortunately there's no electricity in his community and they have to use candles or kerosene lamps. That's why Erick decided to ask Soluz Honduras for financing to buy a solar energy system so he won't have trouble trying to do his teaching tasks and he'll improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system to improve the standard of living in his home and help him in his teaching tasks

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom is widowed. She is the only wage earner for three children. She has experience in buying and selling clothes but now she is going to open a wedding dress salon. Dilorom took part in a course “To Get Ahead” of a women's organization and got a certificate. She will rent wedding dresses to local women. Dilorom is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy wedding dresses to organize her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses to organize a new business.

loans.name: Kom

texts.en:
Kom is 27 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kampong Svay district of Kampomg Thom province. She has one daughter to take care of, who is in school. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income. To make a living, Kom also runs a small business at home as a grocery seller to earn extra income, and her husband is a paid worker in the local area. Kom has been in this business for four years.

This is the first microloan for Kom with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan to buy solar panels for lighting her house. She hopes this loan will enable to her to have electricity for her family's use.

loans.use: to buy solar panels for lighting her house.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Alejandro Cruz

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 34 años de edad y vive junto a su madre y su hija de 14 años de edad, al que está logrando sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Él se dedica a la reparación de calzado y bolsones, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, con mucho esfuerzo. Alejandro desea cambiar las láminas de la pared de su vivienda, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: láminas galvanizadas, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar las láminas de su vivienda mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: 34-year-old Alejandro lives with his mother and his 14-year-old daughter, whom he is helping get ahead with a lot of effort. He works fixing shoes and bags, which allows him to support his family. Alejandro wishes to change the wall sheets at his home, but does not have the financial means to do so, which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheets, wood, nails and wire to change his home's sheets and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to  buy galvanized sheets, wood, nails and wire to change his home's sheets.

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.en: Zulkhumor was born in 1965. She is a smart and hardworking woman. Zulkhumor is married and has three children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. She has been busy with buying and selling fish for more than 10 years. Zulkhumor buys fish in bulk and retails them in a local market. She has regular customers in the local market and that’s why she is going to increase her working capital and in this way attract more customers. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy fish in order to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Adrián

texts.es:
Adrián es un joven estudiante de la carrera de Mecánica de Producción, carrera que decidió estudiar porque le agrada todo lo referente a la mecánica y procesos productivos. Le va muy bien en sus estudios, le faltan solo 7 meses para que pueda concluir con su carrera. Le dedica 45 horas semanales a sus estudios, tanto teóricos como prácticos.

Cuando culmine su carrera piensa trabajar en una empresa que le permita desarrollar una línea de carrera para desarrollar más sus conocimientos, adquiriendo experiencia para luego proyectarse a emprender una empresa de mecánica industrial.

El mayor sueño que tiene en la vida es: convalidar sus cursos con la universidad, especializándose en ingeniería para luego formar una empresa y apoyar a su familia.

Durante los últimos meses, la familia de Adrián estuvo pasando por una situación difícil en lo económico debido a que sus padres no cuentan con un trabajo estable. Es por ese motivo que, recurre a KIVA para que puedan apoyarlo con este préstamo y pueda así cubrir sus deudas pendientes. Este préstamo lo ayudaría mucho porque le daría la tranquilidad de pensar y dedicarse más a sus estudios y no preocuparse mucho por sus pagos mensuales, puesto que con su ayuda el pago le será más fácil.
´
Por último, Adrián desea expresarles unas líneas en agradecimiento por el apoyo que le están brindando:"Me siento muy feliz y agradecido que haya personas que sin conocer, apoyen para que uno pueda salir adelante, cumplir sus sueños y metas. Personas que a veces no tienen el recurso económico y se quedan a medias. Agradezco muchísimo, por esta ayuda que nos brindan, nos favorece mucho, no solo me ayudan a mi, sino también a todo el entorno porque con esta ayuda, estudiamos y nos permite ser más conscientes y más capacitados para tomar las mejores decisiones en todos los aspectos de nuestra vida. Gracias KIVA!".
texts.en:
Adrián is a young student of Mechanical Production, a career he decided to study because he likes everything to do with mechanics and production processes. His studies are going well, he only has 7 months left until he can complete his studies. He dedicates 45 hours per week to his studies, both theory and practical.

When he completes his studies he is thinking of working in a company that allows him to develop a career path to develop his knowledge, acquiring experience. Later he plans to start an industrial mechanical company.

His main life's dreams are: validate his courses with the university, specializing in engineering to later form a company and support his family.

During the past months Adrián's family has been going through a difficult economic situation as his parents don't have stable employment. For this reason he is resorting to Kiva so they can help him with this loan and in this way cover his outstanding debt. This loan will help him a lot as it will provide him with tranquility of mind. He can dedicate himself more to his studies and not worry so much about his monthly payments as with this help payment will be easier.

Finally, Adrián wants to express a few words of appreciation for the support he has been provided with. "I feel very happy and grateful that there are people, who without knowing you, support you to get ahead, achieve your goals and dreams. For people who sometimes don't have the economic resources and fall short. I thank you very much for the help you provide. It benefits us a lot. Not only me but the whole surroundings as with this support we study and it allows us to be more conscious and better trained to make the best decisions in all aspects of our lives. Thanks KIVA!".

loans.use: to finish his studies in Mechanical Production.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
Deisy es una mujer de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es amable, conversadora y muy emprendedora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘Juancho’ caracterizado por acoger a la población sobreviviente del desborde del rio años atrás, hoy convertida en el centro de producción manufacturera, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo.
Deisy es de tez morena, ojos pardos y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la disfruta en compañía de su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, actividad que realiza comprando ropa por fardos para separarla por género y exponerla en cajas o colgada en la pared, “anteriormente comprar ropa de segunda mano era relacionado con la pobreza, eso ha cambiado y hoy es una alternativa más de comercio…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque tiene demanda del sector. La ventaja de su negocio es que el precio de la ropa es accesible, la desventaja es la falta de vitrinas para exponer la mercadería. Su sueño es que su tienda sea conocida por muchos, ella desea comprar 2 vitrinas de vidrio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Deisy solicita un préstamo para comprar 2 vitrinas de vidrio para exponer la ropa a la venta.
texts.en:
Deisy is 35 years old. She is married and has two children of 10 and 18 years of age. Her business is selling second-hand clothes.

She is friendly, talkative, and very enterprising. She conducts her business in the "Juancho" neighborhood, which is characterized by taking in the population that survived the river's flood years before. Today, it has become a the manufacturing hub with a warm, tropical and humid climate.

Daisy has a dark complexion, brown eyes and a thin physique. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks at home. She speaks Spanish because of general culture, and at her work. She enjoys life accompanied by her husband, who works in construction, and her children, who attend school. They live in a rented room constructed from brick with a corrugated iron roof and a cement floor. The house has drinking water, electric power, and sewage. She works selling second-hand clothes, which she does buying clothes in bundles to separate them by gender and displaying them on boxes or by hanging them on the wall. "Before, buying second-hand clothes was related to poverty. That has changed and today it is a commercial alternative," she says. Her business is successful because it has a strong public demand. The advantage of her business is that the price is accessible. The disadvantage is the lack of display cases to exhibit her merchandise. Her dream is for her store to be well-known by many people. She wants to buy two display cases. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 7 years she has been working in this business.

It is for these reasons that Deisy is asking for a loan to buy two display cases to exhibit clothes in the window.

loans.use: to buy display cases to show clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de cocos desde hace 2 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, su suegro y su cuñado, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas cocos por mayor y asi poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man whose face is pixelated is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area. He has worked selling coconuts for the past two years. His business is located at his place of residence and he has lots of clients. With the profits he obtains he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He lives in his own house with his life companion, his father-in-law and his brother-in-law. He is requesting a loan to buy more coconuts wholesale and be able to continue with his sales to make greater income.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts wholesale.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: Natividad  vive en la comunidad de Intibucá, Honduras; tiene 36 años y desde hace 16 años se dedica a la agricultura de café, trabaja como empleado en una bodega de alimentos cuatro días a la semana  y además tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa el que es atendido por su madre, lo cual le genera un mayor ingreso. Él está muy satisfecho ya que con su esfuerzo ha logrado  darles buenas condiciones de vida a sus padres pero debido a que en la comunidad de Intibucá, Honduras donde ellos viven, no cuentan con servicio de energía eléctrica Natividad ha decidido solicitar financiamiento a Soluz Honduras para la compra de un Sistema Solar el cual le será de mucha utilidad ya que ahora no tendrá que iluminarse con velas o lámparas a base de querosén y además mejorara las ventas en su negocio ya que ahora tendrá más tiempo por las noche para  atender a sus clientes incrementando sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Natividad lives in the community of Intibucá, Honduras. He is 36 years old and as of 16 years ago has worked in coffee farming. He works as an employee in a food warehouse four days a week and also in a small business in his house that is ran by his mother, which generates a greater income. 

He is very satisfied because his efforts have achieved good living conditions for his parents. 

But because the community of Intibucá, Honduras where they live does not have electrical service, Natividad has decided to apply for funding from Soluz Honduras to purchase a solar system which will be very useful since he will not have to use candles or kerosene based lamps and also will improve the sales in his business since he will have more time at night to attend to his clients which increases his profits.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system for the home which will improve the living conditions of his family

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes continúa con su negocio de tienda de barrio. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para comprar estantes y abarrotes por mayor, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio trabajó constantemente. Actualmente su negocio cuenta con nuevos estantes donde organiza y acomoda los alimentos, el espacio que utiliza es pequeño pero existe la forma de ampliarlo para agrandar el ambiente y el negocio, “necesito ampliar mi negocio expandiendo el ambiente de mi tienda para que puedan entrar más productos y más clientes…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque cuenta con los alimentos necesarios para la canasta diaria. La ventaja de su negocio es que atiende todos los días y los clientes compran diariamente, la desventaja es la falta de espacio para ampliar el negocio. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, ella desea ampliar su tienda de barrio construyendo un muro. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lourdes solicita un préstamo para construir un muro para ampliar el ambiente de su tienda de barrio y darle seguridad.
texts.en:
Lourdes continues with her neighborhood store business. The loan she received she used to buy shelves and groceries in bulk. She made her payments on time because she worked at her business constantly. Currently, her business has new shelves where she organizes and places food. The space that she uses is small, but there is a way to expand it to enlarge the atmosphere and the business. "I need to make my business bigger, enlarging the atmosphere of my store so that more products and clients can enter," she says. Her business is successful because she carries the necessary food items for daily purposes. The advantage of her business is that the store is open every day and clients buy on a daily basis. The disadvantage is the lack of space to enlarge the business. Her dream is to better her business. She wants to expand her neighborhood store by building a wall. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in the year that she has been working in this business.

For these reasons, Lourdes is asking for a loan to construct a wall to enlarge the atmosphere of her neighborhood store and to give her security.

loans.use: to construct a wall to expand the atmosphere of her neighborhood store and to give her security.

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.es: María tiene 59 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de tamales de gallina y quesadillas de arroz, dicha actividad le ha permitido a María sostener a su familia. Ella habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 18, 17 y 14 años de edad, a los que han logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. María desea construir el cuarto para la cocina, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, madera, clavos y alambre para construir la cocina y contar con un lugar adecuado para preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en: María is 59 years old and makes a living by selling chicken tamales and rice quesadillas. This has allowed Maria to support her family. She lives in a house, which is her own property, together with her life partner and her 3 sons, who are 18, 17, and 14 years old, for whom they have fought with much effort to raise. María wants to construct a room as a kitchen, for which she requests a loan from FUSAI to buy sheets of metal, wood, nails, and wire to construct a kitchen and have a suitable place to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal, wood, nails, and wire to construct her kitchen and have a suitable place to prepare her food.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis, es un joven estudiante de la carrera de Mecatrónica Industrial, eligió estudiar esa carrera porque siempre le interesó saber el funcionamiento interno de los equipos, las tarjetas electrónicas, además de la automatización, el control de procesos y la robótica.

Está cursando el último ciclo de su carrera, le va muy bien en sus estudios, dedicándole 72 horas semanales entre clases teóricas y prácticas. Al terminar su carrera, espera poder obtener su título profesional y también apoyar a su hermano menor en sus estudios. A Jorge Luis, le gustaría trabajar en una empresa que se dedique a la Automatización Industrial y Programación.

El mayor obstáculo que presenta Jorge Luis, es el económico, porque debido a problemas de salud con uno de sus familiares, corre el riesgo la continuidad de sus estudios, por lo tanto, retrasaría la culminación de su carrera y no podría obtener su título profesional. Debido a ello, es que Jorge Luis recurre al apoyo de KIVA para que puedan apoyarlo en pagar las últimas cuotas de SENATI y el costo de su titulación. Es el primer gran paso que dará a nivel profesional y será la base para luchar por sus objetivos tanto personales como profesionales.

Lo que más desea en la vida Jorge Luis, es culminar su carrera exitosamente para poder formar su propia empresa y sacar adelante a su familia, que tanto hicieron por él durante todo el tiempo que duró su carrera.

Jorge quisiera expresarles unas palabras a los inversionistas de KIVA: "Me siento muy contento porque gracias a ustedes podré culminar mi carrera. Estoy muy agradecido porque sé que exiten personas e instituciones que apoyan mucho a los estudiantes como yo, que tenemos muchos deseos de superación, pero por el factor económico, muchas veces vemos truncados nuestros sueños. Gracias KIVA por todo lo que hacen por mi, no los defraudaré!"
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is a young student of his professional course at Mecatrónica Industrial. He chose to study this course because he was always interested to know about the internal functioning of equipment, electronic cards, and also automation, control processes and robotics.

He is attending the final semester of his course, and has done very well. He dedicates 72 hours to his studies weekly, between theory and practical classes. When he finishes his studies, he hopes to be able to obtain his professional certification and also help his younger brother with his studies. Jorge Luis would like to work in a company which deals with Industrial Automation and Programming.

The biggest obstacle in front of Jorge Luis is economical, because due to one of his family member's health problems, the continuation of his studies is at risk. Therefore, he would have to delay finishing his studies, and would not be able to obtain his professional certification. Due to this, Jorge Luis turns to the help of Kiva in order to be able to get help to pay the last fees of SENATI, and the cost of his certification. This is the first big step to a professional level, and will be the base from which he fights for his personal and professional goals.

What he desires most in life is to finish his studies successfully, to be able to establish his own company and move his family ahead, as much as they did for him during the time of his studies.

Jorge would like to express some sentiments to the investors of KIVA: "I feel very happy because thanks to you, I will be able to finish my studies. I am very grateful because I know that there exists people and institutions that help students like me who have many desires to overcome, but because of economic factors have fallen short of our dreams many times. Thank you KIVA for all that you have done for me, I will not disappoint you!"

loans.use: to be able to finish the final semester at Mecatrónica Industrial and obtain his professional certification.

loans.name: Maria Victorina

texts.es: Maria de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias para una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Maria is 38 years old and lives at home with her husband and four children. For 10 years she has been engaged in the making and selling of "pupusas". Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers. With the profits she makes she is able to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork rinds, fresh cheese, beans, corn and other ingredients, so she will be able to have better earnings for a better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase pork rinds, fresh cheese, beans, corn and other ingredients.

loans.name: Arquimides Antonio

texts.es:
Arquimides, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, no continuo con sus estudios por la falta de los recursos económicos, está soltero, vive con su papá, su mamá y dos hermanos.

Arquimides, trabaja como vendedor en una tienda del municipio desde hace 5 años, cuando salio de estudiar decidió buscar trabajo y en esa tienda le dieron la oportunidad de trabajar, para llegar hasta la tienda tiene que viajar en moto 15 minutos desde su casa y el horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 4: p.m.

Arquimides, necesita para colocar una tienda de productos básicos, porque tiene experiencia en vender.

Arquimides, sueña con tener una tienda más grande y reconocida para que los ingresos sean muy buenos para la familia.
texts.en:
Arquímedes, age 24, studied until his high school diploma, and did not continue his studies due to the lack of economic resources. He is single, and lives with his father, his mother, and two brothers. 

He has worked as a salesman in a store in the city for 5 years. He decided to look for a job upon finishing school because he needed employment, and he was given the opportunity to work in this store. To get to his job, he needs to travel by motorcycle for 15 minutes from his house, and his schedule at the store is from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. 

Arquímedes needs a loan to establish a store of basic goods, because he has sales experience. He dreams of having a big and renowned store, so that he will have good earnings for his family.

loans.use: to have a store of basic goods, because he has sales experience.

loans.name: Juan Usmaro

texts.es: Don Juan de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica al transporte de carga desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar y por los precios accesibles, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su pick up para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan is 56 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and son. He has made a living transporting cargo for several years. He has many customers he is responsible for managing with his time, and provides his service for reasonable prices. With the money he obtains from working, he is able to cover the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to purchase tires and provide maintenance to his pickup truck so that he can continue with his work and to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy tires and provide maintenance to his pickup truck.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel works hard to support her family. Isabel is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Isabel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Isabel has been in this business for 22 years now.

Isabel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 41 years old and married with four children; three of them are still in school. Ofelia works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, snack foods and other personal care products.

Ofelia has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 47 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Anna has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. Anna requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more frozen food to resell.

Anna has been in this business for six years. In the future, Anna would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more frozen food to resell.

loans.name: Seinara's Group

texts.en:
Seinara’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Seinara makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Sith's Group

texts.en:
Sith’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sith makes a living cultivating to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. His business goal is to have more motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have good living conditions and educated children.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Joséphine est une femme mariée vivant à Baguida. Joséphine a trois enfants à charge et exerce comme activité, la vente de produits de beautés à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Joséphine s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché. Pour bien tirer une bonne rentabilité de son commerce, Joséphine sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de rouges à lèvres et des unités de maquillages afin d’orienter l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et de prendre en charges certains dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Joséphine is thirty years old, married and has three children in her care. She lives in Baguida and sells beauty products from home and in the surrounding areas. She buys her stock twice a month from the market.

Joséphine has requested this loan to improve her profit levels. She will buy dozens of lipsticks and other makeup. Her profits will provide for the education of her children and certain other family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 25 dozen lipsticks and 15 units of makeup.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 58 years old and has two children. Yolanda is married, and one of her children is still in school.

Yolanda is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Yolanda has been raising livestock for eight years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Yolanda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a single woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Raquel is 39 years old, and her two children are currently in school.

Raquel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase new fishing net, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Raquel has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing net, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Met's Group

texts.en:
Met’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Met makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Jekafo Group

texts.fr: Issouf est le client qui tient la corne du mouton,âgé de trente-deux (32 ans) ans c'est un  embaucheur malien des ovins. Marié, père de trois (03) enfants. Il rêve dans l’avenir d’acheter du bétails pour ses enfants. Issouf n’a pas été à l’école mais il est très courageux dans son embouche. Sa femme fait le petit commerce d’arachide. Issouf a fait recourt au RMCR pour renforcer financièrement ses activités. Avec son prêt, il achète des moutons  et de l’aliment bétails dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Il les engraisse et les revend dans la grande ville.Un client du RMCR qui rembourse bien ses prêts fait un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA environ par mois. Issouf fait l’embouche depuis plus de 09 ans mais il a bénéficié du soutien du RMCR il y a plus de trois (03) ans. Grâce au soutien  du RMCR  ses activités marchent  bien. Issouf est satisfait avec son activité car il y gagne de l’argent et de la fumée organique pour ses champs.
texts.en:
Issouf is thirty-two years old and has been a Malian sheep farmer for more than nine years. He is seen in the photo holding the sheep's horn. Issouf is married and has three children. He dreams of being able to buy livestock for his children in the future. Despite never having attended school, Issouf is a good livestock raiser. His wife works as a peanut grower.

Issouf has requested this loan from the field partner, RMCR (with whom he has successfully worked for more than three years), to improve the finances of his business. He will buy sheep and feed for them from the weekly markets in his region. After fattening them up, he will sell them on in the main town. His loans have always been repaid correctly and he earns an average monthly profit of 65,000 francs CFA. Issouf is very pleased with his business as it generates good profits and also provides organic fertilizer for his fields.

loans.use: to buy sheep and feed and then sell them on.

loans.name: Sanlevo

texts.fr: Sanlevo est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Agée de 37 ans, Sanlevo est une marchandes des produits congelés qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché et le revend dans sa boutique sise à son domicile. Sanlevo sollicite ce prêt pour financer son achat de cartons de poissons et de poulets congelés en vue d’accroître son stock puis réaliser plus de bénéfices pour faire face aux besoins de son foyer.
texts.en:
Sanlevo is thirty-seven years old, married and mother to four children. She sells frozen products from the shop in her home. She buys her stock twice a month from the market.

Sanlevo has requested this loan to buy boxes of frozen chickens and fish to increase her stock levels and improve her profits. This will provide for some of her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of chickens and 5 boxes of frozen fish.

loans.name: Lossi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Lossi est une femme âgée de 59 ans habitant à Baguida. Lossi est une marchande des pagnes qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois  au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour ce fait, Lossi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes et gagner une marge bénéficiaire qui servira à venir en aide à son mari pour soutenir les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Lossi is fifty-nine years old, married and mother to four children. She lives in Baguida and sells pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) on foot in her local area. She buys her stock three times a month from the market.

Lossi has requested this loan to buy more pagnes to improve her profit levels. This will help her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 6 lots of pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing).

loans.name: Ayawa Véronique

texts.fr: Ayawa est une veuve femme âgée de 46 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Ayawa est une revendeuse de produits de liquidations qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier. Ayawa demande ce prêt pour commander des unités de chaussures de filles et pour femme en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir répondre aux attentes de ses clients et aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et prendre en charges les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Ayawa is forty-six years old, widowed and mother to two children. She lives in Baguida and sells bankrupt stock products in her local area. She buys her stock twice a month from the market.

Ayawa has requested this loan to buy shoes for girls and women and improve her profit levels. This will please her customers. Her profits will provide for the education of her children and certain other family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 15 units of shoes for girls and 30 units of shoes for women.

loans.name: Agossi

texts.fr: Agossi est une femme âgée de 31 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Agossi est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Agossi désire ce crédit pour financer son achat des sacs de farine de manioc en vue de bien revendre puis d’en tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Agossi is thirty-one years old, married and mother to three children. She lives in Baguida and sells food products from home and in the surrounding areas. She buys her stock twice a month from the market.

Agossi would like this loan to buy sacks of cassava flour to sell and improve her profit levels. She will then be able to contribute more to pay for her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 7 sacks of cassava flour.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Akouavi est une femme âgée de 45 ans qui vit à Baguida. Akouavi est une revendeuses des articles de mercerie dans sa boutique sise à son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner du nécessaire, Akouavi se rend trois fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander des rouleaux de doublures, des unités de viselines et de fil à coudre en vue de gagner un gain et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouavi is forty-five years old, married and mother to three children. She lives in Baguida and sells haberdashery products from the shop in her home. She buys her stock three times a month from the market.

Akouavi has requested this loan to buy rolls of lining fabric and lace fabric, and units of sewing thread. This will improve her profit levels and help her provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 rolls of fabric lining, 10 units of lace fabric and 10 units of sewing thread.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, Dédé est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida. Avec trois enfants à charge, Dédé est une revendeuse des objets de liquidation. Dédé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à sous un hangar au Port. Dédé sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de fer à repasser, des cartons de plats et des unités de sacs en vue de mieux revendre et satisfaire parfaitement les attentes de ses clients puis réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin d’aider son mari à subvenir aux charges et besoins quotidiens de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dédé is thirty-nine years old, married and has three children in her care. She lives in Baguida and sells bankrupt stock products from a stall at the port. She buys her stock twice a month from the market.

Dédé has requested this loan to buy units of irons, boxes of plates and bags to satisfy her customers. This will improve her profit levels and enable her to help her husband provide for the day-to-day needs of their children.

loans.use: to buy 5 units of irons, 2 boxes of plates and 5 units of bags.

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, Dovi est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida. Ayant trois enfants à charge, Dovi est une revendeuse de friperies et des objets de liquidation qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à un emplacement au port et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Dovi désire ce crédit pour commander des unités de friperies et des tas d’objets de liquidation en vue de bien revendre puis d’avoir des gains et pouvoir aider son marie à bien prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et de payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
39 years old, Dovi is a married woman living in Baguida. With three dependent children, Dovi sells secondhand clothing and end-of-line articles - she buys them once a month at the market, and resells them from a pitch at the port and around the nearby area.
Dovi is requesting this loan to order secondhand items and a stock of end-of-line items; with these she will have good sales and thus be able to help her husband with the family's daily expenses, and to pay for the children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 100 pieces of secondhand clothing, 15 pairs of secondhand shoes and 25 baby dolls.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Nelia works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional coffee, sugar, milk and utensils for her cafeteria.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional coffee, sugar, milk and utensils for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr: Salamatou est une femme mariée âgée de 35 ans résidante à Baguida. Avec deux enfants à charge, Salamatou est une revendeuse des tubercules d’ignames  qu’elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Salamatou désire ce prêt pour commander des unités de tubercules d’ignames. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne revente, Salamatou compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et celui de ses enfants puis à leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Salamatou is thirty-five years old, married and has two children in her care. She lives in Baguida and sells yams from the front of her home. She buys her stock once a month from the market.

Salamatou has requested this loan to buy more yams. When she sells them, she will improve her profit levels and be able to improve her business. Her profits will also provide for her day-to-day needs and those of her children.

loans.use: to buy 100 units of yams.

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en:
Phorn’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Phorn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and to save money on medical expenses. It will also save them time from having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Adjoavi est une veuve femme résidant à Baguida avec six enfants à charge. Adjoavi est âgée de 70 ans et est une revendeuse de charbon de bois et de farine de manioc qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Adjoavi nécessite ce prêt pour commander sacs de charbon de bois et des bols de farine de manioc en vue de bien revendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice puis pouvoir aussi relancer son activité afin de soutenir au mieux les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjoavi is seventy years old, widowed and has six children in her care. She lives in Baguida and sells charcoal and cassava flour from the front of her home. She buys her stock three times a month from the market.

Adjoavi has requested this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and bowls of cassava flour for sale. This will increase her profit levels, improve her business and allow her to pay for a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of charcoal and 50 bowls of cassava flour.

loans.name: Holali

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Holali est une femme mariée vivant à Baguida. Holali a deux enfants à charge et exerce comme activité, la vente de produits de beautés en parcourant dans les quartiers environnant. Holali achète ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché. Pour réaliser des bénéfices de son commerce, Holali demande ce prêt pour commander des cartons de pommades, de savons et de parfums afin d’orienter l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et prendre en charges certains dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
33 years old, Holali is a married woman living in Baguida.

Holali has two dependent children and sells beauty products door to door in the local neighbourhood.

Holali buys her goods twice a month in the market.

In order to generate profit from her business, she is requesting this loan in order to buy boxes of ointments, soaps and perfumes - these will allow her to fund her childrens' education and to cover some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy five boxes of ointments, five boxes of soap and three boxes of perfumes.

loans.name: Yert's Group

texts.en:
Yert’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Yert makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and to save money on medical expenses. It will also save them time from having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chheb's Group

texts.en:
Chheb’s Group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chheb makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families and to save money on medical expenses. It will also save them time from having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 47 years old and married with three children. She is managing a farming business where they plant and harvest rice to sell.

Estelita would like to continue to improve their crop production, and for this reason she is now asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming. This will help to improve the good nutrition of her crops, and it will one day give them profitable income which they can save for their family's emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.fr: Lucia est âgée de 38 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a deux enfants à charge. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires chez elle depuis tantôt cinq ans. Elle rêve de voir progresser son activité. Elle aimerait pouvoir gagner plus de revenus et offrir de meilleures conditions de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Lucia is 38 years old. She lives with her boyfriend and two children. She has sold food products from her home for nearly five years.
Her dream is to see her business grow. She would like to be able to earn more income and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: build her stock.

loans.name: Michou

texts.fr: Michou est commerçante. Elle revend des produits alimentaires à domicile depuis huit ans. Elle a quatre enfants. Son petit commerce lui permet de gagner un peu d’argent pour s’occuper de ses enfants. Elle demande un prêt. Elle souhaite augmenter son stock de sucre.
texts.en:
Michou is a trader. She has sold food products from her home for eight years. She has four children.

Her small business allows her to make some money to look after the children.
She is requesting a loan - she wants to increase her stock of sugar.

loans.use: to increase her stock of sugar.

loans.name: Marie Sophonie

texts.fr: Marie Sophonie, âgée de 33 ans est mariée et a 3 enfants. Elle vend des sucreries, une activité qu’elle mène depuis déjà 3 ans. Dans le but d’assurer la croissance de sa petite activité et d’améliorer ses ventes, elle a demandé un microcrédit. Cet argent servira à augmenter son stock. Elle espère gagner plus de revenus afin d’épargner un peu pour l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie Sophonie is 33 years old and married with three children. She sells candy and has done so for three years already.
In order to help her small business grow and to improve her sales, she is requesting a micro loan. These funds will be used to increase her stock.

She hopes to increase her income in order to build some savings for the children's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of candy.

loans.name: Berlin

texts.en:
Berlin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish and ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 15 years and also earns more income from food vending.

Berlin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF.

She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Toun's Group

texts.en:
Toun’s Group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Toun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and to save money on medical expenses. It will also save them time from having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lina's Group

texts.en:
Lina’s Group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Lina makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and to save money on medical expenses. It will also save them time from having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
40-year-old Hilda owns rice paddies, and she has been growing and selling rice for a long time now. She is married and has six children, all of whom are still attending school. She is striving hard to improve her income. Her husband also earns a living by being a carpenter and a farmer too. Together with her family, she lives in the town of Sikatuna in the province of Bohol.

Hilda would like to take out a loan to purchase rice seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides. These are really vital to her livelihood and will provide a bountiful harvest and enable her to earn more profit. Through this, she will begin to invest in other means of livelihood in order to support the needs of her growing children.

She is determined that in the near future her sources of income will become more productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Buy's Group

texts.en: Buy’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Buy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Cherly

texts.en:
Cherly is 53 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Cherly is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cherly has been farming corn for 10 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready-to-wear.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 52 years old and is engaged in retailing and a livestock business. She is married and has four children.

Narcisa is very happy because she is now reaping the fruit of her labor. Nacisa's two children are now working and sometimes they give her an allowance to support the family's daily needs.

With regard to her retailing business, Narcisa wants to extend the products she sells in order to earn more income. She therefore wants to take out a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy grocery items and soft drinks to sell. She will also use her loan to buy feed for her hogs.

Narcisa hopes to earn more income and also to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mardilyn

texts.en:
Mardilyn is 40 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mardilyn has a business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Mardilyn requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mardilyn has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Mardilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Saira Tomasa

texts.es:
Saira, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y juntos tienen 1 hijo que asiste a la escuela.

Saira, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace dos años, decidió este trabajo porque tenía una tía que se dedicaba a vender ropa también y ella fue quien la motivo a dedicarse a este negocio, sale a vender desde las 2:00 p.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. 

Saira, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para la época navideña, porque ella tiene clientes que le han encargado ropa. 

Los sueños de Saira, son poder salir adelante con su familia para que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Saira is 22-years old. She went to school until the 3rd grade. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. Together they have one child who is in school. Saira has worked selling clothing for 2 years. She decided to do this work because she had an aunt that worked selling clothing as well and she motivated her to engage in this business. She goes to work from 2:00 PM until 5:00 PM.

Saira needs the loan to buy clothing to sell during the Christmas season because she has customers who have ordered clothing form her. Saira's dream is to be able to get ahead with her family so that they do not lack anything.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Veronica Marleni

texts.es: Verónica tiene 26 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, en casa de su propiedad, por lo que se siente muy feliz. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, además presta sus servicios en una tienda grande, por lo que realiza sus ventas los fines de semana. Verónica desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, polines, pines, clavos y alambre para mejorar el techo y parte de las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Verónica is 26-years old and lives with her partner and two children, ages 2 and 5, in a house on their property which she feels very happy about. She works selling items of clothing, as well as loaning her services in a large store where she does her sales on the weekends.

Verónica wants to improve the roof on her home because it is falling apart. She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheets, poles, pins, nails and wire to improve the roof and part of the walls in her house.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, poles, pins, nails and wire to improve the roof and part of the walls in her house.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la venta de madera desde hace 5 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunso gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas madera por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Jose is 43-years old and lives in his own home with his partner. He has worked selling wood for 5 years in his business located in his home. He has many customers because of the good prices. With the earnings he manages to resolve some household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy more wholesale wood to be able to continue with his sales and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale wood.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 25-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one school-aged child. Her husband works hard to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. He owns a farm and raises cattle. As for her, she does not work. She is only dedicated to her home and kids. Today, she is in need for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child’s education fees. Her dreams are to ensure them a healthy life, to help them to achieve high educational levels and to always be able to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to pay her child’s education fees.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District, Pheap is aged 58 years. She is married with five children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living, and to support her big family, Pheap and her husband have been farming rice and growing vegetables such as cabbage and eggplant as their primary business for ten years and she can manage to earn about 48,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first micro loan for Pheap with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to purchase solar lighting. She hopes this loan will help her to reduce her electricity bill.

loans.use: to purchase solar lighting.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 46 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods, detergent, soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, soft drinks and biscuits to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent, soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, soft drinks and biscuits. 

Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, detergent, soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, soft drinks and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells goats. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the loan of 50,000 KES to buy an 8,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future she will have a healthy family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy an 8,000 litre water tank.

loans.name: Maram Group

texts.en:
Ayat is the featured borrower for Maram Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living standards at the same time.

Ayat is a 24-year-old married mother of one child. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she decided three years ago to help him in covering the needs of their family by working as a hairdresser. She is becoming well-known among her region for her professional skills. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a tattoo machine and new collection of cosmetics to better serve her customers' needs. Ayat is the lady in the middle. 

With respect to the other group members, Fatima is the lady on the left, and Rasha is the lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a tattoo machine and new collection of cosmetics to better serve her customers' needs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman. She is 51 years old with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Teresita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase a new fishing net and for maintenance of her business.

Teresita has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing net and for maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Analiza has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for 11 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Emerita

texts.es:
Rosa, de 42 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, porque sus padres no tenían los suficientes recursos económicos; actualmente está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y juntos tienen tres hijos. 

Rosa, trabaja desde hace cuatro años vendiendo tortillas en el mercado, para llegar al lugar donde vende las tortillas tiene que caminar 25 minutos; pero aparte de vender productos por catálogo, cuando ella sale de la venta de tortilla, ofrece los productos por catalogo; y las tortillas las vende de 6:00 a.m. a las 2:00 p.m. 

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar una plancha de cocina para hacer las tortillas, porque quiere colocar su propia venta de tortillas.

Los sueños de Rosa, seguir trabajando y obtener mejores ingreso para la familia y que sus hijos le sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42-years old. She didn't have the opportunity to study because her parents did not have the sufficient economic resources. She is currently married and her husband works in agriculture. Together they have three children. Rosa has worked for 4 years selling tortillas in the market. To get to the place where she sells the tortillas, she has to walk 25 minutes. She also sells products through a catalog and when she goes out to sell the tortillas, she offers the products. She sells the tortillas from 6 AM to 2 PM.

Rosa needs the loan to buy a cooktop to make tortillas because she wants to set up her own tortilla shop. Rosa's dreams are to keep working to get a better income for her family, and that her children are professionals.

loans.use: to buy a cooktop to make tortillas.

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora  Suyapa   de 51  años  de edad,  es soltera  no tiene hijos que dependen de ella y vive en casa propia ubicada en una  aldea  de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Suyapa se dedica desde hace 8 años al negocio de venta de frescos, jugos, churros, maíz, agua, etc. es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante con su familia, es discapacitada mas sin embargo trabaja fuerte y paga mejor que cualquier que tiene sus pies buenos. 
Doña Suyapa está solicitando el préstamo para compra de refrescos al por mayor  ya que viene la navidad y este producto se vende bastante, Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida así como su vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015.
texts.en:
Suyapa is 51-years old. She is single and does not have children who depend on her, and she lives in her own house located in the town of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras. Suyapa has worked for 8 years in a business selling soft drinks, juices, churros, corn, water, etc. She is a hard-working woman with hopes of getting ahead with her family. She is disabled but works hard and pays better than anyone who has working feet.

Suyapa is asking for a loan to buy wholesale soft drinks because Christmas is coming up and this products sells a lot. Her dream is to improve her business and quality of life, as well as her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2015.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Sreypich

texts.en:
Sreypich is aged 18 years and she is single. She lives in a village of Steung Meanchey district. To make a living, she has been working as a garment worker. She can earn about 12 USD per day and she can manage to save around 6 USD each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Sreypich has never been with VisionFund before. She is now asking for a loan to pay for her school fees at university. She hopes that this loan will allow her to stay in school so as to find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees at university.

loans.name: Nelta

texts.fr: Nelta, 46 ans, est mariée et mère de deux enfants qui se préparent pour entrer à l’université. Elle possède une petite boutique de produits alimentaires. La boutique est logée dans un coin de la maison familiale. Elle cherche un prêt pour investir dans l’achat de sacs de riz et des caisses de spaghetti.
texts.en:
Nelta, who is 46 years old, is married and the mother of 2 children who are getting ready to go to university.

She owns a small grocery store. The store is located in a corner of the family home. She is looking for a loan so that she can buy bags of rice and boxes of spaghetti.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and boxes of spaghetti.

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.fr: Marie Thérèse, âgée de 59 ans, est veuve et mère de deux enfants. Elle vend des vivre alimentaires et des légumes. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 21 ans. Dans le but d’assurer la croissance de son activité et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie, elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock. Elle espère ainsi vivre plus dignement.
texts.en:
Marie Thérèse, who is 59 years old, is a widow and the mother of 2 children. She sells food products, including vegetables. She has been doing this for 21 years.

She is requesting a microloan in order to increase her inventory and ensure the growth of her business, so that she can improve her living conditions. In this way, she hopes to live with more dignity.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food products, including vegetables.

loans.name: Jean Jorilus

texts.fr: Jean Jorilus est marié et a un enfant. Depuis deux ans, il tient un commerce dans lequel il vend de la vaisselle. Il demande un microcrédit afin d'augmenter son stock. A l'avenir, il espère développer son activité et proposer davantage de produits à sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Jean Jorilus is married and has a child.

He has been selling crockery for 2 years. He is requesting a microloan so that he can increase his inventory.

In the future, he would like to grow his business and to offer a greater range of goods to his customers.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of crockery.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie a 56 ans. Elle est commerçante. Elle revend ses produits chez elle dans un petit dépôt construit pour stocker ses marchandises. Elle veut développer l’activité. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter des gallons d’huile.
texts.en: Marie is 56 years old. She is a retailer. She sells her products at home, in a small warehouse that she built to stock her merchandise. She would like to expand her business. She is requesting a loan with which to buy a few gallons of oil.

loans.use: to buy a few gallons of oil.

loans.name: Fatima Lisseth

texts.es: A sus 19 años de edad Fátima se dedica a la venta de cereales, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder sostener a su familia. Ella vive junto a sus tíos en casa de ellos, desde hace muchos años, por lo que se siente muy tranquila. Fátima desea construir un cuarto y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda y de esta manera contar con un lugar propio para descansar.
texts.en:
At 19 years old, Fatima has been making a living selling cereals for two years. She is very happy that she is able to support her family. Fatima lives with uncle and aunt at their house. She has lived there for a many years and is content with the arrangement.

Fatima wants to build a room in the house. To do so, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron bars. With this room, she will have her own space where she can relax.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron bars in order to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Mirna Lizzeth

texts.es:
La señora Mirna tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ambos, vive en una comunidad de Trojes al Oriente de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace dos años al negocio de venta de productos de abarrotería en general.
Doña Mirna está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de  ser: arroz, azúcar, manteca, jabón, harina, espagueti, salsa,  limas, etc. es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante espera poder surtir mas su negocio y además desea realizar la compra de cerdos para engorde, con el apoyo del crédito pretende ampliar mas su negocio y  obtener más ganancias.
Uno de sus sueños es ampliar más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su familia.

Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015
texts.en:
Mirna is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children, both dependents. The family lives in the Trojes community, in the east of Honduras. The family owns a house. For two years, Mirna has worked selling groceries.

Mirna is applying for this loan in order to buy rice, sugar, butter, soap, flour, spaghetti, sauce, limes and more. Mirna is enterprising and wants to move forward. She hopes to stock up her business. She also wants to buy pigs to fatten up. Mirna hopes to expand her business further and earn higher profits with the support of this loan.

One of Mirna's dreams is to expand her business and to improve her and her family's quality of life.

Trojes, Honduras; November 2015

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, butter, soap, flour, spaghetti, sauce, limes and more for her business.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José a sus 23 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad, a los que está sacando adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Él para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una empresa cercana, actividad que realiza desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que se siente muy feliz  de poder sacar adelante a su familia. José desea encementar el piso de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para encementar el piso del corredor y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida, sobre todo por sus hijos a los que siempre busca proteger.
texts.en:
At 23 years old, Jose lives with his partner and two children, ages seven and five years old. He is working hard to move forward with his family. In order to advance, Jose has been working at a local business for a number of years. He is happy to be able to help his family.

Jose wants to lay a cement floor in his home. He is applying for a loan in order to lay a cement floor in the hall of his house and thereby improve his quality of life; he is doing this above all for his children, whom he is always looking to protect.

loans.use: to lay a cement floor in the hall of his house and thereby improve his quality of life; he is doing this above all for his children, whom he is always looking to protect.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and five children. Three of them are still attending school. Her husband represents the main source of income for the family. He works as a driver. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to be able to pay her children's education fees. This is her first loan but she has said that she will be a permanent client and is eager to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to be able to pay her children's education fees.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 58 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Angeles has a general store business in the Philippines. Angeles requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Angeles has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Angeles would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Aracili

texts.en:
Aracili is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aracili is 48 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Aracili has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Aracili requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

Aracili has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Aracili would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marie Louisilia

texts.fr: Louisilia, 38 ans, vit en union libre et a 4 enfants à sa charge. Elle vend des ustensiles ménagers depuis plus de 25 ans. Elle souhaite apporter un changement dans l’activité. Sur conseil d’une amie bénéficiaire du microcrédit, Marie a sollicité un emprunt. Son objectif est de développer son commerce pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Louisilia, who is 38 years old, lives in a common law relationship and is raising 4 children. She has been selling household products for 25 years. She would like to bring change to her business.

On the advice of a friend who has benefited from microloans, Marie Louisilia has requested a loan. Her goal is to develop her business in order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of household products.

loans.name: Marie  Mata

texts.fr: Mata est femme au foyer. Mariée et mère de cinq enfants, elle a entrepris de monter une petite activité chez elle afin de gagner un peu d’argent pour soutenir sa famille. Elle prépare et vend du café tous les matins aux passants de son quartier. Elle veut développer cette activité. Elle sollicite un microcrédit pour acheter su sucre et du café en grains.
texts.en:
Marie Mata is a housewife. Married and the mother of 5 children, she decided to start a small business at home in order to earn some money with which to support her family. She makes coffee and sells it every morning to passersby in her district.

She would like to develop her business. She is requesting a microloan so that she can buy sugar and coffee beans.

loans.use: to buy sugar and coffee beans.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom District, Lay is a 62-year-old married father of four children. To better support the family, he has been involved in rice farming for 42 years. The current business earns him about 28,000 KHR per day and he manages to save about 8,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

This is Lay’s first loan with VisionFund. He is seeking for a loan to buy a solar panel for lighting in his house. He hopes this will help him to reduce the utility bill.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for lighting in his house.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Therese

texts.fr: Thérèse a 46 ans, elle vit en union libre et elle a cinq enfants. Son conjoint est agriculteur et elle est revendeuse de produits alimentaires. Cette activité lui permet de gagner un revenu pour contribuer au budget de la famille. Elle demande un microcrédit pour diversifier et accroître son stock de produits alimentaires.
texts.en:
Thérèse is 46 years old, lives in a common law relationship and has 5 children. Her partner is a farmer and she sells food products. This business allows her to earn an income so that she can contribute to the family's budget.

She is requesting a microloan in order to diversify and increase her inventory of food products.

loans.use: to diversify her inventory of food products.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.fr: Sylvia est une commerçante avec plus de vingt ans d’expérience dans la revente de chaussures et de vêtements. Veuve, elle vit avec ses deux enfants.
