Grace à son petit commerce, elle arrive à couvrir ses dépenses la nourriture et les autres besoins de la maison. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
Sylvia is a retailer with over 20 years worth of experience in the sales of shoes and clothing. She is a widow and lives with her 2 children. Thanks to her small business, she is able to cover her expenses, including buying food and other necessities for the household.

She is requesting a loan in order to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to increase her stock of shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young woman's face has been pixelated because she is 24 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has a small store set up in her home and has been in business for several years. The profits she earns cover some of the household expenses.

She lives in her own house with her life partner and son. The loan she is requesting is to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. to earn more income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: José tiene 38 años de edad y vive con su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos de 9, 6, 3 y un año de edad,  de los cuales los dos mayores se encuentran estudiando. Él presta sus servicios en una avícola, actividad que realiza desde hace un año. José desea terminar de construir un cuarto en su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para terminar de construir las paredes de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Jose, 38, lives with his life partner and their four children, ages 9, 6, 3 and one year old.  The eldest two attend school.  Jose is a poultry farmer and has been in business for a year.  He wants to finish building one of the rooms in his house and has requested a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to finish the walls as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to finish the walls of his house.

loans.name: Anette

texts.fr: Anette est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de 3 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Elle vend des produits alimentaires au marché de Bon Repos depuis plus de 6 ans. Grâce à son activité, elle arrive à élever seule ses enfants depuis le divorce avec son mari. En dépit de ses lourdes responsabilités, Anette est dévouée à faire avancer son commerce. Elle attire un bon nombre de clients à faire leurs achats sous sa tente au marché. Elle veut agrandir davantage son commerce et mieux investir dans l’éducation de ses enfants. Elle a demandé un microcrédit en vue d’augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
Anette is 35 years old. She is divorced and the mother of 3 children who all attend school. She has been selling food products at the Bon Repos market for over 6 years. Thanks to her business, she has been able to raise her children alone since her divorce from her husband.

Despite her heavy responsibilities, Anette is committed to improving her business. She attracts a good number of customers to make their purchases at her stall at the market. She would like to increase her business further and to better invest in her children's education. She has requested this loan so that she can increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour and crates of oil.

loans.name: Maria Janneth

texts.es: María tiene 42 años de edad vive en unión libre su conviviente es radiotécnico, tiene una hija de 3 años Madison permanece con su madre  mientras ella vende caramelos en el mercado en un pequeño local todos los días hace 15 años llega  muy temprano con la aspiración de vender sus productos para obtener algo de dinero ayudar a su conviviente a cubrir los principales gastos del hogar. María necesita el dinero para  adquirir mercadería por mayor  mejorar sus ventas obtener mayores ingresos para poder seguir cubriendo las principales necesidades.
texts.en:
Maria, 42, lives with her common-law husband who is a radio technician. She has a three-year-old daughter, Madison, who stays with her mother while she sells candies at the market in a small stall she has been running for 15 years. She arrives at work very early with the hope of selling her products to make enough money to help her partner cover the main household expenses.

Maria is in need of money to buy goods wholesale to improve her sales and earn more income to continue covering her main necessities.

loans.use: to buy candies wholesale for his business.

loans.name: Edwin Henry

texts.es: Edwin es un hombre muy trabajador que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo y venta de ropa, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes que solicitan sus productos. Él a sus 39 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 13 y 14 años y el menor de 9 meses de edad. Edwin desea surtir su negocio, ya que viene la época navideña y desea tener suficiente variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa, productos de belleza entre otros productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edwin is a very hard working man who sells beauty products by catalogue and clothing. He has been in business for three years so he has many customers who request his products. He is 39 years old and lives with his life partner and three children, ages 13 and 14 years, and a nine-month-old.

Edwin wants to stock his business for the Christmas holidays in order to have enough variety to offer customers. Therefore he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy clothing, beauty products and other items to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing, beauty products and other items to offer her customers.

loans.name: Campeonas De Cristo Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Campeonas de cristo” y está formado por 08 integrantes responsables. Rebeca de 58 años de edad es casada con 04 hijos. Rebeca se dedica a la Agricultura. Desde muy joven se dedica  a la agricultura junto a su familia, gracias a su constante dedicación puede darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para su siembra. El deseo de Rebeca es tener un puesto en el mercado para así vender sus productos de la siembra. El grupo “Campeonas de Cristo” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de conseguir sus metas. Rebeca es la tercera a la mano izquierda del grupo con una chompa de color verde.
texts.en:
This is the solidarity group "Campeonas de Cristo" and it is comprised of eight responsible members. Rebeca, 58, is married and has four children. She works in agriculture and has done so since her childhood alongside her family. Thanks to her consistent dedication she is able to give her family a good quality of life.

The loan she has requested is to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crop. Her goal is to have a market stall where she can sell her produce.

The "Campeonas de Cristo" group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the opportunity to meet member goals. Rebeca is third from the left wearing a green sweater.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruth Germania

texts.es: Ruth tiene 28 años de edad es madre soltera, vive con su hijo Francis que tiene 3 años de edad  en las mañanas asiste a un centro de cuidado infantil, en las tardes permanece al cuidado de su madre en el negocio que inicio hace tres años atrás este ha sido su único sustento para los dos. Ruth necesita el dinero para comprar una maquina copiadora cree que así obtendría un ingreso adicional para poder seguir pagando la alimentación y el lugar donde vive con su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Ruth is 28 years old and she is a single mother. She lives together with his son Francis, who is 3 years old. He attends pre-school daycare during the mornings, in the afternoons he is taken care by his mother in the business office that she has started three years ago. This is the only income for the two of them.

Ruth needs the money to buy a copying machine since she believes that it will allow her to earn additional income to continue paying for the food and home where she lives with her little child.

loans.use: to buy a copying machine.

loans.name: Tujipe Moyo Group

texts.fr: Activité héritée de par ses parents, Espérance a été assisté longuement par eux avant que PAIDEK ne vienne faire la relève.  Elle reconnaît les bienfaits de la vente de pagnes car elle améliore la vie de son foyer. La difficulté majeure liée actuellement à cette activité est la situation de troubles qui prévaut à leur lieu d'écoulement qui est la capitale frontalière du pays voisin (Bujumbura). Cela joue énormément sur la qualité de ses ventes et a été contrainte d'observer quelques période de pause. Elle souhaite un avenir méilleur avec Paidek dans l'ultime besoin d'améliorer ses conditions de vie. Espérance est la plus jeune de deux dames sur la photo, étant au premier plan de gauche à droite.
texts.en:
Espérance inherited her business from her parents and was supported by them for a long time before PAIDEK took over. She recognises the benefits of selling pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing) because she is able to improve the life of her household.

Her business' main problem is linked to the current troubles going on in the area where she make her sales, the neighbouring country's border city, Bujumbura. The troubles severely affect the value of her sales and she has been forced to suspend business a few times.

She would like a better future with PAIDEK, her fundamental goal being to improve her living conditions.

Espérance is the younger of the two women on the photo and is sitting on the left.

loans.use: to strengthen her inventory of pagnes for resale.

loans.name: Tujimbere Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice fait partie du groupe Tujimbere  et  habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de 50 ans. 
Elle a 4 enfants s âgés de 18 à 24 ans dont tous étudient.

Elle a sous sa charge 4 enfants orphelins.
Elle  fait le commerce de chèvres et de vaches depuis 7 ans.  

Elle est à son  quinzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup  de chèvres  à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Béatrice is a member of the Tujimbere group and lives in Gitega. She is a 50-year-old widow. She has 4 children aged between 18 and 24 who are all studying. She is also raising 4 orphans.

She has been selling goats and cows for 7 years. This is her 15th loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her working capital and allow her to buy a lot of goats for resale, so that she can earn more money.

loans.use: to buy many goats for resale.

loans.name: Mushombe Group

texts.fr: Mushombe et son épouse Matuamini ont commencé à cultiver le riz depuis  1983 grâce à l'apprentissage qu'ils ont reçu de leurs parents et amis. Ce qui plait aujourd'hui à Mushombe est l'ensemble de réalisations déjà enregistrées grâce à cette activité. Comme obstacle, Mushombe cite l'insuffisance de moyens financiers à sa disposition; mais cela ne l'empêche pas de songer à élargir son espace cultural jusqu'à atteindre 4 hectares pour le riz et 2 hectares pour les autres cultures. Pour lui, cela pourra faciliter la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mushombe and his wife Matuamini started growing rice in 1983 thanks to the training they received from their parents and their friends. What makes Mushombe happy today is the amount of accomplishments they have already achieved thanks to their business.

Mushombe states that his main obstacle is the amount of funds he has at his disposal, but that does not stop him from thinking about expanding his cultivation area to 4 hectares for rice and 2 hectares for other produce. This would help him ensure his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, to pay for weeding, transplanting and for the manual labour needed during the harvest.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Emily works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running a general store. Emily is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nyambere Group

texts.fr:
Suavis fait partie du groupe Nyambere et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 38 ans et est mariée à Paul un cultivateur. 

Elle  fait le commerce de pommes de terre depuis 6 ans.  

Elle est à son  quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de pommes de terre  à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Suavis is a member of the Nyambere group and lives in Gitega. She is 38 years old and married to Paul, a farmer.

She has been selling potatoes for 6 years. This is her 4th loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her working capital and allow her to buy a large quantity of potatoes for resale, so that she can earn more money.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en: Jefferson is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells water storage containers, mattresses, flasks and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the loan of 40,000 KES to buy more stock of mattresses, jugs, flasks, containers and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will provide for his family's financial needs. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mattresses, jugs, flasks, containers and other items.

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Ann is 35 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Ann is representing her group of 12 farmers in Teso District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Ann's desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Ann and her group will receive a total of 2 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 8 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests.

loans.name: Erlie

texts.en:
Erlie is 50 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business of pig-fattening in the Philippines. Erlie requested a loan of 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Erlie has been in the business of pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Erlie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jeannette Group

texts.fr: Quand mon mari est mort, il m'avait laissé un montant de deux cents dollars que j'ai investi dans la vente du poisson jusqu'aujourd'hui." raconte Jeannette. Dans son activité, elle se plaint de la mévente et du vol lors de l'achat par kilogramme. Elle a pour souhait que son activité prospère pour assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants et le désir de pouvoir se construire une maison sur la route principale où elle pourra établir son point de vente. Sur photo, Jeannette porte une blouse multicolore avec un pagne.
texts.en:
"When my husband died, he left me 200 hundred dollars which I invested in a business selling fish, which I still run today", says Jeanette. Her business currently suffers from poor sales and she can be robbed when buying fish by the kilo. She wants her business to prosper so that she can ensure her children's education and build a house on the main road where she could also set up a point of sales.

On the photo, Jeannette is wearing a multi-colour top and a pagne (print skirt).

loans.use: to buy salted fish for resale.

loans.name: Marie Audanie

texts.fr: Audanie, âgée de 29 ans, est une femme mariée qui a un enfant commençant à peine à être scolarisé. Afin de générer des revenus pour prendre soin de sa famille, elle exerce un petit commerce de vente de produits alimentaires. Audanie souhaite agrandir cette activité, c'est pourquoi elle cherche un financement.
texts.en: Marie Audanie, who is 29 years old, is a married woman with a child who is just starting school. In order to earn an income and take care of her family, she runs a small business selling food products. Audanie would like to expand her business, which is why she is looking for financing.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of food products.

loans.name: Marjorie Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive la señora Marjorie tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 7 y 2 años  de edad, los dos mayores estudian en universidad y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Marjorie es una muy buena esposa que junto a su marido tienen una pequeña microempresa en su casa, ellos procesan maní el mismo que luego llevan a entregar a varias ciudades como Guayaquil, Naranjal, Milagro, La Troncal entre otros lugares en los cuales cuentan con muy buena clientela, su marido  recorre los campos y lugares donde compra al por mayor y a precios más bajos y luego ya en su casa procesan el maní el, ellos llevan más de 8 años en este negocio el cual les deja muy buenos ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar maní. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les da el Grupo. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every fortnight in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí and known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Grupo De Crédito Alfa meet.

This is where Marjorie lives. She is 40 years old, married and has three children from this relationship who are 19, 7 and 2 years old. The two eldest study at university and and the youngest goes to school. Her husband is a businessman.

Marjorie is a good wife who runs a small micro business processing peanuts together with her husband. They deliver peanuts to many cities such as Guayaquil, Naranjal, Milagro and La Troncal, amongst others, and they have a very good clientele. Her husband travels around the countryside and to other places where he buys peanuts in bulk at lower prices and then once at home they process the peanuts. They have spent eight years in this business and it has provided them with a good income.

This loan will be used to buy peanuts. Marjorie has been with Grupo De Crédito for three loan cycles and she likes it because of the support the group offers her. Her dream is to give everything to her children.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Daysi Guadalupe

texts.es: Daysi es una mujer trabajadora de 22 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de tortas mexicanas y bebidas, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años, y le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Ella vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar. Daysi desea invertir en su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pan, jamón, queso, carne, tomates, bebidas, entre otros productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Daysi is a hardworking 22 year old woman who works selling Mexican sandwiches and drinks. She has done this for the last five years which has allowed her to bring up her family. She lives in her own home with her family.

Daysi would like to invest in her store which is why she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy bread, ham, cheese, meat, tomatoes, drinks and other products for her store.

loans.use: to buy bread, ham, cheese, meat, tomatoes, drinks and other products for her store.

loans.name: Andrelie

texts.fr: Andrelie est âgée de 64 ans.  Elle est veuve et mère de deux enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une petite boutique de produits alimentaires. Elle y vend du lait, du sucre, de la farine des spaghettis, de l’huile, etc. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Andrelie is 64 years old. She is a widow and the mother of two children. She owns a small shop in which she sells food products like milk, sugar, flour, spaghetti, and oil. She is requesting a loan so that she can increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy spaghetti and milk.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen is 45 years old and has 7 children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Hellen is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Teso District, Kenya.

Hellen started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Hellen’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 9 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Marie Monise

texts.fr: Monise est mère de deux enfants. Elle vit en union libre. Elle revend des produits alimentaires chez elle depuis huit ans. Son rêve est de devenir une grande commerçante grossiste et avoir assez d’argent pour prendre bien soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Marie Monise is the mother of 2 children. She lives in a common law relationship. She has been selling food products from her home for 8 years. Her dream is to become a large wholesaler and to have enough money with which to take care of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food products.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 23-year-old married mother of one child. She decided to start her own business in 2014, by opening her own shop for vending faux bijoux with her special selling methods and providing a high quality of products. She is well-known in her region now with the special talents in her domain, in addition to the customer care she offers. Today, Najwa is demanding a third loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to increase her business merchandise to meet the needs of her clients in order to increase her income. She hopes to enlarge her shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.fr: Beatrice, 40 ans, est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle fait le commerce de chaussures. Elle a beaucoup d’expériences dans la vente en détail. Cela fait déjà 10 qu’elle s’y adonne. Elle veut augmenter son stock, c’est pour cela qu’elle a fait cette demande de crédit.
texts.en: Beatrice, who is 40 years old, is married and the mother of 2 children. She sells shoes. She has a lot of experience as a retailer; she has been in this line of work for 10 years already. She would like to increase her inventory, which is why she is requesting this loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of shoes.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.fr: Marjorie a 31 ans. Elle est célibataire et sans enfants. Esthéticienne de formation, elle a décidé d’ouvrir un petit salon de beauté. Le salon se trouve tout près de chez elle. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter des défrisants pour cheveux.
texts.en: Marjorie is 31 years old. She is single and has no children. A trained beautician, she decided to open a small beauty salon. It is located very near her place. She is requesting a loan with which to buy hair-straightening products.

loans.use: to buy hair-straightening products.

loans.name: Pllumb

texts.en:
Pllumb or 'Pigeon' in English is a married father of four. His children range in age between 7 and 15 years old. He has been photographed with the three younger ones. He has been running a grocery store for about two and a half years now, and the reason for this loan is that he wants to stock up on inventory and replace a cash register. Even though he lives in a village, he does not own land which he would consider as a source of income. In the 2,000 square meters yard that he does have, he can only plant for the family's consumption and he has some orchards which are also for family use. 

From the store activity he makes approximately 200 USD per month; income that is considered the monthly minimum here in Albania. His wife works in a shoe factory for 102 USD a month which is way below the minimum. 

Pllumb's family lived in Greece for long time until three years ago when the Greek economy crashed and they lost their jobs. With the little savings they had, they built the store and on the second floor is their home.

loans.use: to stock up the grocery store with inventory items and replace a cash register.

loans.name: Samrach

texts.en: Living in a wooden house located in the Stoeng Meanchey district, Samrach is aged 21 years and single. Currently, he is selling various kinds of vegetables with his mother at the market nearby his house. He is able to earn approximately 5 USD per day to better support his family. This is the first micro loan for Samrach with VisionFund. He is applying for a loan to pay for his school fees. He hopes that this loan will enable him to stay in school until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr: Yolande vend des vêtements usagés. Grace à cette activité, elle trouve de l’argent pour envoyer ses enfants à l’école et pour nourrir la famille. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Yolande sells second-hand clothing. Thanks to this business, she can afford to send her children to school and to feed her family. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila was born in 1966. She is married and her children are adults. Jamila is a very hardworking woman. She has her own business dealing with animal husbandry more than 12 years. Jamila mainly feeds cows. Now, she has 3 cows and she is going to increase the number of cows she feeds. Jamila is asking for a loan of 6,000 TJS to buy cows. She awaits your mercy. This loan will help to develop her business in a rural area of Tajikistan.

loans.use: to buy cows to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Adrienne

texts.fr: Adrienne, âgée de 40 ans, est mariée et mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Elle vend des produits cosmétiques au marché public de la zone. Grâce à cette activité, Adrienne arrive à prendre soin de sa famille. Elle sollicite un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock. Adrienne veut augmenter son revenu et pouvoir épargner pour les études de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adrienne, who is 40 years old, is married and the mother of 3 children who all go to school. She sells cosmetics at the public market in the free trade zone. Thanks to this business, Adrienne is able to take care of her family. She is requesting a microloan so that she can increase her inventory. Adrienne would like to increase her income and to be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Linda

texts.fr: Linda, 39 ans, revend des boissons gazeuses. Elle est dans cette activité depuis treize ans. Elle est une commerçante très connue dans son quartier. Elle a aussi beaucoup de clients réguliers. Elle cherche du financement pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Linda, who is 39 years old, sells soft drinks. She has been in this line of work for 13 years. She is a very well-known seller in her district. She also has a lot of regular customers. She is looking for a loan so that she can increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase her stock of soft drinks.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cows. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the loan of 50,000 KE to buy more cows. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Blanca Susana

texts.es: Blanca tiene 55 años de edad de estado civil casada vive con su esposo que se dedica al jornal tiene una hija Karen de 17 años de edad estudia en un colegio gratuito del sector, ella recuerda que desde los diez años de edad tuvo que abandonar sus estudios para labrar la tierra por la falta de dinero hoy aspira que su historia no vuelva a repetirse. Blanca necesita el dinero para comprar abono  mejoraría así su producción de papa, obtendría mejores ingresos para seguir ayudando a su esposo a cubrir los principales gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca is 55 years old, married and lives with her husband who works as a labourer. She has a 17 year old daughter, Karen, who studies at a free high school in the area. Blanca recalls that when she was 10 years old she had to stop studying to work on the land due to a lack of money and she doesn't want history to repeat itself.
Blanca needs this loan to buy fertiliser which would improve her potato crop and give her a higher income so she can continue to help her husband to cover the main household bills.

loans.use: to buy fertiiser to improve her crops

loans.name: Bency

texts.fr: Bency a 33 ans. Elle est mariée et a deux enfants. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques. Pour éviter des ruptures de stock, elle utilise des microcrédits qui lui permettent de renouveler régulièrement son stock. Elle souhaite voir progresser son activité.
texts.en: Bency is 33 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She sells beauty products. In order to avoid stock shortages, she uses microloans which enable her to renew her stock on a regular basis. She would like to see her business develop.

loans.use: to increase her stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Joceline

texts.fr: Joceline est commerçante. Elle revend des produits alimentaires. Cette activité est son gagne-pain. C’est ainsi qu’elle gagne un peu d’argent pour prendre soin de sa famille. Elle utilise les microcrédits pour renouveler son stock.
texts.en: Joceline is a retailer. She sells food products. This business is her livelihood. It is how she is able to earn a bit of money with which to take care of her family. She uses microloans to renew her inventory.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food products.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon Jairo, es un joven estudiante que vive junto a sus padres, hermanos y tía. Su padre es operario de sistema drywall, su madre es cocinera. Ambos no cuentan con un trabajo estable, sus ingresos no son fijos.

Él estudia la carrera de Control de Calidad Textil, decidió estudiar esa carrera porque desea ampliar el conocimiento en el área textil ya que anteriormente llevó cursos de Mecánico Textil. Estos complementos le permitirán especializarse cada vez más y así podrá ejercerlos profesionalmente. Esta carrera le permitirá brindar mejor calidad a su familia, porque es una de las carreras más demandadas en la actualidad acá en Perú.

Le va muy bien en sus estudios, le dedica 35 horas semanales, le faltan 2 años y medio para poder culminarla. Cuando termine su carrera le gustaría trabajar en una importante empresa del rubro, específicamente como encargado de desarrollo de tela y Control de Calidad.

Debido a la difícil situación por la cual está atravesando su familia (los bajos ingresos por parte de los padres), Jhon recurre a KIVA para que puedan apoyarlo con la cancelación de sus deudas pendientes, dándole así la tranquilidad a sus padres de ver a su hijo culminar su carrera en el tiempo estimado. El terminar su carrera lo permitirá brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, teniendo mejores oportunidades laborales.

Jhon, desea expresarles unas líneas de agradecimiento a los inversionistas de KIVA por el apoyo brindado: "Me siento muy feliz y agradecido por el apoyo que me están brindando, no los defraudaré y les deseo muchos éxitos en todo. Gracias KIVA por permitirme cumplir mis sueños de continuar estudiando para convertirme en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Jhon Jairo is a young student who lives with his parents, siblings and aunt. His father is a drywall system operator, his mother is a cook. Neither of them have stable jobs and their income isn't set.

He is studying Textile Quality Control. He decided to study this major because he wants to expand his knowledge of textiles, since previously he took classes in Textile Mechanics. These classes will allow him to specialize even more and practice his profession. This major will also allow to bring his family a better quality of life, because it is one of the majors that is most in demand now in Peru.

It is going very well for him in his studies. He spends 35 hours a week at it and has 2 years and a half left to go. When he finishes his major he would like to work at an important company in the area, in charge if fabric development and Quality Control.

Due to the difficult situation his family is going through (his parents' low income), Jhon is turning KIVA so they can help him pay off his pending debts, thus giving his parents the peace of mind of seeing their son finish his major in the estimated time. Finishing his major will allow him to offer his family a better quality of life with better work opportunities.

Jhon wants to say some words of gratitude to the KIVA investors for the support offered: "I feel very happy and grateful for the support I am being offered, I will not let you down and I wish you success in everything. Thank you, KIVA, for letting me make my dream come true of continuing to study to become a great professional.

loans.use: to continue studying Textile Quality Control and become an excellent professional.

loans.name: Señor De Tinya Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Señor de Tinya” y está formado por 05 integrantes responsables y emprendedores. Rita de 44 años de edad es casada con 3 hijos. Rita se dedica a la Agricultura y a la vez a la ganadería. Hace más de 05 años que se dedica a la agricultura, gracias a su constante dedicación puede darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para su siembra. El deseo de Rita es contar con un terreno mas amplio para seguir sembrando en cantidad. El grupo “Señor de Tinya” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de lograr sus metas. Rita es la que esta al medio del grupo con una chompa de color marrón.
texts.en: The Señor de Tinya village bank has five responsible, motivated members. Rita, 44 years old, is married and has three children. She makes a living in agriculture and livestock. She has been a farmer for more than five years, and her constant dedication has allowed her to improve her family's quality of life. She is requesting this loan so she can buy chemical and organic fertilizers for her crops. Rita's dream is to acquire a larger plot of land so she can grow her crops in larger quantities. The Señor de Tinya village bank is grateful to Kiva investors for giving them the opportunity to achieve their goals. In the photo, Rita is in the center of the group wearing a brown jacket.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Eliana Vanessa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive la señora Eliana tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 7 y 2 años  de edad, los dos mayores estudian en universidad y escuela. Su esposo es médico.
Eliana es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo propio y así generar sus propios ingresos, ella se dedica al comercio, compra y vende pescado  y queso por libras o al por mayor, ella recibe en su casa tanto el pescado como el queso el mismo que luego ella vende ya sea al público en general o comerciantes a quienes surte día a día, lleva 2  años en esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse lo suyo y que comenzó gracias al primer crédito que recibió del grupo. 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado y queso. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Every fortnight in Portoviejo, known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds and the capital of Manabí, the members of the Grupo De Crédito Alfa (Alfa loan group) meet.

This is where Eliana lives. She is 40 years old, married and has three children from this relationship who are 19, 7 and 2 years old. The two eldest study at university and the younger one goes to school. Her husband is a doctor.


Eliana is a woman who likes to make her own money and generate her own income. She works in business, buying and selling fish and cheese by the pound or in bulk. She receives deliveries of fish as well as cheese at home which she later resells, either to the general public or to the traders that she supplies day after day. Eliana has spent two years in this business which has allowed her to make her own income. She began this job thanks to the first loan that she received from the group.

This loan will be used to buy fish and cheese. Eliana has been with the Grupo De Crédito loan group for two years and she likes it because of the help the loans give her. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and cheese

loans.name: Dana

texts.en:
Dana is a 22-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one school-age child. Her husband represents the main source income. As for her, she is still attending university. She is very tender and cares a lot about all of her family members.

Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her university educational fees. She said that she is very happy with the loan that will allowed her to continue her education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her university educational fees.

loans.name: Bigen

texts.en:
Bigen, 43, is a married woman with five children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Bigen has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Bigen requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

In the future, Bigen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Mala

texts.en:
From Samraong Tong District, Kampong Speu Province, Mala, 52 years old, is an experienced and industrious farmer. Her husband is also a farmer. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, they can earn around USD 4 a day to support their family. She is a lovely mother of two married children and one unmarried child who is working in a factory.

To improve living conditions and to accelerate her farming process, Mala needs some money to buy cows to help her for plowing the farmland, yet she can’t afford them. Due to the shortage of money, she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to support her goal.

She thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy cows to help her for plowing the farmland.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Oumarou est un malien âgée de 26 ans, marié père d’un enfant âgé d’un an (01), l’enfant n’a pas l’âge requit d’être scolarisé, et sa femme fait le ménage à la maison.
Oumarou est un éleveur courageux dans son activité n’ayant pas assez de fonds crédits pour le progrès de son élevage de moutons à fait recours à l’IMF pour avoir accès à un financement plus conséquent dans le but d’acheter plus de moutons et d’acquérir beaucoup de profits pour le bien être de sa famille en matière de : santé, d’éducation et de revêtement.
Il s’approvisionne dans les foires locales et après approvisionnement il les revend aux comptants, il a une méthode de vente extraordinaire qui lui permet de réaliser un bénéfice prévisionnel acceptable qui varie entre 25000 à 80000f par mois. Oumarou a souvent quelques obstacles sur le marché tel que : la chute des prix sur le marché et la mévente. 
Oumarou est l’homme à la droite tenant entre ses mains la corde attaché au coup du mouton.
texts.en:
Oumarou is a 26-year-old Malian. He is married and the father of a one-year-old child who is not yet of school age, and his wife is a cleaner.

Oumarou is a hard-working breeder. Not having enough funds for his sheep-breeding activities, he is turning to the MFI in order to get more substantial financing which will enable him to buy sheep and make a lot of profits, so that he can cover his family's expenses (health, education, clothing) and ensure their well-being.

He gets his supplies at the local markets and then resells them for cash. He has an extraordinary sales method which allows him to make an acceptable potential monthly profit of between 25 000 and 80 000 francs. Oumarou often faces obstacles on the market, like falling prices and bad sales.

Oumarou is the man on the right holding the sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep for breeding and resale.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en: Ma. Cristina is 31 years old, married, and has one kid. Her husband is a government employee. While her husband is working on able to sustain their daily needs, Ma. Cristina is engaging herself in retailing business. Her priority in life is to give a better way of living for her kid, and send her/him to school until college. She wishes that her kid will finish college soon and will have a better future. With regards to her retailing business, she is managing the business well to support their other needs. Ma. Cristina wanted to borrow a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy groceries. She hopes for continuous growth of her business and to earn bigger profits that enable her to invest in new assets.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Sok Chea

texts.en:
Sok Chea is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in Phnom Penh city. She has two children, one of whom is still in school. She support her family’s living through selling sweets. She can manage to save about USD 8 each day for future needs through her business.

Sok Chea, who is new to VisionFund, is now requesting a loan to pay for tuition fees for her son, who pursuing bachelor degree in marketing. She hopes to see her son have chance to study in university and have a good job in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her son who pursuing a bachelor's degree in marketing.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hassana

texts.en:
Hassana is a 49-year-old widow with special needs and the mother of one child. She is the only person responsible for caring for her child. She is a hardworking woman, well known in the region, and has a good reputation for working hard.

Hassana has a convenience store that is located in her house, and this is very helpful for her in many ways.

Hassana is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new items and offers to satisfy her customers' needs in the upcoming Christmas season. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of satisfying her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new items and offers in the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.name: Centro De Rioyos Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad pequeña del Estado de México se integró un grupo de personas que coinciden en sus características y objetivos pues son muy trabajadoras y dedicadas completamente a sus familias. Todos son originarios de dicha comunidad la cual es rica en tradiciones, fiestas, música y recursos naturales; gran parte de la población se dedica al cultivo de maíz. Las fechas próximas son muy importantes para ellos ya que pueden recoger el fruto del esfuerzo realizado durante todo el año.
   Doña Margarita es una de las integrantes que se destaca por su actitud emprendedora y quien además gusta de preservar las tradiciones de su lugar de origen. Doña Mago, como le dicen de cariño, tiene un taller de costura desde hace más de quince años y lo inició debido a que, al tomar un curso de corte y confección, se convenció de que era su pasión. 
   En un inicio laboraba desde su hogar con a una maquina que le prestaban sus suegros y sólo realizaba composturas de prendas, pero gracias a sus ganancias invirtió lo necesario para comprar telas e instrumentos necesarios. De igual forma comenzó a elaborar trajes típicos de la región ya que quiere que las personas puedan conocer más de sus tradiciones por medio de sus creaciones. "Es un muy buen negocio, obtengo las ganancias que necesito y a pesar de la competencia tengo ventas muy buenas pues las escuelas me contactan para hacer uniformes o vestuarios" comentó satisfecha.  
   Con la oportunidad del préstamo de VFMéxico compraría telas, resortes, listones, encajes etc. para aumentar su producción. Una de sus metas es remodelar su taller para en un futuro contratar a más personal y, desde luego, solventar los gastos educativos de su hijo quien actualmente estudia la preparatoria. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Jorge quien invertirá en una herrería; María Agustina y José Ángel, en una tienda de abarrotes y Juan, en una carpintería.
*La fotografía fue tomada en su taller, Doña Mago viste un suéter gris.
texts.en:
In a small community in the State of Mexico, a group of people joined together who are similar in their characteristics and objectives, since they are all very hardworking and completely dedicated to their families. They are all originally from this community, which is rich in traditions, fiestas, music, and natural resources. Many of the people make their living in the cultivation of corn. The upcoming time is very important for them since they can harvest the fruit of the labor they've done throughout the year.

Margarita is one of the members who stands out for her enterprising attitude and who also enjoys preserving the traditions of her birthplace. Mago, as she is affectionately called, has had a dressmaking shop for more than fifteen years. She started it after taking a sewing class and found that it was her passion.

At first, she worked from home with a sewing machine that her in-laws had loaned her, and she only did mending of clothing. But thanks to her earnings, she was able to buy fabric and the necessary tools. She then started to make clothing that was traditional to her region since she wanted people to learn more about their traditions through her creations. "It's a very good business. I earn the profits that I need, and in spite of the competition, I have excellent sales because the schools contact me to make uniforms or costumes," she comments with satisfaction.

With the opportunity of receiving a loan from VFMéxico, she will buy fabric, elastic, ribbons, lace, etc., to increase her production. One of her goals is to remodel her shop so that in the future she can hire personnel and, in the course of time, pay for the educational expenses of her son, who is currently studying in high school.

The rest of the members of the group are Jorge, who will invest in a blacksmith's shop, María Agustina and José Ángel, in a grocery store, and Juan, in a carpenter's shop.

*The photograph was taken in Mago's shop, and she is wearing a gray sweater.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric, elastic, ribbons, lace, etc.

location.town: San Felipe del Progreso, Estado de México

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr: En 1993, Marie a fait ses débuts dans le commerce via l'apprentissage qu'elle a reçu des familiers. Cette activité participe à l'amélioration de son niveau de vie malgré la petitesse de son fond de roulement. Elle compte continuer à travailler avec PAIDEK pour améliorer de plus en plus sa vie de famille. Sur la photo, Marie porte une chemise noire et foulard noir.
texts.en:
Marie started working as a retailer in 1993, learning from family and friends. This business helps her to improve her standard of living, despite the small size of her working capital. She plans to work with PAIDEK in order to improve her family's life more and more.

In the photo, Marie is wearing a black blouse and scarf.

loans.use: to strengthen her inventory of items like spices and vegetable oils.

loans.name: Leticia Eugenia Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive la señora Eugenia tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno de 15 años que  estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es comerciante.
Eugenia junto al marido tienen un negocio con el cual luchan día a día para salir adelante,  ellos tienen una funeraria y ofrecen los servicios en una sala de velación la cual esta en la ciudad de Rocafuerte lugar de donde son ellos, nos cuenta además de ofrecer el servicio de  las salas de velación y carrosa fúnebre ellos también venden ahí mismo cofres mortuorios, nos cuenta que a pesar de que no es un negocio muy tradicional les toca realizarlo ya que es su única fuente de ingresos que ellos tienen para ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar cofres mortuorios y sillas. Lleva más de 14 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos le han ayudado a implementar su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the Alfa village bank meet in Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabí province known as the home of the Reales Tamarindos Stadium. Eugenia, 50 years old, lives here. She is married and she and her husband have three children, two of whom are adults and one of whom is in high school and still lives with them. Her husband is a businessman.
Eugenia and her husband have a business and work hard every day to earn a living. They run a funeral home and offer services in a viewing room in the town of Rocafuerte, where they live. She tells us that in addition to offering the viewing rooms and a hearse, they also sell coffins. She says that although it's not a very traditional business, it's the only source of income they have to make a living.
This loan will be used to buy coffins and chairs. She has been a member of this village bank for 14 years, and she likes it because the loans have helped her strengthen her business. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy coffins and chairs.

loans.name: Ana Rizza

texts.en:
Ana Rizza is a hardworking woman whose livelihood is selling barbecue. She is a 40-year-old woman and has seven children ages 2-20 years old respectively. Her partner in life earns a living by being a driver. Her income goes for food and school expenses. Her work is done late in the afternoon when she prepares chicken and pork barbecue and sells it to the locals and nearby residents in community.

She would like to improve her earnings by providing more barbecue to sell but unfortunately, she has limited funds to make it. Therefore, she would like to avail herself of a loan from CEVI to cater her need. Ana Rizza would like to purchase additional supplies like meat, chicken, sauce and bamboo skewers . In that way, she will augment her earnings.

She is very grateful to Kiva and CEVI for the support and she is doing her best to become more productive and continue to support the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies like meat, chicken, sauce and bamboo skewers.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is 45 years old. She owns a motorcycle which she uses for transport business.  She also does coconut farming and raises hogs for a living, alongside her husband.  She is asking for a loan to buy feed and fertilizer to meet the needs of her business.  Her earnings from the business will be used to buy food for the family, pay for school fees of her youngest child and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Letty Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive la señora Letty tiene 37  años de edad, está separada y de esa relación  tiene 5 hijos todos de 15, 13, 9 y 5 años  de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en colegio y escuela. 
Letty es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar sus propios ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos sola, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, vende una gran cantidad de productos como sabanas, zapatos, ropa de todo tipo, productos Yanbal, Avon, Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas),  entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale todos los días  a vender y cobrar sus productos ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, ella  también vende  en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando desean algún producto de los que ella vende, lleva más de 20 años con esta actividad la cual  le permiten ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, ropa, zapatos, perfumes, entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la institución. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the Alfa village bank meet in Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabí province known as the home of the Reales Tamarindos Stadium.

Letty, 37 years old, lives here. She is divorced and has five children who are 15, 13, 9, and 5 years of age. All of her children are in primary and secondary school.

Letty likes to be self-sufficient and earn her own income to provide for her children on her own. She has a business selling a variety of products such as linens; shoes; all kinds of clothing; women's beauty products from Yanbal, Avon, and Belcorp; and other things. She goes out selling her products door to door and collecting payments every day. She allows people to buy on credit and collects payments every week. She also sells out of her home and her customers come to her when they want a product that she sells. She has been in this business for more than 20 years, and it allows her to make a living.

This loan is to buy linens, clothing, shoes, perfume, and other products to sell. This is her third loan cycle with the village bank, and she likes it because it's how she was able to start her business, so she's very grateful to the institution. Her dream is to be able to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy linens, clothing, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: St Moise Group

texts.fr: St moise vient de finir son 1er prêt kiva. Le remboursement a été faite normalement. Pascaline Fati, membre repésentatif remercie tout le personnel et les prêteurs de kiva pour le soutien. Avec le prêt, Pascaline Fati avait pu payer les mèches, du gèle pour son salon. Elle a eu un bénéfice dans la coiffure qui lui a permis de payer la scolarité de ses enfants, de contribuer aux dépenses familiales et surtout d'augmenter son activité. Pascaline Fati a encore besoin de crédit, pour continuer son activité. A l'issue de ses ventes son bénéfice lui permettra de payer une parcelle si possible construire et aussi continuer son activité.
texts.en:
St Moise has just complete its first loan cycle with Kiva. The money was properly repaid.

Pascaline Fati, the featured member, would like to thank all the personnel at Kiva and the lenders for their support. Pascaline Fati was able to use her loan to buy hair extensions and gel for her beauty salon. Her hairdressing business made a profit which allowed her to pay for her children's education, contribute to the family expenses and, above all, to develop her business.

Pascaline Fati needs another loan to continue doing business. After making her sales, her profit will allow her to buy a plot of land and maybe to build on it, as well as to keep doing business.

loans.use: to buy 150 000 francs worth of beauty products and soap .

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso con 39 años de edad,de estado civil casado,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su esposa y sus tres menores hijos, en el distrito de Pimpingos,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor, plantación tiene cuatro años de edad, esta en tercer año de producción,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 04 años en terreno propio. Su producto lo comercializa en distrito Pimpingos a compradores mayorista de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría-engorde de ganado vacuno, cuenta con terreno de invernas propias, actividad lo desarrolla hace más de 10 años. Así mismo a la cría de animales menores como (patos, gallinas, pavos, chanchos y cuyes), cuenta con experiencia en el rubro,cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátanos, vitucas, frutas y otros), Siendo estos para su consumo y en ocaciones para la venta. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de dicho cultivo, con ello obtendrá buena producción y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Alfonso es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. El firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 39 years old. He is married and lives in a rustic house with his wife and three children; his children are all under the age of 18. Alfonso lives in the Pimpingos district of Cutervo province. This is a rural area in Cajamarca department, Peru. The locals here mainly work in farming, trade and cattle-raising. Alfonso receives good personal and professional references.

Alfonso works in farming: he grows Catimor coffee, and has had his plantation for four years. This is its third year of production, while Alfonso has more than four years' experience working his own land. Alfonso sells his product to wholesalers in the Pimpingos district.

Alfonso also works raising and fattening up bovine cattle. He has land for the animals to graze. He has been doing this work for more than ten years. As well as bovine cattle, Alfonso has smaller animals (ducks, hens, turkey, pigs and guinea pigs) and has experience with such work. He also grows products such as yucca, plantains, fruits, and more. He grows these for consumption at home and sometimes to sell on.

This loan will be used to look after crops. This loan will give him a good yield and a higher income to improve his and his family's quality of life.

Alfonso is a repeat borrower at Edpyme Alternativa. He is taking out this loan with his wife.

loans.use: to look after crops.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: 28-year-old Elsie lives in Duero, Bohol with her family. She is a married woman and her husband work as a Technician. He repairs appliances and she also cooks meal dishes to sell to her neighbors. Elsie is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like soy sauce, seasoning, cooking oil, noodles, vegetables and repair tools for her husband’s work. She is determined to make her business work so that she can save ahead for her future children and create a life of abundance with her husband. Elsie dreams of having a big restaurant and a repair shop someday.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like soy sauce, seasoning, cooking oil, noodles, vegetables and repair tools for her husband’s work.

loans.name: Jenayn

texts.en: Since the year 2011, Jenalyn, from Valencia, started farming vegetables.  She farms bell pepper and string beans to sell in the town proper.  She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings that she can use to further improve her crops. She believes that her loan will change her living conditions because her harvest will then increase. Jenalyn will also save money that she can use to improve her household and reinvest for agricultural expansion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en: Jeralyn is a farmer from Jagna, Bohol. She is a mother to her five-year-old son. Jeralyn has a vegetable garden where she grows ginger, bell pepper and eggplants. Jeralyn also runs a Sari-sari store business. Jeralyn is asking for a loan to buy more seeds, a sprayer and insecticides so she can better take care of her garden and grow it for more profits. It is her goal to further improve her Sari-sari store business in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, a sprayer and insecticides.

loans.name: Playsia

texts.en:
Playsia is a married woman. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be a role model to other farmers.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 55 years old and has ten children. Rosita is married and has two children who are still in school.

Rosita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Rosita has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en: Son’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Son makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.en:
Ibodat was born in 1961. She is married and has 3 children. Ibodat has been busy with a sewing service for 18 years.. She has a great experience in this field and that’s why her clients are glad from her services. Ibodat sews a variety of national women dresses. She always tries to get higher education to her children.

Now her son is a student in the Russia Federation. She is asking for a loan of 11000 Somoni to pay for the university tuition of her son. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition of her son.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
58-year-old Margarita is in the business of raising poultry in the community of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She raise ducks and chicken for her family. This business usually earn PHP5000 per month.

She is asking a loan to finance the needs of feed for her chicken and ducks.

Margarita hope to live a good life out of her successful business. All her children are now adults.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes, belts and beauty products. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport costs.

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes and belts. His business goal is to own a big business stall within five years.

He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to the university level. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes and belts.

loans.name: Maria Gracia

texts.en:
Maria Gracia is 39 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Gracia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like candies, coffee, snack foods, canned goods, detergent soap, milk, noodles, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as candies, coffee, snack foods, canned goods, detergent soap, milk, noodles, etc.

Maria Gracia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like candies, coffee, snack foods, canned goods, detergent soap, milk, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ollga

texts.en:
Ollga is a 52-year-old married mother of 3; the oldest is 25 and the youngest is 14. Ollga's husband has been operating a rented shop where he's been making aluminum doors and windows and also wooden kitchen cabinets, doors and windows. A few years ago their older son joined him, thus, since then father and son have been working together.

The loan that Ollga is requesting now will be used to buy materials such as aluminum and wood.

Her brother left land to Ollga to use for as long as his family resides overseas. She plants only corn and sells it all, 20 quintal/year. On this she earns $250/year, and from the activity of her husband, has an approximate monthly income of $300.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the metal/furniture shop that her husband and older son operate

loans.name: Seoy's Group

texts.en: Seoy’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia.  Seoy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Ali El Rida

texts.en:
Ali El Rida, age 25 and unmarried, is a baker. He left school at an early age to help support his family, which consists of six members. He opened his own bakery business six years ago after gaining five years of experience in the baking domain. He is working hard to develop his business, which is becoming well-known in his region.

Today, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools and foodstuffs to facilitate his bakery business and increase his production. His goal is to continue expanding his business in order to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools and foodstuffs to facilitate his bakery business

loans.name: Dila

texts.en: Dila operates a mini-farm with dairy cows and calves. With her loan funds, she will repair the stable in which she houses her animals.

loans.use: to repair the stable in which she houses her animals.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef, age 23, sells fruits and vegetables to earn his living. He has operated this business since 2011. To supplement his income, he paints houses. Youssef is well-known in his region through his good reputation and his hard work.

Youssef is a Palestinian refugee whose wife has recently given birth to their first baby.

He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his merchandise with special seasonal goods, as well as to renovate his workplace to better develop his business. This will enable him to increase his sales and provide his family with a better standard of living.

This is Youssef's second loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan was invested in increasing his business capital, and he managed this investment well. Currently, he is working hard to further develop his business so that he can open a larger market in the future.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with special seasonal goods, as well as to renovate his workplace to better develop his business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul sells milk to earn his living. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes himself to be focused. He tells us that his biggest business challenge is inflation.

Paul and his wife have two children, and he works hard to provide for them.

He will use the Kes 60,000 loan funds to buy a new stock of milk to offer for sale. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. Paul's goal for the future is to improve his family's living standards.

He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a new stock of milk to offer for sale

loans.name: Jones

texts.en: Jones is a married man. He has 3 children. He operates a photo studio where he offers photography services. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy photography equipment. His business goal is to open other business branches within 5 years. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy photography equipment

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
Mohira is a bright and beautiful girl. She is studying at the university with good and excellent marks. She is a fourth-year student. She is studying very well. She wants to become the best specialist. Her favorite subjects are history, chemistry and math. She participates in a lot of circles.

The condition of her family is so bad they couldn’t help her. Her parents have a small income. It’s hard for her to pay university tuition. She wants to pay for the fourth year of her studies. She is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition. She hopes for your help and mercy.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition.

loans.name: Leizl

texts.en:
Leizl  is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leizl is 31 years old and has one child still in school.

Leizl  has a fishing business in the Philippines. Leizl requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new equipment like fishing net, tackle, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Leizl  has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new equipment like fishing net, tackle, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Chamreoun's Group

texts.en: Chamreoun’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chamreoun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
Mohira is divorced and brings-up a child. She is the only provider for her child and she tries hard for her well-being. Mohira sews different kind of dresses and sells them in a local market. She works hard every day from early morning till late evening. Mohira has worked in this way more than 4 years. She, little by little with the passing of time, is developing her business.

Mohira is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy medicines, because she is ill and she must buy medicines. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicines needed for treatment.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is a resident in the town of Mayorga, from Leyte province. She earns a living by operating a small pedal-operated vehicle, which known as "pedicab", serve as mode of transportation to the locals in her community from one place to the town proper.
Aside from that, she also goes farming. She grows and sells rice, as additional income for the entire family. She is married and has four young children ages 4-10 years old respectively.

Myra would like to gain higher earnings but the main obstacle is her lack of funds. That is why she decided to join CEVI to access loan and wants to purchase fertilizer and pigs for hog raising start-up. These would help her boost and improve the yield of her farm.

That would enable her to provide for the needs of her family and continue to expand her farm to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pigs for a hog raising start-up.

loans.name: Khmut

texts.en:
Khmut, 52 year old, is an experienced and industrious farmer from Phnum Sruoch District, Kampong Speu Province. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around USD 6 a day to support her family daily. She is a lovely mother of six children, one married and five unmarried, and the girl who sitting with her is her youngest daughter.

Khmut is faced with a financial issue in her family, thus she would like get some money to hire a tractor for plowing her rice field and to buy some seeds, but she can’t afford them. Due to the shortage of money, now she would like to get a Kiva loan, she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help her. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support and also thanks them for their kindness.

loans.use: to hire a tractor for plowing her rice field and to buy some seeds.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is a mother of nine children, ages 2-16 years old, respectively. She lives in the town of Dulag.

She earns a living by operating a pedicab (a small, pedal-operated vehicle which is used as a mode of transportation in her place). She also engages in the buying and selling of fruits to aid with the needs and expenses of her household.

It was just a year ago that Genelyn started selling fruits. Fruit selling is a very lucrative business in her place, but she doesn't have enough funds to do bulk purchases. She has requested a loan to purchase a variety of fruits. Thus, slowly, she would be able to cater to the demand and her income will go higher.

In that way, she could start to save and continue to use the revenues to expand her livelihood to become successful.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a married woman and has been running her beauty parlor for the past three years. It's her passion, and she works with full commitment passionately. She knows the techniques of makeup and hair design. She is a well-known beautician in her town.

Shazia is a responsible mother of four children and is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of her husband.

Now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy more beauty products including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently. She is obliged towards the Kiva team and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Malama

texts.en:
Malama is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Malama is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Malama would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Malama will store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Malama now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and her family members, and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji Shehu

texts.en:
Alhaji Shehu is maize farmer from Hayin Allahuwa village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alhaji Shehu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Shehu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Alhaji Shehu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post- secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
