texts.es: El es un señor mayor de edad que esta jubilado, por su edad sufre de problemas dentales y de perdida de piezas dentales frontales, por lo que se le dificulta mucho alimentarse. Necesita una placa dental frontal para mejorar su mordida y su salud. Lamentablemente la pensión que recibe no le alcanza para solventar el gasto para poder adquirir la placa dental que necesita.
texts.en:
He is an elderly man who is retired. Due to his age, he suffers from dental problem and the loss of some front teeth. This makes it difficult to eat.

He needs a front dental plate in order to improve his bite and his health. Unfortunately, the pension that he gets is not enough to pay for the expense of being able to get the dental plate that he needs.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Sert's Group

texts.en:
Sert, age 61, has been a rice farmer for almost 30 years. To supplement her income, she prepares and sells Khmer noodles, a traditional Cambodian dish. She also raises cows. Her husband is a paid laborer in their local region. Together, they can earn about 67,000KHR per day.

Sert is the group leader for this group loan with VisionFund, and she has been with VisionFund for seven cycles. Her past loans, which she completely repaid, have helped her to better support her family, as well as to have sufficient working capital for her business.

She and her fellow group members are applying for a new loan. Sert will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and also to pay for labor fees for plowing the rice field. Additionally, she will use a portion of her loan to buy piglets to raise, so that she can earn extra income for supporting her family.

Sert hopes this loan will enable her to grow her current business so that she can earn a higher income. Her goal for the future is to extend her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, to pay for labor fees for plowing the rice field, and to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Ummaru

texts.en:
Ummaru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ummaru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ummaru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ummaru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ummaru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ummaru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en: Kosal’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Kosal makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS FLORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Isabel se dedica su negocio de tienda de abarrotes donde vende todo tipo de productos como panes, gaseosas, arroz y cereales, y otros productos de primera necesidad.
La socia tiene 50 años y dos hijos con quienes sale adelante trabajando todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, ya son muchos años que se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes y su deseo es ampliarla y brindar mejores productos a sus clientes.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar galletas, gaseosas y azúcar.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de cabinas de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
Las socia que están adjuntas en la fotografía principal se les tomo la imagen después de la reunión de su banco por que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.

La socia está contenta y agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito que le otorgaron y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Las Flores" communal bank .  This bank is located in the San Sebastián District which is part of the Cusco Province in the Department of Cusco.  One of the members is Isabel.  She makes a living from her grocery store where she sells all kinds of products such as breads, soft drinks, rice, cereals and other basic staples. 

Isabel is 50-years-old and has 2 children with whom she is able to prosper by working every day from 7 o'clock in the morning until 8 o'clock at night.  She has made a living from her grocery store for many years and her wish is to expand it and provide better products to her customers.  Isabel is requesting the loan to buy cookies, soft drinks and sugar.

The other group members make a living in various businesses such as:  selling sandwiches, clothing sales booth, grocery store and restaurant.  The pictures of the two members attached to the main photograph were taken after their bank meeting as they had requested permission to be late due to work commitments.  

Isabel is happy and grateful to KIVA investors for the loan that they have given her and commits to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy cookies, soft drinks and sugar

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has one child and lives in Mayorga, Leyte province.   She works hard to support the needs of  her family. Lilia raises and sells hogs, which she has been doing for many years, serving locals and town dwellers.

Lilia requested a loan from CEVI, which she will use to purchase a sufficient supply of feeds to become sustainable. Raising hogs is at peak these holiday season, but she did not have enough funds to make it, which is why she joined CEVI. Lilia would like to boost her earnings by raising more quality hogs. She hopes to be able to set aside enough savings to invest in business opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other pig supplements

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA MADRE DE FAMILIA PREOCUPADA POR LA SALUD DENTAL DE SU HIJA DE 13 AÑOS, QUIEN PRESENTA FUERTE DOLOR EN UNA DE SUS MOLARES INFERIORES, NECESITA URGENTE UN TRATAMIENTO DE ENDODONCIA, POSTE Y CORONA PARA EVITAR QUE PIERDA LA PIEZA Y SOBRE TODO QUITARLE EL DOLOR TAN FUERTE QUE SUFRE Y QUE ESTA AFECTANDO EN SUS ESTUDIOS.
texts.en: She is a mother who worries about the dental health of her 13 year old daughter.  Her daughter has severe pain in one of her lower molars.  She urgently needs endodontic treatment, post, and crown in order to avoid losing the tooth.  Most of all she needs the treatment to stop the severe pain that she has, which is affecting her studies.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una joven que trabaja en un supermercado laborando en turnos para apoyar en la economía familiar, actualmente sufre de molestias en los molares inferior y superior, requiere de un tratamiento regenerativo ya que padece fuertes dolores al masticar sus alimentos. Sus recursos son insuficientes para solventar el tratamiento dental que requiere.
texts.en:
She is a young woman who works shifts at a supermarket in order to help with the family finances. She currently suffers from pain in her upper and lower molars. She needs regenerative treatment because she has severe pain when she chews her food.

She has insufficient resources to be able to pay for the dental treatment that she needs.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Stephany Leticia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive la señora Stephany, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  1 año  de edad. Su esposo es empleado público.
Stephany como varias personas del cantón se dedica a la elaboración de dulces, ella le da forma y sabor a sus dulces para que sean degustado por las personas de su ciudad y de otras donde se venden sus dulces, son muchos los clientes que ella tiene y que le piden que les prepare los dulces los mismos que vende al público en general o a comerciantes que llevan  otras ciudades a vender sus dulces, ella lleva 7 años dedicada a esta labor la misma que aprendió de su mamá. 
Este crédito es para  comprar todo tipo de ingredientes para preparar dulces. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The town of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province, has been known for a long time as the home of the Reales Tamarindos stadium. It is where the members of the Alfa credit group meet twice a month. Sra. Stephany lives here. She is 23 years old, married, and has a one-year old son. Her husband works in the public sector.

Like several people in the town, Stephany earns her living making candy, the sort that are enjoyed by the local people and others. She has many customers. They are asking her to make candy to sell to the public in general and to businesspeople to sell in other towns.

Stephany has been doing this work for seven years and learned her skills from her mother. This loan will be used to buy all kinds of ingredients for the candy. She has been with this credit group for five years and enjoys it because of the very low interest rates. Her greatest wish is to do the best she can for her son.

loans.use: buy ingredients for candy

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a farm where he grows maize and also keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 18 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the  100,000 KES loan to buy three more dairy cows. His business goal is to own a milk processing plant within  five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy 3 more dairy cows

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia  is a house wife and looks after her family consisting of six members. She is well trained in cloth stitching and started her business two years ago. She provides tailoring services to the people in the area where she is residing. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of raw materials for her business, including threads, needles, clothing etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and effectively. However, due to the lack of money she finds it difficult. So Safia is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. Safia is very thankful to KIVA's partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her tailoring business .

loans.name: Lara

texts.en:
Lara is a 29-year-old married Palestinian mother of two. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started two years ago, tailoring to help him in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is becoming well-known among her region for her professional skills.
Lara is working hard to develop her business, thus today, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tailoring tools (needles, magnets, scissors, thread, etc..) which will facilitate her business and increase her production.
Lara hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary tailoring tools (needles, magnets, scissors, thread, etc..) to increase her production

loans.name: Fidaa

texts.en:
Fidaa is a 25-year-old married mother of two. Two years ago, she started sewing shoes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and an ambitious woman who is becoming well-known in her region.

Fidaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house's roof before winter. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house's roof before winter

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El socio continua realizando su negocio de transporte, mediante esta actividad el está logrando salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de su servicio para satisfacción de sus pasajeros, es por ello que el necesita el crédito para seguir brindando su servicio de mejor manera.
El socio Rodolfo solicito el crédito para comprar muelles y aceite de carro.
El socio está agradecido con todas las personas que le apoyan a seguir yendo por su metas.
texts.en:
Rodolfo continues to be engaged in his transportation business.  Through this business he has been able to get ahead and improve the quality of his service for his passengers' satisfaction.  

Rodolfo needs this loan to purchase car springs and oil.  He is thankful to all the people that support him to continue reaching his goals.

loans.use: to purchase car springs and oil

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 45 years old, married with five children.

Geraldine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Geraldine has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Geraldine aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a strong mother of two grown children. She is 45 years old and is widow. She is engage in direct selling business as her way to comfort herself. Rowena is happy to serve her customers by offering them products which she is selling. She is also traveling to their villages to pick up and deliver her customers orders. With her good service to her customers, Rowena gains customers. But, due to the volume of her costumers order, she can’t deliver it on time because of not having enough capital.

Thus, she is requesting a loan of P50,000 to purchase shoes, ready to wear clothes, underwear, and cosmetics products. Rowena wish to be healthy for her to continue operating the business, and gain income as well.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, ready to wear clothes, underwear, and cosmetics products

loans.name: Nuevo Día Group

texts.es:
Los habitantes de una pequeña comunidad del Estado de México se sienten orgullosos de pertenecer a  llena pues es rica en tradiciones, cultura, leyendas, logros, etc. De igual manera, las personas son muy trabajadoras y se dedican al cultivo de maíz; considerado el producto más importante ya que de ahí obtienen tortillas las cuales son básicas en su alimentación. La cría de ganado, no obstante, es una actividad que gracias a las facilidades de la localidad se realiza a lo largo de la región. 
 Integrante de un grupo local, Doña Costantina es una persona muy amable portadora de un gran espíritu emprendedor. Ha formado una familia muy unida junto con su pareja, Brigido y sus tres hijos de los cuales uno estudia la educación secundaria.
    Doña Consta, como la llaman cariñosamente, decidió ayudar a solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos por medio de la cría de ovejas. Dicha actividad le permitiría, de igual forma, pasar más tiempo de calidad con su familia.  El apoyo recibido por parte de VFMéxico le ha permitido desarrollar su actividad al grado de aumentar el número de ejemplares y la cantidad de alimento que utiliza. 
   En esta oportunidad compraría un carnero para obtener más crías  junto con los ejemplares hembras que actualmente mantiene en su corral. "Estoy muy contenta con mi negocio porque poco a poco está creciendo y mis niños están mejor" comentó contenta. Al hablar de sus metas lo primero que refiere es que desea que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera profesional.
 Los demás integrantes son María Luisa y Magdalena quienes invertirán en una tienda de abarrotes; María Elena, en la construcción de un corral para la cría de animales; Matilde, Celia, Constantina y Angelina, en la compra de ovejas mientras que María Juana, en la compra de cerdos.
 *La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín central del municipio.
texts.en:
These inhabitants of a small community in the state of México are proud of coming from Llena as it is rich in traditions, culture, legends, and achievements. The people are very hardworking and earn their living growing maize, which is considered the most important ingredient of tortillas, a staple of the local diet. Cattle are also raised throughout the area as it is good for livestock.

Sra. Costantina is a member of the local group. She is friendly and also has a great entrepreneurial spirit. With her partner Brigido and their three children, she is part of a wonderful family. One of the children is in secondary education. Consta, as she is known. decided to help pay for household expenses and the education of the children by raising sheep. The work allows her to spend quality time with her family.

The money obtained from Vision Fund México has allowed her to expand the business and increase the number of animals and the amount of feed that she uses. At this time Consta will buy a ram so she can have more lambs as well as more ewes to raise in the corral.

She says that she is very happy with her business as it is gradually growing and her children are doing better. Her goal is to see her children get good jobs.

The other members of the group are María Luisa and Magdelena who will buy merchandise for their grocery store; María Elena who will build a corral for the animals she raises; Matilde, Celia, Constantina, and Angelina who will buy more sheep, and María Juana who will buy pigs.

The photograph was taken in the municipality's main garden.

loans.use: buy lambs

loans.name: Tioda

texts.en:
Tioda is a married woman, with 3 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services, which she has been involved in for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to open a new business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve living standards of her family.. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to cater for family needs.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mildred works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Mildred is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Arjan

texts.en:
Arjan is a 34-year-old Egyptian Albanian married father of a 2-year-old. He lives in a little town in northern Albania where he's been recycling plastics and metal trash for cash for all these eight years. "I am a hard worker. I wake up at 4am every day and start searching for recycling in the large garbage bins of the town and the villages around. I am not alone in this, my wife and my elderly parents join me too. As far as the plastic concerns, I deliver it myself with the tricycle I operate, whereas the other matter I gather it in the yard of my home until companies buy it from me," said Arjan to the branch assistant.

Even though they work hard, they live very poorly; Arjan has been photographed holding some recycling in his hands at the front of his house.

The loan will help Arjan buy a compressor for the plastics and cans.

loans.use: to buy a compressor for plastic and cans recycling.

loans.name: Sirak

texts.en:
Sirak is 59 years old and lives with his wife in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. He has a vocational education and works as an auto mechanic. This is his family’s only source of income as his wife is unemployed. For many years, Sirak worked at different workshops, but since 2012, he has operated his own garage. He has a lot of regular customers who trust only him to repair and solve all problems and disorder with their cars. 

Sirak is requesting a 650,000 AMD loan to purchase some new tools for his garage and mechanic work. Some of his tools are already very worn out and hard to work with.

loans.use: to purchase some new tools for his garage and mechanic work

loans.name: Jashaswini's Group

texts.en:
Jashaswini, standing in the middle of the photograph, is one of the victims affected by India's rural sanitation crisis. This lady with sheer patience and willpower is a resident of a village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is a married lady and is a blessed mother of one daughter.

She faces numerous difficulties due to absence of a toilet at her home. The absence of a toilet at her home compels her to walk a long distance to relieve herself. She no more finds it feasible as she can sense the danger of crime and molestation.

Therefore, she, along with her group members, is requesting a loan in the amount of 60,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode, a hand water pump, and a shower in it.

Jashaswini is awaiting your kind hearts to help her and her family.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode, a hand water pump, and a shower in it.

loans.name: Houeida

texts.en:
Houeida is a 22-year-old single lady who has been running a home-based beauty salon for three years to make a living and develop her skills. She is well known in her region and recommended by her customers, most of whom are neighbors, friends and relatives. Houeida quit school and started training in a beauty salon to develop her hobby and start her career.

Houeida is requesting a YOUTH loan from the Kiva field partner Al Majmoua to purchase necessary cosmetics and hairdressing tools to develop her business and please her customers. In the future, she hopes to develop her business and open a separate beauty salon outside her home.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and hairdressing tools to develop her business

loans.name: Juliter

texts.en:
Juliter is 37 years, she sells goats and poultry at Voi Kenya. She is a mother of three, who has been in this business for the last two years doing well and her husband supports her.

This is her third borrowing to finance her business. She will use the money to purchase goats and poultry for resale

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to repay her loan and educate her children.

She hopes to be the major supplier of goats in town in future.

loans.use: to purchase goats and poultry for resale

loans.name: Kherdija

texts.en: Kherdija is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells eggs, water, juices and snacks. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of snacks. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs, water, juices and snacks

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Louis Ivan is 23 years old and is 1st of the three children in the family. His mother Florenda a member of NWTF, supports the family through her buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Louis Ivan is studying Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering and is currently in the 5th of this 5-year course.

Florenda is borrowing PHP 20000 to pay for the tuition fees for her son Louis Ivan for the school year 2015-16.

Louis Ivan plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her son's last year tuition fees for a BSc. in Mechanical Engineering

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 57-year-old married woman with four children. She lives happily with her family in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Shamim’s husband is a rickshaw driver. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly and his is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to get it repaired it as soon as possible but, due to the lack of money, he cannot cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Shamim is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the repairing cost of his rickshaw. Her loan will help him to continue his business. Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a maize farmer and a member of the Babban Gona Farmers Organization.  Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mohammed has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of Maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Mohammed would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing.  Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mohammed can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Mohammed will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land.  Mohammed is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children obtain a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing.

loans.name: Vith's Group

texts.en: Vith’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Vith makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hortensia

texts.es:
La socia Hortencia sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin”.
La socia continúa dedicándose a su actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes. Esta actividad es propia de la población de Arin. Sus ganas de salir adelante impulsa a Hortencia todos los días, por eso quiere aumentar la población de animales que ella posee comprando mas animales y alimentos para estos.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar gallinas y alfalfa.
La socia agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hortensia continues to be a member of the communal bank Virgen Concebida de Arin, and she continues with her work of raising and selling small animals such as hens and guinea pigs. This is typical work for the people of Arin. 

She is motivated every day by her desire to get ahead, and that is why she wants to increase the number of animals she owns by buying more  animals amd the food for them. She  is applying for the loan to buy hens and alfalfa. 

Hortensia is grateful to Kiva lenders for their continued confidence in her, and is committed to making her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy hens and alfalfa.

loans.name: Manjuri's Group

texts.en:
The cheerful lady standing in the middle of the photograph is Manjuri. She is one of the victims who is affected by India's rural sanitation crisis. She is married to a grocer and has two sons in her care.

Manjuri does not possess a toilet at her home due to her husband's limited income. This compels her to walk a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds it feasible as she can sense the danger of insect bites, crime, and molestation.

Therefore, she, along with her group members, is requesting a loan in the amount of 60,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean toilet, incorporate stainless steel water pipes, and install a commode.

Your loan will make her happy and let her enjoy a healthy and disease-free life with her family.

loans.use: to build a clean toilet, incorporate stainless steel water pipes, and install a commode.

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Penninah is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Penninah has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Penninah would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Penninah can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Penninah will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Penninah is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to diversify her farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer from Sabon Kaura village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare, five and half times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, he can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season. Samaila can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Samaila is requesting a loan to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, he no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land, Samaila hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rosa Blanca Group

texts.es:
Rosa Blanca es un grupo formado por personas muy alegres, trabajadoras y entusiastas que se sienten especialmente orgullosos de sus raíces.  El lugar en donde viven también es digno de admiración ya que es muy tranquilo y conserva importantes tradiciones; gran parte de la población  celebra las fiestas religiosas con bailes, música y desfiles. 
   Doña Rosa es de las integrantes más amables, siempre se encuentra de muy buen humor y así afronta sus labores con el objetivo de velar por el bienestar de su familia. Su familia está integrada por Pedro, su esposo, quien trabaja como comerciante y sus cuatro hijos de los cuales tres de ellos estudian actualmente, su hija más grande estudia corte y confección; otra, educación preparatoria y el más pequeño, la secundaria.
   Al mismo tiempo de formar su familia, emprendieron el negocio de venta de zapatos sin embargo tiempo después prefirieron volcar sus fuerzas a la cría de ganado pues en ella vieron mejores oportunidades de desarrollo. Así pues, desde hace 20 años dicha actividad les ha permitido solventar gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Los ejemplares son comprados desde muy pequeños para tener completa inspección del sano crecimiento de cada uno. “Los animales los compramos en la plaza de animales y ahí mismo los regresamos cuando ya estamos seguros que obtendremos buenas ganancias” comentó contenta Doña Rosa.
   Una de las dificultades que puede presentar la actividad es que los animales enfermen, no obstante, tiene un fondo para cubrir dichos imprevistos. Por otro lado, está muy agradecida con el préstamo pues gracias a él aumento su producción; así,  cubre todos sus gastos y pudo construir un corral con todas las condiciones necesarias para llevar a cabo su labor. Su meta a futuro es integrar otros animales para cubrir todo el mercado dentro de su comunidad. 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son Matilde y Diana Araceli quienes invertirán en ovejas; Elidia y Teresa, en cerdos; Elena, en reses; José Alberto, en accesorio para auto e Itzel, en pavos.
*La fotografía fue tomada frente a las ovejas de Doña Matilde, ella es quien viste el abrigo gris y Doña Rosa, el chaleco negro.
texts.en:
The members of the Rosa Blanca group are very lively, hardworking and enthusiastic. They are especially proud of their roots. The place where they live is wonderful as it is tranquil and preserves the important traditions. The majority of the population celebrates religious festivals with dances, music, and parades.

Sra. Rosa is one of the most friendly members. She is always in a very good humour and goes about her work with the goal of watching over the wellbeing of her family. Her family consists of her husband Pedro, who is a businessman, and their four children, three of whom are currently at school. Her eldest daughter is studying to be a seamstress, another is at college, and the youngest in secondary school.

At the same time as starting her family, Rosa and her husband began their business selling shoes. However, some time later, they put their efforts into raising animals, believing it gave them better opportunities for development. So, twenty years later, they pay for household expenses and the education of their children from this work. The animals are bought when they are very small so they can control the healthy development of each one. Rosa explains that they buy the animals at the market and return there to sell them when they are sure of obtaining a good profit.

One of the difficulties they face is when the animals get sick. However, they have set aside money to cover such events. Rosa is very grateful for the loan money as thanks to it, production has increased, expenses are paid for, and she was able to build a corral with all the necessary conditions for raising animals. Her future goal is to introduce other types of animals to sell in the community.

The other members of the group are Matilde and Diana Araceli who will buy more sheep; Elida and Teresa, pigs; Elena, livestock; and José Alberto, vehicle accessories; and Itzel, turkeys.

The photograph was taken in front of Matilde's sheep. She is wearing a gray jacket, and Sra Rosa, a black vest.

loans.use: buy calves and animal feed

location.town: San Pedro El Alto, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Bryan Steven

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Cristo Rey, esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive el señor Bryan, tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de los padres, el estudia en una universidad en la ciudad. El lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para seguir adelante.
Bryan es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta trabajar y así lograr sus propios recursos que le sirvan para sus gastos en la universidad, el con la ayuda de su mamá tienen una  tienda de víveres en la casa,  allí venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también artículos de bazar papelería y útiles escolares, helados, entre otros víveres,  mientras el sale a sus estudios es su mamá la queda administrando la tienda.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres y artículos de  bazar y papelería. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
The Cristo Rey Credit Group meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto, which is known for its traditional culture and close proximity to two of the best beaches in the province such as San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Bryan lives, he is 18, single and lives with his parents. He attends a university in the city. He has already completed two cycles in the Credit Group, and he likes it for the help the loans provide to get ahead.

Bryan is a very hard-working young man, he likes to work so he can have his own resources to pay for his school expenses. He and his mother run a general store out of their home, selling all types of basic goods, stationery and school supplies, ice cream, and other items. While he attends school, his mother manages the store.

This loan is to buy basic goods, retail items and paper goods. His dream is to complete his studies and practice his profession.

loans.use: to buy supplies, retail items and paper goods.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a Kiva borrower with 1 child. She describes herself as honest. She has operated a beauty salon to offer beauty services for 4 years. Her primary customers are local people.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation. She will use 50,000 KES to buy beauty products for salon use. She hopes to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for salon use.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 49 years old and she lives in Kapan City in the region of Syunik. Aida is a widow and a mother of three children, whom since her very young age she managed to bring up and care for properly and with great love.

Aida has musical education and for many years she has been working at the city’s musical college as a teacher of piano. Aida’s elder son works at the Yerevan State University as a lecturer. Her younger son is still a student and her daughter is school-aged.

Aida is hopeful that her request for Kiva loan will be accepted. She will use this loan of 200,000 Armenian drams to help solve her health problem. She must take a course of treatment at the hospital.

loans.use: to solve her health problem by funding a course of treatment at the hospital.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with 5 children who describes herself as joyful. She operates a retail business to sell rice, flour, tomatoes, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are local people.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use 60,000 KES to buy sugar, flour, rice, and tomatoes. Her goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice, tomatoes.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is 52 years old, married, and has an adult daughter. She lives in Tsaghkunk of Gegharkunik region. She is a nurse but is currently unemployed and operates her farm with her husband. Alvard’s husband is a constructor and does different hired constructional works in their village, while she overseees nearly all the work of their farm.  

Alvard has cows, calves, pigs, and chickens on the farm. She sells a lot of milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, meat, and eggs. Alvard also sells her farm’s potatoes, mainly to re-sellers.  

Alvard has plans of increasing the number of her farm cattle. She requested a loan, which she will use to buy two calves and fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two calves and fodder for all cattle

loans.name: Kanchanama's Group

texts.en:
Kanchanama is a humble and an enterprising lady. She is standing on the left in the photograph. A tailor by profession, she does not have a toilet at her home. She is a resident of a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. The lack of a toilet makes her vulnerable to crime, diseases, and other dangers as she has to trek a long distance to relieve herself.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 40,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan to build a hygienic toilet with requisite sanitary fittings in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce medical expenses.

She is in dire need of your kind help and support.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet with requisite sanitary fittings in her home

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a maize farmer from Marmara village. As a Babban Gona member, Nuhu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Nuhu can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Nuhu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Nuhu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alh. Saidu

texts.en:
Alh. Saidu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Saidu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Alh. Saidu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Saidu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Alh. Saidu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 43-year-old mother with five children.

She provides tailoring services in the town to add a source of income for the family.She needs to purchase a variety of supplies including thread, needles, and fabric. This is very important for her to continue his work efficiently and effectively. However, due to the lack of money she finds it difficult.

She requests a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband with the financial matters of the family. Robina is happy that she will be able to help her business with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To invest in her tailoring services.

loans.name: Mustafah

texts.en:
Mustafah is maize farmer from Chidau village. As a member of Babban Gona, Mustafah is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mustafah would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Mustafah can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Mustafah is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive la señora Maria tiene 32  años de edad, está separada y de esa relación  tiene dos hijos de 8 y 4 años  de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. 
María es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro para darle lo necesario a sus hijos, hace un año atrás se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale todos los días  después de dejar a sus pequeños en la escuela donde estudian, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días, sus ventas son muy buenas ya que cuenta con buena clientela que siempre le encargan las prendas cuando ella viaja a Guayaquil a comprar, de esta forma ella se gana la vida honradamente. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas y camisetas. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta la unidad del grupo. Su sueño es que nunca les falte nada a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The members of "Grupo de Crédito Alfa" meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, Manabí's capital, that has been known for many years as the city of "los Reales Tamarindos".  María lives in this city.  She is 32 years old, separated and has 2 children from that relationship.  Her children are 8 and 4 years old and both are currently studying in school.  

María is a woman that has had to work hard in order to provide for the basic needs of her children.  For the past year she has made a living selling cloth.  She sells all kinds of clothing and does so by going door to door.  Every day she starts working after dropping off her children in school.  She gives credit to her customers and collects from them every 15 days.  Her sales are very good as she has a good clientele that are always ordering items from her when she travels to Guayaquil to purchase merchandise.  In this way María is able to earn an honest living.  

María will use this loan to purchase merchandise such as: pants, shirts and t-shirts.  She has been in "Grupo de Crédito Alfa" for 2 cycles and likes the unity of the group.  María's dream is that her little ones never lack anything.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts and t-shirts

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells bags, paper bags, caps, and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

Milton describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of bags, caps, and other items. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level.

This is Milton's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bags, caps, and other items.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 49-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Nusrat ’s son who is a professional driver who provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional.

Nusrat has applied for a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

Nusrat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Day by day increasing expenditures compelled Rukhsana to initiate her own business selling animals. She is a 34-year-old married woman with 4 children. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She works very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

She has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase goats and calves. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase  goats and calves.

loans.name: Ansar

texts.en:
Ansar is a 56-year-old married woman with 3 children. Her son is shown in the photo. She is a vigorous lady who has operated a fabric business for many years. She buys cloth in various fabrics, colors, and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

She requests 30,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Ansar expects an increase in her earnings and she plans to spend part of her profits to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 49 years old, a married woman and a mother of four children. She and her husband(also shown in the photo) have been selling animals for some years. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

In order to purchase small animals such as goats and calves, Robina has applied for a murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR. This would help her to increase their sales, which ultimately would help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase small animals such as goats and calves.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees for the kids.

For two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and opening a retail shop in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of KES 50,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes as well as bedsheets for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and bedsheets for resale.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La socia Feliciana continúa dedicándose a la crianza y venta de animales. Ella está saliendo adelante y sigue luchando para cumplir su meta de tener un local propio donde vender sus animales.la socia por eso quiere incrementar el número de animales para poderlos vender por fiesta de fin de año.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.
Feliciana esta agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito otorgado y asegura que pagara sus cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Bank member Feliciana continues to work at her business of raising and selling animals. She is making a living and is working hard to reach her goal of having her own spot to sell her animals. For this reason she would like to increase the number of animals so she can sell them for the end of the year festivities. 

The member is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and hens. 

Feliciana is thankful for the KIVA investors and for the loan she received. She promises to make her payments according to the set schedule.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Nurmah

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Nurmah, one of Ruma's agents. She lives with her husband and her two sons in South Tangerang, a sub-urban area located around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.

As a housewife, Nurmah realized that she has to help her husband increase their income for their children's education, so she is becoming an agent for Ruma. Right now she is selling mobile airtime credits to her community. Nurmah is sure she will succeed at being an agent for Ruma because she has a kind and friendly personality.

As the demand for transactions increases, Nurmah is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credit, especially on the weekends, where the demand is usually high.

Nurmah is the one who is seen in the photo. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 28-year-old single woman shown in the photo with her mother. She is had a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. She has become very famous in her community. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a variety of cosmetics products.

She has applied for 45,000 PKR to buy hair care and skin products to service more customers. She will use the profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care and skin products.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Abla est une femme mariée avec trois enfants à charge. Abla vit à Baguida et est une revendeus de pagnes qu’elle s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et de quartier en quartier. Abla sollicite ce crédit pour commander des pièces de pagnes en vue de bien revendre puis avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et à couvrir certaines charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Aged 33, Abla is a married woman raising three children. She lives in Baguida and resells lengths of African print cloth (pagnes) that she buys five times a month at the market. She resells them out of her home and on foot from one district to another.

Abla is asking for this loan to place an order for some lengths of cloth so as to have a larger stock and maximize her profit so that she can help her husband with the education of their children and cover certain daily expenses for the family.

loans.use: to buy three lengths of African print cloth.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Maryam is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Maryam would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Maryam will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Maryam now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakila is a 31-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Shakila ’s husband, a professional driver who provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance.

Shakila has applied for a Murabaha loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

Shakila is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Grupo Los Globos Group

texts.es:
En cierta comunidad de Oaxaca es temporada de zafra (corte y proceso de la caña de azúcar) y se puede observar a los campesinos recorrer el territorio hasta llegar a la fábrica donde un enorme silbato anuncia el cambio de turno. El olor de la caña quemada se puede percibir por todo el ambiente y desde las 5 de la mañana toda la comunidad se pone en movimiento para cumplir con sus actividades. La zafra es, pues, una manera de identificarse y por eso se consideran privilegiados de pertenecer a una zona cañera.
   En un lugar rodeado por sembradíos de caña y potreros se integró el grupo Los Globos cuyo nombre hace referencia a un negocio local. Los integrantes son: Graciela quien vende tacos y comida típica; Adriana y Marilu, calzado por catálogo; Odulia, carne; Natalia, servicio de taxi; Dulce y Juan, ropa; Azucena, abarrotes y comida; Nieves M., cosméticos; Nieves B., artículos de recamara y Carolina, lencería. 
   Doña Graciela es conocida por todos como “Chela”, tiene un carácter amigable que comparte con cualquier persona que conoce. Proviene de una familia de comerciantes donde sus tíos se dedican a la panadería y su madre vendió durante más de 30 años comida típica en la comunidad. Siguiendo el ejemplo familiar comenzó con la venta de comida típica, en un inicio sólo para invertir su tiempo libre, después, la demanda de sus clientes aumentó  y pasó de vender en su cocina a establecer un negocio en el exterior de su hogar. “Lo que empecé como un juego es ahora mi más grande logro” comentó contenta. Asimismo las ganancias le permitieron construir un techo de lámina para protegerse del sol y en ocasiones de la lluvia.
    Algo que le da mucho gusto es poder brindar empleo a tres personas que le ayudan sobre todo a la preparación de almuerzos para los alumnos de una primaria cercana. Por otro lado, los fines de semana prepara tacos de distintos ingredientes y sus hijos le ayudan a entregar los pedidos a domicilio. “Lo que más me gusta es la convivencia con el cliente, verlos contentos mientras disfrutan de mis platillos” expresó Chela  quien atribuye el éxito de su negocio a su peculiar sazón y trato al cliente.
   El préstamo le servirá para  invertir en carne, tortillas, verdura, chiles, platos y refresco pues con el inicio de la zafra sus ventas aumentan.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el exterior de la tienda de Doña Azucena, Chela viste blusa color azul.
texts.en:
In a certain community of Oaxaca, it is sugar harvest season, when the sugarcane is cut and harvested.  The smell of burned sugarcane is in the air and the whole community is in motion by 5 in the morning to carry out its activities.  The sugar harvest is a part of the community identity, and so the residents consider themselves privileged to come from a sugar region.  The Los Globos group, whose name refers to a local business, was formed In a place surrounded by sugarcane plants and pastureland.  The members are: Graciela, who sells tacos and local food, Adriana and Marilu, footwear from catalogs, Odulia, meat, Natalia, taxi service, Dulce and Juan, clothing, Azucena, groceries and food, Nieves M., cosmetics, Nieves B., home goods, and Carolina, lingerie.  

Graciela, known to everyone as "Chela", has a friendly character and shares with any person that she knows.  She belongs to a family of merchants.  Her uncles made a living at a bakery and her mother sold local food in the community for more than 30 years.  Following the family example, she started selling local food.  In the beginning she only wanted to make an investment of her free time, but later, as the demand from her customers increased, she went from selling out of her kitchen to establishing a business outside of her home.  "I started it for fun and now it's my biggest accomplishment," she happily comments.  Also, the profits allowed her to build a sheet metal roof to protect herself from the sun and occasionally the rain.  

One thing that gives her a lot of joy is being able to provide employment for three people who help her, mostly with the preparation of lunches for students from a nearby primary school.  She also makes tacos from various ingredients on the weekend and her children help her deliver the orders to homes.  "What I like the most is the fellowship with my customers, to see them happy while they enjoy my food," says Chela, who attributes the success of her business to her distinct seasoning and customer service.  

The loan will allow her to buy meat, tortillas, vegetables, chiles, plates, and soft drinks, since her sales go up with the beginning of the sugar harvest season.

*This photo was taken outside of Azucena's store.  Chela is wearing a blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy meat, tortillas, vegetables, chiles, disposable plates, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Marjorie Liliana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive la señora Marjorie, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores  de edad, una hija aun vive en su casa actualmente.  Su esposo es profesor.
Marjorie es una mujer  muy luchadora que le gusta ganar sus propios ingresos haciendo algo que a ella le encanta como es la cocina, ella prepara deliciosos almuerzos para entregar, antes tenía un restaurante pero los gastos de arriendos eran muchos así que mejor decidió cerrarlo y vender desde su casa a domicilio,  ella tiene muchos clientes a quienes les lleva los almuerzos ya sea a domicilio o a sus respectivos lugares de trabajo, de esta forma ella logra ganar sus recursos que les ayudan a salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres, tarrinas y embases para entregar los almuerzos. Lleva  dos  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for years as the city of Reales Tamarindos, the partners of Grupo de Crédito Alfa meet every fifteen days. This is where Marjorie lives. She is 53 years old, married and from this relationship has three adult children; currently one daughter still lives at home. Her husband is a professor.

Marjorie is a very strong woman who likes to earn her own income doing something she loves as is cooking. She prepares delicious lunches to deliver. Before, she had a restaurant, but the rental expenses were so high she decided it was better to close it and sell from her home to other homes. She has many clients to whom she brings lunches either to their home or to their respective workplaces. In this way she manages to earn resources that help them get ahead.

She is going to use this loan to buy food, containers, and jars to deliver the lunches. She has been with Grupo de Crédito for two years and she likes it due to the help they give her with the loans. Her dream is to continue going forward.

loans.use: buy food, containers, and jars.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg sends his warmest greetings to Kiva lenders and hopes that he will acquire his third Kiva loan.

He lives in the village Gugark in the Lori region, with his wife. They have three married daughters who live with their families.

Gevorg runs a shoe-repair and shoe making business in a rented stall near a Vanadzor wholesale market. He is a master in his work and his professional and quick work has keep his customer base high.

He will use the 300.000 Armenian drams to buy materials to make winter boots. He will buy leather, shoe soles, and new stylish shoes forms to renew the assortment of shoes in his inventory.

loans.use: to buy leather, shoe soles, and new stylish shoe forms to renew the assortment of shoes for his customers.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 54-year-old widow, shown in the photo with her son. He is a professional driver and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family.

He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and consumes too much oil. Jamila requests a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR for her son to buy a new engine.

Jamila is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van to provide better services.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Abdul. Abdul is one of the Ruma agents who live in South Tangerang, a suburban area located around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married, and he and his wife have been blessed with one son and one daughter.

As the head of the family, his main source of income comes from selling mobile airtime credits to members of his community. He joined Ruma because he wanted to learn more about increasing his income, as well as contributing more to his community.

As the business runs, Abdul hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile airtime credits, especially on the weekends. In the near future, Abdul plans to add more products from Ruma to his list of services, such as e-commerce for low-income communities. Abdul is the one who is seen in the photo, together with his wife. He feels thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, which needs access to such a service.

loans.name: Shamama

texts.en:
Shamama lives in the Baku region with her family. They are IDP (internally displaced persons) from Füzuli City. She is 46 years old, has two children, and works as a cleaner. Her daughter is studying her first course of college and her son is a soldier. She is widow and she must take care of her children. Shamama is thankful for Komak and Kiva for helping.

Currently, she needs her first loan in the amount of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat), so that she can plan to supply her business. She wants to buy a vacuum cleaner, sponge, washing board, broom, and other cleaning tools. She is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for the help.

loans.use: to buy a vacuum cleaner, sponge, washing board, broom, and other cleaning tools.

loans.name: Zakiya

texts.en:
Zakiya is a 39-year-old single lady who has been working as a tutor for two years to make her living.

She used to work in a sweets selling shop but she decided to stay at home to take care of her old mother and make her living from providing tutoring services to her neighbors' children.

Zakiya's income is set for her family's daily living expenses, but unfortunately she can't pay any extra unexpected requested needs.

Today, Zakiya is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for an urgent surgery she has to do for her mother.

She hopes to stay capable of taking care of her mother and making their living.

loans.use: to pay for an urgent surgery she has to do for her mother.

loans.name: Consuelo Cecilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Alfa.
En este lugar vive  la señora Consuelo, tiene 29 años  de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, el cual estudia en escuela, ella vive en casa de los padres. 
Consuelo es una mujer muy trabajadora que le ha tocado trabajar duro para que a su hijo no le falte nada,  para esto ella adecuo un local en la casa de sus padres donde vende comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, papas fritas, colas, jugos, entre otros alimentos, ella también  en las mañanas sale a vender ropa de todos tipo por la localidad y también tiene una vitrina en su local donde muestra la mercadería que tiene, así sus clientes pueden ver y comprar en su local, lleva 4 años con esta actividad la cual le deja lo necesario para que a sui hijo no le falte nada.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para la preparación de los alimentos y ropa de todo género. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda para ella. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The members of the Alfa Credit Group meet every fifteen days In the city of Portoviejo,  the capital of Manabí known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind trees.

It is also the residence of Consuelo, a 29-year-old single mother of a 5-year-old who is studying in school.  She lives in her parents' home.  Consuelo is a very hard-working woman who works hard so that her child has everything he needs.  Towards that aim, she remodeled a place in her parents' home where she sells fast food such as hamburgers, french fries, soda, juice, among other foods.  She also goes out to sell all types of clothing in the morning around the area and also has a window in her store where she displays her merchandise so her customers can see what she has and buy it in her store.  She has been doing this business for 4 years and it provides her with what is necessary to see that her child lacks for nothing.  

She will use this loan to buy ingredients to make food and all types of clothing.  She has been a member the credit group for two years and she likes it because the loans are fast and very helpful to her.  Her dream is to give her son the best.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients and clothing.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna lives with her beloved husband in the city of Vanadzor of the Lori region. They have a son who lives abroad. Zhanna works at a private workshop as a tailor. Her husband is also employed and he is a computer operator. Zhanna mentions that the flat where her family lives has not been repaired for many years and especially during winter period, with the wooden old windows and with the absence of a heating system, the colds seem to be endless and winter months pass very slowly. 

Now she greatly hopes that Kiva lenders will help her with a loan to solve this problem. This loan of 400,000 Armenian drams she will use for buying a heating boiler and of course she will finally settle the heating system in her flat.

loans.use: to buy a heating boiler and of course she will finally settle the heating system in her flat

loans.name: Masika Group

texts.fr: Après la mort de l'époux de Françoise, la famille l'a aidé avec un montant de cent dollars qu'elle a investi dans la vente de souliers acheté en gros à kampala. Aujourd'hui grâce à cette activité, elle a pu s'acheter une parcelle et y construire une maison. Comme difficulté, elle se plaint de tracasseries douanières. Elle aimerait ouvrir un magasin en ville dans un endroit stratégique, au lieu de transporter chaque jour ses marchandises de la maison jusqu'au marché. Elle souhaite également améliorer ses conditions de vie. Sur photo, Françoise porte une robe rouge-blanche.
texts.en: After Françoise’s husband died, her family helped her with the sum of $100, which she invested in shoes to sell. She bought the shoes wholesale in Kampala. Today, thanks to this business, she was able to purchase a parcel of land and build a house on it. As for difficulties, she complains of red tape at customs control. She would like to open a store in town in a strategic location instead of transporting her merchandise every day from the house to the market. She would also like to improve her living conditions. In the photo, Françoise is the one wearing a red and white dress.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
In Vanadzor city of the Lori region lives Gagik, with his wife and two children (the elder is a student and the smallest is school-aged). Gagik has higher education with a specialty of architecture, but he works not of his profession; he sells jewelry in Vanadzor’s jewelry market at the rented stall. He sells rings, bracelets, and earrings. He also sells crosses and medallions, which he buys from the local jewelers in the city of Yerevan. One of his business challenges is seasonality. For example, there are fewer weddings at the end of autumn and more during the New Year’s holidays. So there are periods when he has very little income from his business.  

Gagik has been in this business for 7 years already and he is rather popular with the nice and stylish jewelry on his stall. So with great hope of having more sales near to the New Year’s period he asks for this loan in order to buy a new, fashionable, and elegant assortment of jewelry and attract a lot of customers for purchases.

loans.use: to buy a new, fashionable, and elegant assortment of jewelry and attract a lot of customers for purchases

loans.name: Aya Shwayt Group

texts.en:
Nahed is the featured borrower for Aya Shwayt Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and live at the same time.

Nahed is a 44-year-old, married mother of three. She started, two years ago, selling cosmetics and prepaid mobile cards to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business by adding a clothes section to satisfy her customers in the upcoming Christmas season. Nahed is the lady sitting in the middle.

With respect to the other group members, Nada is the first lady on the right, and Rayan is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to develop her business by adding a clothes section to satisfy her customers in the upcoming Christmas season

loans.name: Janeth Mariuxi

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Cristo Rey, esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Janeth, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 23, 21, 17 y 8  años de edad, la menor estudia en una escuela de la localidad y es la que aun vive con ella. El marido es mecánico. 
Janeth es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganarse sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su marido a salir adelante, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos, ropa de todo tipo, productos Yanbal, Avon, (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas),  entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale todos los días  a vender y cobrar sus productos ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, ella  también le da parte del crédito a su marido el cual lo necesita para comprar ciertas cosas que necesita en su taller para realizar sus trabajos en los carros que el repara, ella lleva más de 10 años con sus ventas.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, ropa, zapatos, perfumes y repuestos que necesita el esposo en su taller de carros. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The credit group Cristo Rey (Christ is King) meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto, known for its traditional culture and also for being only a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, which are San Jacinto and San Clemente. 

This is where Janeth lives. She is 40 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has four children that are 23, 21, 17 and 8 years old. The youngest goes to the local school and is the only one who still lives with her. Her husband is a mechanic. 

Janeth is a woman who likes to stand on her own and earn her own income so that she can help her husband support the household. For this reason she works selling things such as shoes, clothing of all kinds, Yanbal and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women), among other things. She sells her wares door to door, and goes out every day to collect payments and sell her products. She leaves the products with customers on credit and lets them pay in installments each week. She will share a part of this loan with her husband, so he can buy certain things he needs in his workshop to work on the cars he repairs. She has been selling products for over 10 years. 

This loan will be used to buy sheets, clothes, shoes, perfumes and spare parts her husband needs in his car shop. She has been in this credit group for 10 years and likes it because it allowed her to start her business. Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy sheets, clothes, shoes, perfumes and spare car parts.

loans.name: Gloria Betty

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Cristo Rey, esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Gloria tiene 65  años de edad, está separada, y de esa relación  tiene 4 hijos mayores  de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa.
