Gloria es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar sus propios ingresos para no depender de nadie, ella tiene un negocio en su casa, ella vende plátano, carne, pollos ya sea enteros o por libras y en ocasiones también vende camarón, de esta forma ella logra ganar sus propios recursos que le sirven para salir adelante, trabaja todos los días y hace mas de 16 años que lleva con este negocio que comenzó gracias al crédito que recibió del grupo, ella desde aquel día le cambio su vida y esto fue gracias a los créditos.
Este crédito es para comprar carne, pollos y plátano que es lo que con más frecuencia vende. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y está muy agradecida con los créditos. Sus sueños es tener buena salud y seguir recibiendo el apoyo de los créditos.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto the Grupo De Crédito Cristo Rey meets every fifteen days. This town is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Gloria lives. She is 65 years old, separated, and from that relationship she has 4 adult children; two of them still live at home.

Gloria is a woman who likes to take care of herself and earn her own income so as not to have to depend on anyone. She has a business at home; she sells plantains, beef, and chickens either whole or by the pound, and sometimes she also sells shrimp. In this way she manages to earn her own income which helps her go forward. She works every day, and it has been more than 16 years that she has had this business, which she began thanks to the loan that she received from the group. From that day on it changed her life and this was thanks to the loans.

This loan is to buy beef, chickens, and plantains, which is what sells with the most frequency. She is a founding member of the Grupo De Crédito and is very grateful for the loans. Her dream is to have good health and to continue receiving the support of the loans.

loans.use: buy beef, chickens, and plantains.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending and raising livestock.

Lourdes dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gul

texts.en:
Gul is a 53-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family.

Gul's husband wants to change the van's tires. That is why Gul has taken a murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband to buy new tires along with some spare parts to provide better facilities to the customers. Gul is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with some spare parts to provide better facilities to the customers.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 71 ans, Kossiwa est une femme qui vit à Baguida avec trois enfants à sa charge, Kossiwa est une revendeuse des objets en plastiques. Kossiwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Kossiwa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de sceaux en plastiques, des sachets de cinq francs et des unités de sachets « Bafana » en vue de satisfaire parfaitement les attentes de ses clients et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à bien leur prendre en charge leurs besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
A widow of 71, Kossiwa is a woman who lives in Baguida and is responsible for three children. She sells plastic objects. She stocks up twice a month at the market and resells her merchandise in front of her home.

Kossiwa is requesting this loan to order several dozens of plastic buckets, some bags for 5 francs, and some Bafana bags so as to satisfy the expectations of her customers and make a good profit margin. She wants to help her children with their education and cover their daily needs appropriately.

loans.use: to buy three dozen plastic buckets, three dozen bags at 5 francs, and 120 Bafana bags.

loans.name: Naseema

texts.en:
Naseema is a 61-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her son. He is a driver by profession. He is expert in driving vans and makes enough income through his business. He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. 

That is why Naseema  has availed herself a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR for her son to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers. Naseema is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra, 31 years old, is a married woman with three children. Her husband is shown in the photo. He provides painting services in his locality and earns sufficient income to meet the family's expenses.

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Bushra has sought a Murabaha loan of 10,000 PKR  to purchase buckets of paint in different colors, along with good quality paint brushes to cater to the maximum number of customers to increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase buckets of paint in different colors, along with good quality paint brushes to cater to the maximum number of customers to increase their income

loans.name: Vaelua

texts.en:
Vaelua is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy pork meat, bag of flour, yeast, cooking oil, containers, etc.

In the future, Vaelua hopes to extend her business and to start a bakery. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy pork meat, bag of flour, yeast, cooking oil,containers, etc.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a resident of Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with five children; they are 19, 17, 16, 14 and 11 years old. Fe has always been dreaming of a business improvement for her children’s education. She wants them all to finish their studies and become professionals in the future.

So, she decided to raise pigs to augment their livelihood. And she has been doing this business for eight years. But her problem is to sustain their feed. That is why she is asking for a loan; she will buy feed and vaccines for her piglets. Aside from this, she will also buy an additional sow (pig). In this way, she will be able to enhance her sales and improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her piglets; she will also buy an additional sow (pig).

loans.name: Estrelieta

texts.en:
Estrelieta is a 34-year-old woman who lives in the city Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has four children. Her oldest child is 14 years old while her youngest child is two years old. Estrelieta is so happy to have her family even if she married early. Her children are her inspiration to go on and continue believing that in the future they can have a better means of living. 

To help her husband augment their livelihood she started her own business. She has a hog raising business. She has been doing this for a couple of months. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs. In this way, she will be able to sustain her pigs consumption and able to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Diokling

texts.en:
Diokling is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. He is a married man and supports his family by doing a hog-raising business. He has been doing this for three years.

Diokling is 44 years old and plans to improve his business for sustainability. He dreams of having children in the future and giving them better lives. With this, he is asking for a loan to buy feed for his pigs. In this way, he will be able to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
A tan solo 20 minutos de “La novia del sol”, entre sembradíos de caña de azúcar y árboles de mango, se encuentra una comunidad donde aún se pueden apreciar rasgos de la cultura mazateca. La mayoría de los adultos mayores hablan alguna variante de dicha lengua originaria asentada en el ahora estado de Veracruz. En la comunidad se integró un grupo llamado Manantial debido a que con este nombre identifican su lugar de origen. Los integrantes son: Juana quien vende artículos de plata y maneja una estética; Anai, pollo; Georgina, cosméticos; Sebastián, caña de azúcar; Eva, ropa; Rosa, papelería y fotografía, y Rubicela junto con Gabriela, comida típica.
   Juana  es una mujer muy carismática y centrada, “la necesidad económica y el deseo de brindar lo mejor a mi familia me motivó para iniciar mi negocio” comenta.  Desde hace ocho años se ha dedicado a la venta de artículos de plata de manera ambulante. De igual forma expresa, “me encanta lo relacionado con la belleza” ya que brinda servicios de estilismo a domicilio; de tal manera que combina sus actividades pues después de realizar un corte o peinado ofrece sus productos de plata. Para lograr el éxito que tiene como estilista realizó estudios en una escuela de belleza y, adicionalmente, su amabilidad hizo que los clientes la recomendaran a más gente. Las ganancias obtenidas le han permitido comenzar una nueva actividad junto con su esposo, además de realizar remodelaciones a su hogar.
   Para Juana lo más importante de sus actividades es el trato con las personas pues le satisface y alienta saber que dejó satisfecho a un cliente. Para lograrlo ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar anillos, aretes, pulseras, tintes, peróxido, spray, pasadores y peines para invertir en ambas actividades. Finalmente comenta, “estoy feliz por la gran familia que tengo y por conocer a gente que confía en nosotros, Dios los bendiga”.

*La fotografía fue tomada en un antiguo pozo, Doña Juana es quien viste blusa color rosa y falda blanca, su pequeño hijo está junto a ella.
texts.en:
Only 20 minutes from "La Novia del Sol" ("the Bride of the Sun"), among sugarcane plants and mango trees, you can find a community where you can still appreciate the roots of the Mazatec culture.  Most of the older adults speak some variety of the language originating from the area now known as Veracruz. 
A group called Manantial, whose name identifies their place of origin, formed in this community.  The members are: Juana, who sells silver items and styles hair, Anai, chicken, Georgina, cosmetics, Sebastián, sugarcane, Eva, clothing, Rosa, stationary and photos, and Rubicela with Gabriela, local food.  

Juana is a very charismatic and centered woman.  "The economic necessity and desire to provide the best for my family motivated me to start my business," she says.  She has been making a living selling silver items on foot for eight years.  She also provides hair styling services in people's homes since, as she puts it, "I like everything related to beauty."  This allows her to combine her business activities, since after doing a cut or a brushing, she offers her silver items.  In order to achieve the success that she has had as a stylist, she went to beauty school, and her friendliness also made her customers want to recommend her to more people.  The profits that she has gained have allowed her to start a new business with her husband and remodel her home.  

For Juana, the most important thing in her business is customer service, since it nourishes and satisfies her to leave her customers satisfied.  She has requested a new loan to buy rings, earrings, bracelets, dyes, peroxide, hairspray, clips, and combs to invest in both of her businesses.  Finally, she comments, "I am happy for the big family that I have and to know people who believe in us.  God bless you."

*This photo was taken in an old well.  Juana is wearing a pink shirt and a white skirt, with her little son by her side.

loans.use: to buy rings, earrings, bracelets, dyes, peroxide, hairspray, clips, and combs.

location.town: LOC LOMA MANANTIAL, TIERRA BLANVA VERACRUZ

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is a 48-year-old married woman from Clarin, Bohol. She is a mother of three children who are the center of her life. Their age is 20, 18 and 15 years old. With this, she and her husband are working hard to provide and give the best for their children. Her husband works hard as a mason while Wilma sells fish to the community to earn and support the needs of their children. She has been doing this business for ten years and hoping to improve this business. Wilma is in need of a loan for additional capital to buy more fish to sell. In this way, it will help them increase their earnings and augment their profit.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 52 years old and married with seven children.

Estela works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Estela has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Estela aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emilly's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Emilly, who, as group leader, is representing her group formed by nine farmers in Teso District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to two children. She is known by her community as a very experienced farmer.

Initially, Emilly joined One Acre Fund in 2012 because she wanted to earn enough to send her children to school. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Emilly plans to send her children to school.

Between the nine farmers in Emilly's Group, a total of 6.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive one solar light.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her harvest of maize

loans.name: Dukanguke Group

texts.en:
Fortunee is a 54-year-old married woman with three children. She has operated a beans business for seven years. She works everyday from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. While the work is tough and the hours are long, Fortunee is committed to her business so that her children may prosper. She is the president of DUKANGUKE group and she shown in the photo holding a book.

Fortunee has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of beans to sell.

She will use the loan to earn more profits, reinvest for better financial stability, pay her children's school fees, pay medical insurance and buy new clothes for her children.

Fortunee hopes to earn enough money to buy a general store.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of beans to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 59 years old, married with five adult age children from Pagadian City. She is engaged in direct reselling business of various cosmetics, fragrances, plastic wares and others for eight years and is making good sales out from it. Her business is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC where is an active member since 20015. Recently, she avails a loan to purchase additional stocks of inventories for direct resell.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of cosmetics, frangrances, plastic wares etc for direct resale

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Bryan Alejandro

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  21 De Julio.
En este lugar el señor Bryan, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de los padres, el espera en este año ingresar a la universidad y seguir con sus estudios. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para seguir adelante.
Bryan es una joven que le gusta trabajar para así labrarse un futuro mejor, es por eso que él se dedica al comercio actividad que aprendió de su papá desde niño, el vende pescado ya sea por libras o pescado pequeño, tiene un puesto en el mercado local en el cual desde hace ya 7 años se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite salir delante de una forma honrada. 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado para sus ventas. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The "21st of July" Credit Group meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.

Bryan resides here. He is 19 years old, single, and lives in his parents' house. Bryan hopes to enter the university this year and continue his studies. He is in his third loan cycle with this Credit Group and likes it for the aid it offers, especially for the loans to forge ahead.

Bryan is a young man who enjoys working. He hopes to continue laboring for a better future. That's why he is dedicated to commerce, an activity he has learned for his father since childhood. Bryan sells fish, either large fish by the pound or small fish. He has a stand in the local market where he has dedicated himself to this activity for the past seven years. This has allowed him to get ahead in an honorable way.

The loan is for purchasing fish to sell. Bryan's dreams are to complete his studies and continue to improve his life.

loans.use: buy fish to sell at his market stall.

loans.name: Darwin Javier

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  21 De Julio.
En este lugar vive don Darwin, tiene 37 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad, el cual estudia en escuela. Su esposa es odontóloga.
Darwin es un hombre muy responsable que trabaja para que a su familia no les falte nada, el tiene un taxi en el cual labora todos los días realizando transporte de un lugar a otro de la ciudad, el utiliza los créditos para realizar mejoras en su taxi ya que es su medio de transporte el cual le deja lo necesario para vivir, lleva más de 10 años dedicado a esta profesión con su taxi por lo cual ya requiere de ciertas refacciones y con eso también brindar un mejor servicio.
Este crédito es para comprar llantas y hacer arreglos en el taxi. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños es comprar un taxi nuevo.
texts.en:
Darwin lives in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has long been known as the CIty of Royal Tamarinds. He is 37 years old, married, and has an eight-year-old little boy from this relationship.

Darwin is a very responsible man. In order to provide the best for his family, he works driving his taxi, traveling through town from one place to another. He uses his loans to make repairs on his taxi, because his vehicle is his means of making a living. He has been driving his taxi for ten years, so certain parts need to be replaced in order for him to provide a better service.

He will use this loan to buy tires and repair his taxi. He has been with his communal bank for five cycles, and enjoys being a member because the loans are fast. His dream is to buy a new taxi one day.

loans.use: to buy tires and repair his taxi.

loans.name: Ma. Ardenita

texts.en:
Ma. Ardenita is 45 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Ardenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like bread, biscuits, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Ma. Ardenita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Ma. Ardenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like bread, biscuits, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зульфия успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто откликнулся и помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Зульфии есть 8 коров, лошадь, на 2,50 Га земли она выращивает люцерну и пшеницу. Ежедневно Зульфия сдает молоко молокозаводу- около 20 литров в день. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 22,000 сом (KGS). Зульфия вновь обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Она намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en:
Zulfiya has successfully repaid her loan, having used the funds as specified. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who responded and helped her with financing. Zulfiya's farm has eight cows, a horse, and on 2.50 hectares of land she cultivates alfalfa and wheat. Zulfiya delivers milk to a dairy daily - about 20 litres a day. The monthly income from the business is about 22,000 som (KGS). 

Zulfiya is again applying to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) in order to buy a cow. She intends to expand her business, that will certainly lead to increasing her family's capital.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: Chanthou’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chanthou makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter that will provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is 52 years old and living in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He owns a shop in which he sales beauty products. His income is for household expenses as he is the only breadwinner for the family. He always tries to establish his business through offering the latest cosmetic products. Nowadays, some new cosmetic product ranges, which are very demanding and expensive as well, have been introduced in the market.

Asif has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. He will inject the money into his business so that he can buy the latest cosmetic products, such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kit, lipstick, nail polish, etc., and increase his profits. He hopes that through this amount he will be able to enhance his business and will be able to return it on time. Asif is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in his cosmetic shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ali has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ali would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Ali can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Ali will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Ali is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Marie Claire is a 50-year-old woman. She is married with two children aged 12 and 16 years old. Marie Claire was elected to become president of the group Abishyizehamwe. She can be found (in the picture) on the second right at the back wearing a red dress and holding a book.

She operates a food stall business and has requested for Kiva loan in order to expand her business by buying more food items such as potatoes, maize, bananas, onions, tomatoes and beans. With the profits that she will get after expanding her business, she will be able to continue paying school fees for her children and buy enough food for her family. 

She also hopes in five years she will be able to renovate her house so that she will be able to have better shelter, most especially for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more food products such as potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a Babban Gona Farmers Organization maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Salisu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Salisu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Salisu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% above the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to USD 2,000 per hectare of land, Salisu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and he would like to use this additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a repeat client to Ugafode Microfinance. She previously applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX. She is a married woman with four children. She is a businesswoman and tailor and she is a hardworking lady. In a bid to increase on her working capital she has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy another sewing machine. She is however faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital to boost her business. She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.

Pictured is Harriet (seated behind the sewing machine and the Ugafode Credit staff).

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  21 De Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es taxista.
Mariana es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con sus ingresos ir mejorando su hogar, ella   tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende productos   como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, frutas y legumbres carnes, pescado, entre otras cosas, allí sus clientes consiguen de todo, esa es la razón por lo cual cuenta con muy buena clientela que la han preferido en estos 38 años que lleva en este negocio  con el cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, cosas de bazar, entre otros productos. Lleva más de 10  años en el  Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para su negocio. Sus sueños darle lo mejor a su familia
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank 21 De Julio meet every two weeks in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has long been known as the City of Royal Tamarinds. This is where Mariana lives. She is 57 years old, married, and has three adult children who all live on their own. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Mariana has always been an independent woman. She makes her own income in order to make a living and improve her home little by little. She has a small grocery store set up at home where she sells products like rice, sugar, oil, fruits and vegetables, meat, fish, detergents, and other items. Her customers can find everything at her store, which is why she has a great customer base of people who have been coming to her business for the past 38 years.

She will use this loan to stock up on more products for her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, and also novelty items. She has been with her communal bank for over ten years and enjoys it because the loans are of great help for her business. Her goal is to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, novelty items, etc.

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en: Neng’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Neng makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. She has one youngest child in her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both of these women and a man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Tsalha

texts.en:
Tsalha is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Tsalha is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Tsalha would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Tsalha will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land, Tsalha now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ion

texts.en:
Ion is a land engineer from Cornesti, in the Ungheni region of Moldova. He is 61 years old.

As an engineer, he has worked for 14 years, but agriculture has always been his biggest passion. That’s why Ion grows grapevines and produces about 1,500 liters of wine every year. Also, he deals in wood-working, making barrels for wine.

The sale of wine and barrels gives him a lot of satisfaction and it’s a good addition to the family income. To sell wine in a more enjoyable atmosphere, Ion dreams to build a wine cellar in his village.

This loan will help Ion to realize his dream to become the first cellar owner in the village.

loans.use: to construct a wine cellar.

loans.name: Lesbia Patricia

texts.es: Lesbia Patricia, de treinta y dos años de edad, casada, y tiene tres hijos,  se dedica a la venta de medicina Natural,y a la venta de cosmeticos. en el mercado Municipal, también  en su puesto vende comida tres veces a la semana, solo en el almuerzo, su negocio está desde hace cinco años, el negocio lo inicio lo inicio su mama  solo con venta de comida, y heredo su puesto, esta feliz porque su negocio a progresado tiene clientes  fieles, este es su tercer crédito kiva, y espera poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos y a su esposo, para los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lesbia Patricia is 32 years old, married, and has three children.

She works selling natural medicine and cosmetics in the municipal market. She also sells food in her stall three times a week, just at lunch. She has had her business for five years. Her mother started the business alone with the sale of food. She inherited the stall. She is happy because her business has progressed through loyal customers.

This is her third Kiva loan. She hopes to be able to continue supporting her children and her husband, and to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 40-year-old married mother of three. In 2003 she decided to establish her own perfume sales business to support her husband, who's working abroad to provide his family with the necessities of life.

Safaa is a hard working businesswoman who is putting forth a great effort to develop her business through increasing its capital with diversified products that attract customers' attention and increase her sales.

Safaa is developing her business properly, but sometimes she needs external financial support to buy certain occasional items she is not ready for. That's why, and since the Holy Christmas season is soon, Safaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas gifts and newly released cosmetics.

She hopes to stay capable of developing her business as much as she can in a well-managed way.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas gifts and newly released cosmetics

loans.name: Gs Brisas Del Rio 1 Group

texts.es:
Doña Darcis Ermicenda es una señora con más de 30 años ella vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, Doña Darcis Ermicenda,   se dedica desde hace 5 años, a la LA ELABORACIÓN Y VENTA DE TORTILLAS, ejerce otras actividades comerciales como la elaboración y venta de nacatamales, los fines de semana Doña , Darcis Ermicenda  la mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos  de su colonia, y personas que transitan para otros barrios 
Doña, Darcis Ermicenda necesita el crédito para la compra de maíz, cal, leña etc.  Con el préstamo espera ampliar su negocio para  satisfacer la demanda  de sus clientes,  Doña Darcis Ermicenda,   es su cuarto crédito con prisma y Kiva  espera seguir contando con el apoyo para seguir obteniendo su materia prima para la elaboración de sus tortillas 
Su sueño es comprarse una máquina de hacer tortillas, y que sus hijos estudien 

Doña Darcis solicita el credito de forma grupal con las siguientes personas: Wilmer Alexis tiene su negocio VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS  desde hace 3 años, actividad que realiza en el municipio donde vive, la cual le está generando grandes ingresos ya que su ventas la realiza ambulante. 
Rosa Amelia su negocio es la VENTA  Y ELABORACIÓN DE TORTILLAS el cual forma la mayor  parte de sus ingresos, ella realiza  esta actividad es desde hace 3 años, donde la mayoría de sus clientes  son personas que residen en la colonia donde vive a las que les entrega tortillas a diario

Todos los integrante del grupo son persona comerciante, Responsable y  Honorable, el financiamiento lo necesitan para surtir su negocio, no cuenta con capital de trabajo
Choluteca, Honduras –  Octubre   del 2015
texts.en:
Mrs. Darcis Ermicenda is a woman in her thirties who lives with her husband and three children. She has worked for the past five years in the preparation and sales of tortillas. She engages in other commercial activities like making and selling nacatamales, steamed corn dumplings with a savory filling, on the weekends. The majority of her customers are neighbors in her colony, and peoples that come from other neighborhoods. 

Mrs. Darcis Ermicenda needs the loan to buy corn, lime and firewood. With the loan she hopes to expand her business to meet the demand of her customers. This is her fourth loan with Prisma and Kiva. She hopes to continue receiving the support to continue to obtain the material inputs for the preparation of her tortillas. Her dream is to purchase a machine to make tortillas and that her children study.

Mrs. Darcis is requesting this group loan with the following people: Wilmer Alexis has his business selling fruits and vegetables for the last three years. She works in the municipality where she lives. She is getting a good income with her mobile sales. Rosa Amelia has a business making and selling tortillas, which provides the largest portion of her earnings. She has been doing this for the past three years. The majority of her customers live in the area where she lives. She sells tortillas to them daily. All the members of the group are business people, who are responsible,and honest. They need the financing to supply their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase lime, corn, and firewood for her business
